story:
HI everyone :

My name is Chiu Yi Chiang. (You can call me Grace :) )
I am a dancer also a choreographer.
I just finished my university this June.
i studied a lots of different form of dance from ballet and Contemporary  to Chinese Opera even Tai Chi.
I am super grateful that I found dance since i was 7 and I been dancing  ever seen.
I been trained in great dance academies even went to WAAPA (Western Australian Academy Of Performing Art) on a scholarship to exchange.
This year I was invited as an artist to WDAS2015 ChoreoLab. I am so lucky and blessed.
I love everything I had done so far!!!!
But I know I have a bigger dream......

After I started to grew up .... My body changed to became more like a woman.....
And ever since then..... I started to have body image Issue .
In Taiwan people has typical body image towards dancer (maybe it's a culture thing.. I haven't figured it out)
I always struggle cause I have big boobs....
It's hard for me to work as a dancer .... and to think that  people is looking at me cause I am a great dancer not just I have boobs.
It get me down and wondering all the time.

This year I was lucky to be dancing in Vienna ,dancing in EU is always the dream of mine.
It's so human so natural so much freedom for me.
People look at me cause I am a good dancer not cause I am different from others.
I feel so refilling and it reminds me why I love dance.

I tell myself I have to go back to EU again and try to get a job and start a refreshing dance life.
But sadly.... At the moment the job I got offer is a dance teacher. I love teaching kids and love offering everything I have to them.... I work long hours.... but the payment is less than an office worker . I thought of getting a normal job.... but I am not sure that is where my passion is .

SO.... today I am here.
Trying to start this campaign to get some help.
I am trying the best I can to earn some money so I can give everything I have in audition in EU  .
It would mean so much to me if this works out .
I will try whatever I have to start this new dance life.
Thank you so much and wish all the best to the people who also have a dream to be what you always wanted .

story:
Who are we? 

Hi friends! We're the Wasatch Wordsmiths, a Salt Lake City based non-profit that spreads and cultivates performance poetry throughout the valley.This year, our non-profit is supporting TWO SLC teams to get to the National Poetry Slam in Oakland, California. What's a poetry slam? A poetry slam is one of the most authentic and rowdiest places to share and experience poetry in a way that values the audience as well as the poet.  In addition to funding two teams with this money, we also put on poetry workshops throughout the Salt Lake Valley from high schools to after school programs. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the costs we are looking at to get to Oakland: 

  • Registration ($1,000)
  • Hotel Rooms for 12 people
  • Enough gasoline to get four cars all the way to Oakland! 
  • Food for us hungry poets!
In order to raise all the funds, we are willing to pay all you lovely people back in poetry! Some of our perks include personalized chapbooks, individualized poems, and Wasatch Wordsmiths merchandise. 

The Impact

Not only do we want to represent you well, but we also want to bring valuable talent and knowledge back to Salt Lake City. National competitions allow us to attend workshops, promote our scene, but most importantly, grow as an artist by listening to others' work. In order to keep Salt Lake City a thriving hub for new and impactful art, we need to constantly be learning and listening. We promise to come back from Nationals as better informed poets, with a deep appreciation for craft. This is our second year sending 2 teams to Nationals, so let's keep the momentum going! And another reminder that your money funds us to grow as artists, but also to help the Salt Lake City youth grow, as we put together school workshops and programs! 

Risks & Challenges

Fundraising our way to these national events is not easy. Each year, we must fundraise thousands of dollars to send our best poets to compete against much larger cities. It's very taxing on us emotionally, and most of us are working other jobs to support our craft. But we do this because we genuinely love poetry, and love being able to represent you with our best! The points are not the point at these competitions, the point is poetry, and we go to these competitions each year to share that with others. We thank you for all your continued support over the years. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While we rely on financial donations from people such as yourself, we also welcome support in the form of attendance, promotion, passion, and your indiegogo shares! If you don't have the funds right now to donate (we're poets, we understand empty pockets!), then please come to our slams and workshops! Like us on facebook to keep updated: https://www.facebook.com/WasatchWordsmiths?fref=ts 

Also, please support other local poetry scenes: Indie Underground, Westminster Slam, and YouSpeak Slam among others. Please spread the word online, in classes, in the community. We are nothing without you, so thank you for all your support.

story:
The Project ...

Completing a demountable 30 foot wide by 18 foot high mural that melds 
with large walls.


... The Dream of the Cow/Horse ...

We weathered the "Masterpiece" project's Manhattan beginnings in the 90's, its
Williamsburg move and gallery shows of the Naughts, and in fact grew the work
when others struggled to survive. History repeats itself, and we find ourselves
in the middle of the Bushwick scene's boom. Fortunately the Cow/Horse is now
in the position to complete its Masterpiece.

...On the Edge of Reality ...

We are now at a tipping point where your support can be a catalyst in the 

success of a new kind of self sustaining artwork that can reach a new kind

of art audience. The "Masterpiece" is a demountable 35' wide by 18' high

mural that generalizes space while using traditional ends to particularize

individuals. We're about to resolve the final challenges of the left hand side

and need help to make our vision a reality.


Budget

Painting specific material ................................ 4,500.

Mural specific supplies ..................................... 3,500.

New detail and area application systems ....... 2,500.

Project work supports ...................................... 1,500.

Lighting and space equipment ........................    500.

________________________________________________

                                               Total .......................$12,500.


Words of Support from Our Audiences


TEAM

story:
A momentous time

I'm Stewart Bremner and I was the artist for Yes Scotland's digital team. I created over 1,200 graphics for both them and many key groups during the campaign. 

The independence debate was a momentous period in Scotland's history and my graphics played a key part in the online campaign. I am honoured that these iconic designs have now been archived by the National Library of Scotland. 

With the debate moving to the longer term, I want to bring my graphics back into the light and collect them in a book. There they will serve not only as a reference for the ongoing campaign, but also as a fantastic historical document. 

The book contains:

  • 700 graphics marking key moments and arguments
  • 200 full-colour pages, measuring 20x20cm
  • January 2013 to September 2014.

What I need and what you get

£4,500 will cover the cost of printing and sturdy cardboard mailers, to ensure your copy arrives safely! The book will be printed in Scotland by Bell and Bain (who also printed Greg Moodie Versus The Union) and published by Imagined Images Editions (who also published Leith Said Aye which features some of my photos from the campaign).

  • Give £5 and you'll get a signed postcard featuring one of my graphics
  • Give £10 and you'll get a downloadable PDF of the book (plus the postcard)
  • Give £30 and you'll get a signed copy of my book (plus the PDF and postcard)
  • Give £50 or more and you'll get the book and a special A4 print of my very popular 'Early days of a better nation' design (plus the PDF and postcard) 

What others say

"Stewart Bremner's art defined Yes Scotland's extremely successful social media campaign. Even more than our corporate leaflets and billboards, it captured our spirit of engaging, educating and enthusing supporters and voters with its passion, imagination and compassion."
– Stewart Kirkpatrick, former Head of Digital for Yes Scotland

"Stewart Bremner created the most memorable and impactful illustrations and graphics of the Yes campaign."
– Blair Jenkins, Chief Executive, Yes Scotland


Exhibition

The book coincides with an exhibition of my graphics at Edinburgh's Free Space gallery. The exhibition will open and the book will launch on Monday 6th April.


Other ways you can help

Please share my campaign among fellow independence supporters far and wide!

story:
SEWW At a Glance

Southeastern Women's Wrestling (SEWW) is a group of female and female-identifying performers currently based in Athens, Georgia. Through spectacle, these bad ass babes are reclaiming the sport from hyper-masculinity and subverting sexualized stereotypes of females to promote a body-positive space free from the male gaze where fantasy alter egos can be constructed, cultivated, and performed.

Our campaign is important to us, because, hello??? Did you read the previous paragraph? We need to raise money for wrestling events that empower badass women. This is important to us as wrestlers and to you as viewers. Don’t you want to be part of an authentic uplifting space? Yeah we thought so, that’s why you’re here! WITH YOU we can cover costs of our wrestling ring, design and print posters to hang around town to increase hype (YEAH we have some badass artists/wrestlers that design our logo, t-shirts, posters, and zine pages), and to eventually obtain an LLC license, which would be a fancy way of saying we are officially legit. 

If you donate, THANK YOU. You are awesome and because of that, we are all awesome together. Spread the word and MARK YOU CALENDAR FOR WRESTLEWOMANIA ON APRIL 28th (the next wrestling event, obviously. Did we mention you get into it for free if you donate $5 or more???).

What We Need

Are you a math-nerd number crunching geek? Perfect! Here is where we break down the numbers for how the donations are distributed. 

We are raising money for our next three matches:

The most important part is the ring, this is $250 per day, with three matches that would be $750.

A professional wrestling license would help SEWW to continue to grow and develop by becoming an official organization, which in turn will provide more opportunities for crazy cool lady wrestling events in the Athens area! It costs $100 to apply for an LLC. (We’re at $850 now for all you math geeks).

Printing materials (ink, artist’s time, paper) for posters and zine articles. This will be about $100 for the three matches.

Sound system for wrestling events so you can listen to our BOSS announcer, Colette: $50.

IF we do not get full funds, wrestlers will pay out of pocket and be grateful for the amount that we did raise. AGAIN did we say THANKS yet for donating? Thanks, you’re the best.

Let's Get Perky!

Now you're probably asking yourself, "Other than the joy of giving and potentially watching some strong folks kick each other's butts, what the frick else am I gettin out of this??!??"

Depending on the amount of your donation, we have a range of perk options!

At $3, you can get your hands on your own version of the SEWW title in sticker form to place wherever you see fit! 

From $5 up, you get free admission to WrestleWomania!! WOOO!!!

In addition to free admission, other perks include:

  • a handprinted coozie or SEWW zine ($10 level)
  • SEWW t-shirt or pennant ($20 level)
  • Your name in the playbill + an SEWW cross stitch (limit 5) OR a relic from either a Heel (meanie) or Face (sweetie) wrestler in our crew ($50 level)!
  • A SIGNED, PERSONALIZED poster from your favorite wrestler ($75 level)(limit 10)!
  • A PERSONALIZED shout out on social media from either a Heel (meanie) or Face (sweetie) wrestler in our crew ($100 level) (limit 5)!

The Impact

This project is valuable to the world, at least the Athens and surrounding areas world. As women, we are SICK AND TIRED of having the media, our peers and our partners, telling us how we are supposed to act, dress, talk, and express our gender or sexuality. SEWW allows women to explore their inner personality that is formed authentically, reflectively, and intentionally. Having women carry out this task, while having other people observe and also reflect, creates a better place for us all. We have put on 3 wrestling events in the past, and let me tell you, its fun and inspiring. So, let’s do this together!

How Else Can You Help?

If you’re on social media, SPREAD THE WORD. (I mean, if you’re not on social media how the hell did you get here?). Retweet, regram, repost, send an email, send a hand written letter to your grandma (you should do this regardless), talk about the coolness of SEWW at the water cooler, pass a note on a piece of toilet paper under a bathroom stall, get drunk at a bar and rant to strangers about how they should donate to SEWW’s indiegogo, get the QR code to this website tattooed on your forehead, or go to the library and place SEWW fliers inside random books. You’ll figure it out, you’re smart (that is why you donated, after all).

story:
Summary of Our Project

We are raising funds to build a series of mural-climbing walls in rural communities in Thailand. Our goal is to beautify low income areas with art that has meaning for the individual community while also providing a new recreational space for children and adults alike. Climbing a bouldering wall can be as easy or as challenging as an individual chooses. Bouldering is like piecing together a puzzle. To be successful it takes patience, visualization and planning. 

Anna is an accomplished artist and passionate muralist and Mathew is an experienced rock climber and builder. We have worked hand in hand to create two such murals in rural areas of Taiwan, and would like to build a few more in underprivileged communities in Thailand where we will be living and teaching later this year. Its a great project that will enrich the lives of countless people over the course of many years to come.

What We Need & What You Get

If you choose to support our campaign your name (or word of your choosing) will be incorporated into a mural as a way to permanently thank and recognize your gift to the community.

We need money for climbing holds, screws, paint, paint brushes and a few accessories. What you get is good karma and satisfaction in knowing that you have contributed to long standing instillations that will beautify and enrich the lives of generations of people in a plethora of different ways.  

Additionally, If you are planning a trip to our corner of the world in the next year, your generosity will be reciprocated in the form of a home cooked meal and a couch to sleep on.


The Impact

You are contributing to a world where beauty and creativity are not things only for the rich and privileged, a world where art is not untouchable- but rather begs to be touched and played with. You will play a key role in the physical and emotional development of countless children who will be challenged by this bouldering wall and through their interactions with this project will learn perseverance, confidence and goal setting.  Bouldering is an excellent and safe recreational activity (its rock-climbing, but closer to the ground and safer). These walls will be located in public spaces, free for anyone to use. Bouldering has no need for special equipment ( special shoes, gloves, harnesses...) like other physical pursuits often require. That means that financial advantage or disadvantage has no bearing on an individual's ability to participate and succeed.   Watch this video for a short example of bouldering: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LQJfXPedk28

This TED Talk articulates the power of color and beauty on a community : 



Furthermore, we intend to purchase our supplies needed for this project (food, cleaning supplies, protective gear, general equipment ) from LOCAL merchants, therefor money will be funneled into the community.

story:
We are the third-year illustrators from the University of Northampton and we are setting up our degree show for the 11th June. 

Like most degree shows, it comes down to us the students to fund-raise.

We need to raise money to help purchase the supplies that are necessary for the show, getting our show catalogue printed and much more. For this, we need your help.

With your help, we are hoping to raise £500. Any donations great or small will be greatly appreciated! Your donations will help the Illustration students shape this into a reality.

To help entice you, we are setting up some donation perks with more to come in the future. We will also be updating this page with more details of the show as time progresses, so keep checking back.

Thank you for contributing, we really appreciate your help and hopefully you can come to our show!

For this, we need your help.With your help, we are hoping to raise £500. Any donations great or small will be greatly appreciated! story:
Hello lovely humans! We are Carmine Santavenere and Katie Gartlan-Close: emerging theatre artists and recent graduates from Simon Fraser University’s Theatre Performance program. Both of us are interested in creating collaborative, unique, and eye-opening art in Vancouver (from theatre, to dance, to visual arts).

                   

So what is Living Cardboard Projects? It’s essentially taking something that we both love- cardboard -and turning it into things that we could only dream of. The goal is to bring that dream out into the everyday world, to spur inspiration and joy in the eyes of the public. That’s you people!

The Living Cardboard Projects are all being created in an effort to surprise and delight. It’s important for us to invite people to slow down, even for just a moment, to enjoy something that they may not usually see. We both feel that our city tends to feel closed off and that routine gets in the way of illuminating our everyday lives. Art and performance are so often kept away in galleries and buildings, but we think art should be alive and accessible- to be enjoyed by all!

We are interested in creating cardboard ‘body masks’, city installations from small to large-scale, and performances throughout our urban environment. We have plans for many cardboard-based projects in the works: a cardboard arm dance performance in local parks, cardboard installations (from little birds hung in trees to full size forts and tunnels), a huge scale cardboard mask parade through the city (featuring approximately 20 performers in full-size cardboard boxes), a clown-based performance featuring two old ladies searching for a home, and hopefully much more! We are SUPER excited to turn our ideas into living, breathing experiences.

                     

So, for this to happen we need some help from YOU delightful people!! As theatre artists, we often end up making work and doing it for little or no money but it’s okay because we love what we do. We are asking for help this time around, because many of these ideas are grand and will require bundles of materials. We are not going to get paid for our labour, but we would so greatly appreciate your help to lessen some of the materials and rehearsal space costs.

This is our projected budget:

Large sheets of cardboard (corrugated cardboard size 48’ by 96’) -$320

Magnifiers (for the large cardboard box ‘body masks’)-$120

Tape and other construction materials-$75

Rehearsal/workshop space-$225

Pizza lunch for our generous performers-$60

TOTAL budget for Living Cardboard Projects=$800

If you can’t donate, there are other ways you can help! We would love if you could share this page with your friends and loved ones. Spread the word through social media, word of mouth, or carrier pigeon. Any method is fully endorsed by us. The more people who support us, the greater we can brighten up our city and the bigger we can dream.

We are also looking for scrap cardboard! The big cardboard masks need large sheets which we have to buy separately, but we need lots of cardboard so any extras that you have lying around at home or in your garage we will gladly take off your hands. We are also interested in old vintage items, random objects, or old metal bits-really anything that could spark interest in our minds.

                        

THANK YOU for visiting and catch us around the city this summer (and beyond)!

Feel free to contact us at livingcardboardprojects@gmail.com , like us on Facebook at facebook.com/livingcardboard, OR on Instagram at livingcardboardprojects. We will keep you up to date on our progress, performances, and installations!

story:
Short Summary

My wife, an illustrator, is absolutely in love with the Copic Sketch markers (like these: https://imaginationinternationalinc.com/copic/101/markers/#sketch ). We picked up an assortment of 55 used markers from a graduating fashion design student, and she can hardly put them down!

If you're not familiar with Copic markers, they are professional-grade and refillable. From our original batch we've already tried refilling one, and it works amazingly well. One can use the same marker casing for life, and just refill it with ink as it runs dry. Basically, in our opinion, these are the best markers. In. The. World.

Our one-year anniversary is coming up (so is Christmas) and as a surprise gift I'd like to round out her collection. That would amount to an order of 1 each of the 303 colors currently not in our collection.

This gift is much better coming from more people! Imagine having a hundred people tell you, "I like your art, here, have some tools to make more!"

What We Need & What You Get

I've already reached out to Copic about logistics for an order (and maybe they'll give a discount). If they don't offer any bulk discount, I can get most colors from a local art store for $5.24 per marker which comes to $1588 (for 303) ... which is a lot for me on my own. I've reached out to friends and family for help covering the cost. I plan on picking up the slack myself … but thought I'd also ask strangers on the internet for help, too!

As a perk, you'll get a postcard sketch from my wife using the marker that you sponsored. These will be delivered digitally (unless you chip in a little extra for shipping the original). I imagine she'll take requests on subject matter - but I'm not going to ask her, because that would spoil the surprise!

If we don't reach our entire goal, the partial funds will still be used for markers. They'll just offset my out-of-pocket cost for purchasing the markers.

If we exceed the goal, extra funds will go into purchasing ink refills, replacement marker tips, and fancy marker paper.

The Impact

By helping purchase markers, you'll bring color to my wife's work and our world. You'll have a major impact on the budding career of a talented artist. These are refillable markers that can be used for a lifetime!

I can't understate the impact you would have on my wife's life. She's struggled with self-confidence/anxiety issues (like lots of creative people do). Receiving a gift like this will brighten her day/month/year/decade and really launch her career.

You can see more of her work at [redacted] and [redacted] - but please be careful with interacting through social media until after the gift is delivered! It's a SURPRISE! (I had to remove those links because clumsy "Market Your IndieGoGo" vultures were not seeing the "SURPRISE" part and almost spoiled the surprise. If you want to see more of Cathy's work, just send me a message!)

Risks & Challenges

I'm taking a risk making this a public campaign, because I want it to be a surprise!

Beyond that, the hardest part is organizing who sponsors which color. I've made a Google Spreadsheet for tracking progress. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1w_OHZxy... This will help you claim a color to sponsor. I'll be closely monitoring this campaign and sending instructions about color-claiming individually.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute directly to the project, please spread the word about this campaign. (but not too much, because SURPRISE!)

story:
About me

I am an independent artist who recently went from full time to part time at my job so I could pursue my dream. One of my life goals is to be able to support my family with my artwork. Making these compact mirrors is one small step towards achieving that goal. I'm extremely passionate about my work and hope that one day I will be able to help people with my artwork and give it a purpose beyond just being something to look at.

What I need

The money I am fundraising will go towards the mirror machine, 250 mirrors and packaging for the finished project. I will be purchasing the mirror machine from buttonbiz.com because it is a well-made, quality product.

Why the deadline

I've been working as an artist since 2009, honing my skills and developing my style while working various jobs.

This August my work will be shown in a gallery show for the very first time! I would like to be able to have some merchandise for those who do not get the chance, or do not have the money, to buy a painting.

Other ways you can help

If you enjoy my work, please spread the word. You can find me on Facebook, twitter (@RebekahJoyPlett) or at my website www.rebekahjoyplett.wordpress.com. Most of my fans have found me by word of mouth.

You can also support my work by buying a print of your favourite piece at www.rebekahjoyplett.imagekind.com.

I've also started my own jewelry line and you can see what work I've done there at www.rebekahjoyplett.etsy.com. 

Even just an email of encouragement goes a long way, so please leave a comment or just say hi. 

Thank you so much for being a part of my project just by reading about it!

story:
Short Summary

Help fund the 101 Vagina Book Launch and Exhibition Tour in USA & Canada 2014.

By pre-ordering the book through this crowdfunding campaign, you are helping me meet the huge initial outlay required for self-publishing, in particular for getting the books printed locally.

The tour will visit Los Angeles, San Francisco, Chicago, Montreal, New York and Toronto, in that order.

See below for tour details or visit: http://101vagina.com/usa-canada
(Note: There are some NSFW images on the site)

About 101 Vagina

101 Vagina is about breaking down the taboos and shame around our bodies in general and vaginas in particular, to celebrate diversity and generate dialogue.

It is a beautiful coffee table photo book with 101 black & white photos and an accompanying message from or about each woman's vagina, written be each woman.

Having 101 Vagina sitting on your coffee table is impossible to ignore! 

The exhibitions will show all 101 photos and messages from the 101 Vagina book printed in A3 size on high quality archival photo paper and pigment ink.

For more details on the book please see: http://101vagina.com
(Note: There are some NSFW images on the site)


What We Need & What You Get

The 101 Vagina book is already published here in little old Australia, but I want to take it to the world, via America. For that I need some help!

Self-publishing and organizing a book launch and exhibition tour has many costs associated with it. The biggest single expense is getting the books offset-printed locally for the book launch and tour. This is a HUGE OUTLAY for me.

By supporting this campaign you are effectively PRE-ORDERING your copy of the book, so that I can pay the printers.

You'll also SAVE MONEY since I'm offering the book at a discount price to supporters of this crowd-funding campaign.

I am getting the books printed locally (USA/Canada) to ensure the best quality, environmental standards and ethical practices are maintained. I also believe in local manufacturing to support local industry and jobs and cutting down on unnecessary transportation.

I am not financially backed by any organisation or publisher, meaning this project is free from any corporate interference or commercial/sponsor interests. Because I self-published all costs associated with the entire project have been carried by myself. Taboo Books is my own business name under which I self-published. Book sales are the only means I have of recovering costs to keep this amazing project going.

Once the tour is underway, sales of the 101 Vagina book will hopefully carry the expenses of the tour, but the initial outlay is huge. At this stage it looks like I'll need to sell around 1000 books over the duration of the tour just to break even.

(Note: Print on demand would be convenient because no initial outlay is required, but each book would then cost over $150. Offset printing produces higher quality images and is cheaper per copy, but to achieve those lower costs high volumes to be printed, and paid for, at once.)

The Impact

By supporting this crowd-funding campaign you are helping break down the vagina taboo and body image shame generally, by helping me get the book printed and keeping the exhibition tour on the road.

Beyond that, once printed, $5 from every book sold will go to charities working towards ending violence towards women, or helping and healing survivors. This is inline with my having been inspired by Even Ensler's Vagina Monologues and her VDay Foundation.

I have had many people say to me that they wish this kind of work would be part of sex-education in schools, or that they were buying the book for their daughter or friend. If even only one person feels better about themselves through this project then it's all been worth while.

I am constantly buoyed by the positive feedback I get from people who have seen the book or visited an exhibition.

You can see what some people had to say about it here, for me this is really what it's all about. Changing people's hearts and minds:
http://www.101vagina.com/category/feedback/

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, they don't know!

Give them the direct link to this crowd-funding campaign:
http://igg.me/at/101vagina

Social media links for 101 Vagina are:

Twitter: @101vagina or http://twitter.com/101vagina
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/101vag
Google+: https://plus.google.com/+101vagina
Tumblr: http://101vagina.tumblr.com

Also, at several of the exhibitions I would love to host a one day Festival of the Vagina, bringing together diverse local artists, speakers, musicians, poets, educators, etc. in a day or vaginal celebration. For this I need contacts with local vagina loving artists and help organising the event.

If you feel like helping out is some way or want to bring your art of perform or speak, please get in touch :)

**********************************************


Tour Dates and Venues

Los Angeles: 5 – 13 April

DATES:
Saturday 5 – Sunday 13 April, 2014

VENUE:
Think Tank Gallery
939 Maple Ave, Suite #200
Los Angeles

San Francisco: 19 – 27 April

DATES:
Saturday 19 – Sunday 27 April, 2014

VENUE:
Goforaloop Gallery & Studios
1458 San Bruno Avenue
San Francisco

Chicago: 6 – 11 May: CANCELLED !

(The gallery became afraid of potential controversy)

DATES:
Tuesday 6 – Sunday 11 May, 2014

VENUE:
Space 1858
1858 W. Grand Ave
Chicago

Montreal: 17 – 25 May

Dates:
Saturday 17 – Sunday 25 May, 2014

Venue:
Le repaire des 100 talents
5867 Rue Saint-Hubert
Montreal
Canada

New York: 3 – 8 June

Dates:
Tuesday 3 – Sunday 8 June, 2014

Venue:
NOo SPHERE Arts
251 East Houston St
New York

Toronto: 13 – 22 June

Dates:
Saturday 13 – Sunday 22 June, 2014

Venue:
Creative Blueprint Gallery
376 Bathurst Street
Toronto

story:
Tukto-what?
Tuktoyaktuk is the highest drivable point from mainland Canada, only accessible during the winter months via an ice highway. It'll be cold, -60c cold at times and certainly a difficult drive!

We're doing it not only to experience something amazing, but to raise awareness for a charity close to my heart, no pun intended.

The Heart and Stroke Foundation is important to us, not only because we all have hearts but because in Canada 1 in 3 people will die from a heart related illness. That doesn't bode well for at least 1 of the four of us on this trip.

So, we plan to raise awareness with young people in our local city of Vancouver while we prepare for the trip. We plan to spread the word at every location we hit on the way, through BC, Yukon and Northwest territories.

We're officially sanctioned by the heart and stroke foundation of BC and Yukon, and they're as excited as us about the trip!

Why $4000
Between the four of us we're covering maintenance and personal costs, so until we hit our $4000 goal, 50% of your contribution will be to our fuel cost, with 50% going directly to the heart and stroke foundation.

Once we hit $4000 however, ALL contributions will be going directly to the heart and stroke foundation, which is a great goal to strive for! We've been fundraising here in Vancouver by hosting some local events, and hope to raise our total even further!

The Trip

Heading north through BC, we'll be passing through Whitehorse and Dawson in the Yukon, making our way further north along the Dempster Highway to Inuvik, and driving the ice road right to Tuktoyaktuk. Four good friends who have never been further north than BC. Check out this map of the trip below -

 

 

We'll get to see the northern lights all along our trip, drink a Sour Toe Cocktail in Dawson (A shot... with a real human toe in it!), see lots of great wildlife and meet some great people who live their life in northern Canada.

Why contribute?
Well I'm sure you'll want to know where our blog is while we document our trip. You'll also wanna see our Youtube channel, seeing as we're taking GoPro cameras and a digital SLR with us for some amazing shots of the great white north.

We're offering a whole bunch of bonuses too, such as -

$3 - Backstage Pass!
Access to the special features on our journey blog!

$10 - Year Round Beauty + Car Shout
Previous rewards, plus access to our online calendar, full of photographs from our journey! We'll also write your name on the flag we're taking with us!

$25 - Postcards from the North!
Previous, + we'll send you a postcard from Tuktoyaktuk, handwritten and sent via Canada Post! USA residents, please add an extra $1 to your donation. International +$2.

$45 - Sour Dedication
Previous, plus we'll dedicate a sour-toe cocktail in Dawson City to you in a video clip!

$50 - Northern Aurora
A high quality, large print of your choice from our trip, plus a Car Shout, Postcard and Blog Access. USA residents, please add an extra $1 to your donation. International +$2.

$60 - 365 Days

A print copy of our photograph calendar, plus a Car Shout, Postcard and Blog Access. USA residents, please add an extra $1 to your donation. International +$2.


$200 - Sour Double!
Gail will take 2 Sour Toe Cocktails! Plus Blog Access, Postcard and Car Shout. (one only!)

$250 - Welcome to the North!
We'll film a video outside the sign for a town of your choice, and send it to you, first come first served, Plus Blog Access, Postcard and Car Shout. (limit of 5)


Extra Help!

If you feel you can contribute in other ways, by offering us a place to stay, or maybe even by loaning us a vehicle (we'll insure it!) do get in touch, as it all means more $$'s for charity.


Thanks so much for taking a look, and I really hope you'll take part in what is to be a very memorable trip!
story_txt:
Tukto-what?Tuktoyaktuk is the highest drivable point from mainland Canada, only accessible during the winter months via an ice highway. It'll be cold, -60c cold at times and certainly a difficult drive!We're doing it not only to experience something amazing, but to raise awareness for a charity close to my heart, no pun intended.The Heart and Stroke Foundation is important to us, not only because we all have hearts but because in Canada 1 in 3 people will die from a heart related illness. That doesn't bode well for at least 1 of the four of us on this trip.So, we plan to raise awareness with young people in our local city of Vancouver while we prepare for the trip. We plan to spread the word at every location we hit on the way, through BC, Yukon and Northwest territories. We're officially sanctioned by the heart and stroke foundation of BC and Yukon, and they're as excited as us about the trip!
Why $4000Between the four of us we're covering maintenance and personal costs, so until we hit our $4000 goal, 50% of your contribution will be to our fuel cost, with 50% going directly to the heart and stroke foundation.Once we hit $4000 however, ALL contributions will be going directly to the heart and stroke foundation, which is a great goal to strive for! We've been fundraising here in Vancouver by hosting some local events, and hope to raise our total even further!
The Trip
Heading north through BC, we'll be passing through Whitehorse and Dawson in the Yukon, making our way further north along the Dempster Highway to Inuvik, and driving the ice road right to Tuktoyaktuk. Four good friends who have never been further north than BC. Check out this map of the trip below -
 

 
We'll get to see the northern lights all along our trip, drink a Sour Toe Cocktail in Dawson (A shot... with a real human toe in it!), see lots of great wildlife and meet some great people who live their life in northern Canada.Why contribute?Well I'm sure you'll want to know where our blog is while we document our trip. You'll also wanna see our Youtube channel, seeing as we're taking GoPro cameras and a digital SLR with us for some amazing shots of the great white north.We're offering a whole bunch of bonuses too, such as - $3 - Backstage Pass!Access to the special features on our journey blog!$10 - Year Round Beauty + Car ShoutPrevious rewards, plus access to our online calendar, full of photographs from our journey! We'll also write your name on the flag we're taking with us!$25 - Postcards from the North!Previous, + we'll send you a postcard from Tuktoyaktuk, handwritten and sent via Canada Post! USA residents, please add an extra $1 to your donation. International +$2.$45 - Sour DedicationPrevious, plus we'll dedicate a sour-toe cocktail in Dawson City to you in a video clip!$50 - Northern AuroraA high quality, large print of your choice from our trip, plus a Car Shout, Postcard and Blog Access. USA residents, please add an extra $1 to your donation. International +$2.
$60 - 365 Days
A print copy of our photograph calendar, plus a Car Shout, Postcard and Blog Access. USA residents, please add an extra $1 to your donation. International +$2.
$200 - Sour Double!Gail will take 2 Sour Toe Cocktails! Plus Blog Access, Postcard and Car Shout. (one only!)$250 - Welcome to the North!We'll film a video outside the sign for a town of your choice, and send it to you, first come first served, Plus Blog Access, Postcard and Car Shout. (limit of 5)
Extra Help!
If you feel you can contribute in other ways, by offering us a place to stay, or maybe even by loaning us a vehicle (we'll insure it!) do get in touch, as it all means more $$'s for charity.
Thanks so much for taking a look, and I really hope you'll take part in what is to be a very memorable trip!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Extend your skills and professional service with multispectral imaging!  
It's affordable! 
Don't miss this chance! 

Why a new multispectral Imaging system.

The identification of pigments in polychrome artworks and archaeology is necessary to gain a deep understanding of the materials and the painting technique applied. Conservators and art historians can use this information to select the proper conservation procedures and to reconstruct the artists’ workshop practices. In many cases, the application of non-invasive techniques is mandatory since physical sampling of the art works is not possible.
Multispectral imaging systems are not invasive and are successfully used in art examination to map and identify artists’ materials (pigments and binders) and to enhance the reading of old documents.  This is possible thanks to the different reflectance spectral features that characterize pigments.
We propose to spread the use of this technology by developing a low-cost multispectral imaging system. If funded this project will benefit a transnational community of professionals involved in art conservation.     



System Features

We have a simple and sturdy system in mind!

  • made using commercially available parts (for less than $4000). 
  • no costly custom made components
  • free software
  • user-friendly 
  • lightweight and small
  • easy to understand 
  • covers the 360-1000 nm spectral range


Project Features

Open Source

This project will develop and test a system whose features will be published and freely available. It will be made of commercially available parts and free software and it will be easy to assemble.  

Consulting Team

We will have 5 conservators or Institutions that will participate as Supporters and will join the Consulting Team. They will be an integral  part of this project and will guide the design of the system to fit the needs of the art conservation sector.

Budget

We need $5000 to make it happen. Further funding will be used to demonstrate the system at art conservation conferences.



Testimonials


Elisabetta Bosetti, Danimark, painting conservator
"I support this project because I believe in passionate and truly dedicated people to the preservation of cultural heritage. People behind CHOSOS show the way!" 

Ricardo Suárez, Spain. Conservation scientist, National Center of Restoration in Catalonia (CRBMC).
Thanks Antonino for your CHSOS open source web. Here in the National Center of Restoration in Catalonia (CRBMC) we love your work. My little contribution for raise your project.

Alessandro Fiamingo, Italy. conservation scientist. Art Defender.
“There are a number of courses on conservation science which provide plenty of theory but unfortunately, little practical advices.  Also the instrumentation is costly, and definitely not user friendly. So far we didn’t see any effort to make these methods affordable and easy to use specifically for conservation scientists. This is actually the mission of CHSOS! Thanks to Antonino and his papers and posts I was able to learn a lot. This is the reason why I trust him and I decided to contribute. ”

David Lainé, Belgium.  Senior partner painting conservation and research at IPARC International Platform for Art Research and Conservation.
"Because of my interest and my own involvement  in scientific methods for art examination I am always looking for opportunities and affordable alternatives in analytical methods. That is why I have been following CHSOS and Antonino Cosentino from the beginning. I welcome their initiative in developing an affordable and easy way for this analytical imaging system for art research."

John Scott, USA. NYCF President, NYMS Pres., EAS Organizing Committee

CHSOS / Antonino Cosentino: a great online source on accessible methods for technical study of art and archaeology. 

In November Cosentino will present results in New York Conservation Foundation’s 21st Conservation Science Annual at the Eastern Analytical Symposium, and applications in cultural heritage microscopy with the New York Microscopical Society, interested public and Salmagundi Art Club Members, at the Club.

Chris Cox, USA. Senior Computer Scientist on Photoshop at Adobe Systems, Inc.
"I really want to see this CHSOS project succeed.  Releasing a reasonably priced, usable, open source multispectral camera system will significantly advance adoption of multispectral techniques in art, archaeology, and other domains."


Fabian Rasson, Belgium. Conservator, ORNAMENT CVBA. 
"As an experienced conservator specialized in wall paintings and historic interiors I believe that we all welcome the ideas behind CHSOS. Certainly the practical implementation of an open source analytical imaging system is very appealing. So when I can contribute to the further development of a system that makes scientific diagnostics more accessible for us all, I do not hesitate."

Angela Campbell, USA. Assistant Conservator in Paper Conservation, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, NY.
“I have been following Antonino’s work for the past five years, I trust his commitment to developing an affordable Multispectral Imaging System, and I look forward to learning about the results of this project.” 
Samantha Stout, USA. Ph.D. student in Materials Science and Engineering, UCSD.
"The concepts of this imager tie directly into my dissertation research.  It's all about making the scientific diagnostics more accessible to art conservators and other professionals. Once we have a standardized way to document cultural artifacts, we can start health assessments and time monitoring to identify common threats and vulnerabilities to state of conservation. (Plus, I really need the pigments checker!)"

Athanasios Velios, UK. Reader in Digital Documentation, Ligatus, University of the Arts London and IIC webmaster.
"Conservation is largely dominated by proprietary software solutions which slow down the development of new tools and limit the potential of learning. It is exciting to see open source becoming the focus of this project which will hopefully deliver a tool that other groups can build on." 
Tim Zaman, The Netherlands. PhD Researcher, Delft University of Technology.
“In cultural heritage imaging, there is a need for pragmatic pioneers that are passionate about giving the field easy access to scientific tools. Organizations like CHSOS fit this role, but the effort should be collaborative. Therefore have to give mutual support to promote and motivate.”
Antonio Martinez, Puerto Rico. Professor of Physics, University of Puerto Rico.
“I have been following CHSOS for a while now and I am confident that they can bring this project to fruition.  It is consistent with CHSOS initiatives to empower the members of the Cultural Heritage community through training and pointing to accessible instrumentation and techniques."
Silvia Amato, UK. Conservation scientist, London.
"I like and I believe in Antonino's ambition, his fresh ideas and his way of making them real. I support this project because I appreciate this new way of thinking the Multispectral Imaging for works of art: an easy and low-budget system available to anyone who needs useful and reliable data using non-destructive analyses. I want this project to grow up!".
Moshe Caine, Israel. Head of Interactive Communications and New Media, Hadassah Academic College, Jerusalem Conservation Imaging Technologies - Haifa University Department of Archaeology.
“Antonino has been at the forefront of conservation imaging for many years and has a proven track record in the field. I have been a follower of CHSOS and I trust their commitment to make this project happen!”
Elena Mumford,  UK, Art Historian, London.
“I have experienced Antonino's work first hand and cannot recommend him highly enough. This project is a breath of fresh air and a sign of reassurance for both researchers and collectors ."

Carsten Wintermann, Germany. paper conservator. www.papierrestaurierungdresden.de
"I have been a follower of CHSOS and I trust their commitment to make this project happen! It is a very amazing project and i like this project very much. I wish you success."

Gema Grueso, Spain. Conservator, Museo Nacional Reina Sofía.
"I'm very excited to see where your project is going. I can't foresee what kind of opportunities this crowdfunding campaign is opening, not only for the goals of this particular project but for the way the professionals approach our conservation field. Open source, crowdfunding, networked communities, we need to implement all these 21st century dynamics in our professional workflow! I'm convinced that such initiatives can bring major changes of perspective and actually improve the way things get done."

Paolo Triolo, Italy. Imaging specialist, Venaria Reale, Turin.
"CHSOS is the best solution for sharing ideas and new solutions for multispectral diagnostics for culturale heritage!"

Alexandr Nikityaev, Russia. CTO, Tula city
"Антонию делает замечательный проект, распространение которого позволит использовать современные технологии энтузиастам и профессионалам доступными по деньгам куда большему количеству людей без бесконечных ожиданий финансированя со стороны государства. Вы себе представьте, что какой нибудь музей под Тулой В.Д. Поленова или военно медицинский музей Санкт Петербурга, сможет заново открывать тайны картин или тексты рукописи Залмана Градовского, члена зондеркомандо, рукопись которого была найдена в пепле возле крематория в Аушвиц-Биркенау. Она до сих пор хранит тайныи в силу низкой читаемости без специального оборудования"

"Antonio make very beautiful project. Available technology allow many enthusiast or professionals reopen many secrets. Imaging some museum under Tula like V.D Polenov or manuscript of Zalman Gradowski in Military Medical Museum in St. Petersburg. In case of  V.D Polenov we can study more about this painter. In case of Zalman Gradowski we can read text of direct holocaust witness. His manuscripts were found near crematorium in Auschwitz Birkenau "

Kaoru Suemori, Japan. Researcher, Center for Cultural Resources, National Museum of Ethnology (Minpaku), Osaka, Japan
"This project has a lot of possibilities for contributing to the examination of art works. In addition, this low cost techniques could be applied to many kinds of collection care methods.  I would like to follow the progress of this project."

Valentina Ferro, UK. PhD Candidate, University of Dundee.
"Contributing to new creative ideas in the field of applied physics is always exciting. As a researcher, I believe that this CHSOS project has everything it needs to bring an effective world-spreading tool to the cultural heritage community."

Elisa Di Stefano, Italy. Researcher at Italian Institute for Astrophysics. 
“The development of low cost instrumentation supported by the experience will be very helpful for all the people that have a low budget and want operate in the field of Art and Archeology.”

story:
Wednesday Update:  SEE THE GALLERY FOR PREVIEWS OF THE FINAL LIGHTING EFFECT!

LA/SoCal Contributors: When I'm shooting local photos in July, I'll make a special effort to put my rainbow halo on you (if you want to wear it)! And you'll get a physical 5x7 print of your portrait, no matter what funding level you support at!

As a last hurrah before going back to the workforce in July, I'm taking a 10 day roadtrip with a few friends. We're planning on hitting the Grand Canyon, Denver Pride, Yellowstone, and SF Pride before returning to LA.

I'm taking my camera (of course), but would like to add a rainbow LED halo* to take portraits of folks I meet on the road. I'm going to install some Arduino-controlled RGB LEDs to the back of a picture frame to use as a prop and light source.

This is a spur of the moment project I think will be a great way to meet and interact with people at the first PRIDE events I've ever attended. The cost of the LEDs is a little more than I can afford to drop on a whim right now, so I thought I'd throw my idea into the shark tank of crowd funding and see what happens.

---

*The "official" campaign photos were taken on my cellphone with a pico projector, but the pico projector isn't user friendly and can't cast the kind of light I have in mind 


I don't need the full $500.

The materials for what I want to build are only about $50. But 500 is the minimum allowed by IndieGoGo. I feel gross about putting that number there and having a keep-it-all campaign when I'm trying to raise a tenth of it, but this is the least of various evils.

Why crowdfund at all?

Even though the upstart is small, I believe this idea has the potential to produce some very cool portraits. With interest and support from the people around me, I'll go beyond a digital gallery to produce prints and (potentially) a photobook. 


What will I do with your money?

  • At $50, supplies will be paid for and the digital images will go in an online gallery. PAID FOR :D
  • At $100, I will feel loved and will shoot additional portraits in the LA area in July.  GET READY, LOS ANGELES AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES!
  • At $200, I will send all participants (people whose photo I take during the project) a 5x7 print of their portrait.  HAPPENING!
  • At $300, I will be surprised at the success of this campaign and produce a photo book with images from this project, to be sent to all donors who contribute at least $40. (In the event that this comes into play, I'll add "photobook" as a contribution option)
  • At $400, I will take my film cameras on the trip and send each contributor ($5 and up) a unique print.

Additional funds contributed to this campaign will help pay for campaign fees, travel costs, camera repairs, treats for my road trip companions, and the various sideways expenses of artistic life.
story_txt:
Wednesday Update:  SEE THE GALLERY FOR PREVIEWS OF THE FINAL LIGHTING EFFECT!
LA/SoCal Contributors: When I'm shooting local photos in July, I'll make a special effort to put my rainbow halo on you (if you want to wear it)! And you'll get a physical 5x7 print of your portrait, no matter what funding level you support at!

As a last hurrah before going back to the workforce in July, I'm taking a 10 day roadtrip with a few friends. We're planning on hitting the Grand Canyon, Denver Pride, Yellowstone, and SF Pride before returning to LA.
I'm taking my camera (of course), but would like to add a rainbow LED halo* to take portraits of folks I meet on the road. I'm going to install some Arduino-controlled RGB LEDs to the back of a picture frame to use as a prop and light source.This is a spur of the moment project I think will be a great way to meet and interact with people at the first PRIDE events I've ever attended. The cost of the LEDs is a little more than I can afford to drop on a whim right now, so I thought I'd throw my idea into the shark tank of crowd funding and see what happens.
---
*The "official" campaign photos were taken on my cellphone with a pico projector, but the pico projector isn't user friendly and can't cast the kind of light I have in mind 
 I don't need the full $500.
The materials for what I want to build are only about $50. But 500 is the minimum allowed by IndieGoGo. I feel gross about putting that number there and having a keep-it-all campaign when I'm trying to raise a tenth of it, but this is the least of various evils.


Why crowdfund at all?
Even though the upstart is small, I believe this idea has the potential to produce some very cool portraits. With interest and support from the people around me, I'll go beyond a digital gallery to produce prints and (potentially) a photobook. 


What will I do with your money?




At $50, supplies will be paid for and the digital images will go in an online gallery. PAID FOR :D


At $100, I will feel loved and will shoot additional portraits in the LA area in July.  GET READY, LOS ANGELES AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES!


At $200, I will send all participants (people whose photo I take during the project) a 5x7 print of their portrait.  HAPPENING!


At $300, I will be surprised at the success of this campaign and produce a photo book with images from this project, to be sent to all donors who contribute at least $40. (In the event that this comes into play, I'll add "photobook" as a contribution option)


At $400, I will take my film cameras on the trip and send each contributor ($5 and up) a unique print.


Additional funds contributed to this campaign will help pay for campaign fees, travel costs, camera repairs, treats for my road trip companions, and the various sideways expenses of artistic life.

story:
What is the wall today?

The wall today is a website for curated digital art prints by Bulgarian artists. The prints are stuck on a very durable white surface and are ready to hang on your wall. The website features Bulgarian artists and sells in Bulgaria only. For now.

Who is behind the wall today?

Five years ago I was looking to create something that excites me and delights me. The concept for ‘the wall today’ came to life over dinner with a friend. We figured that there wasn’t a Bulgarian art prints website at the time and the idea really resonated with me. I’ve always been drawn to different art forms, but my strengths are more on the business side of things. I liked the idea of using my skills to become the link between the artists and the customers. The wall today for me is a collaboration with the artists where they bring the creation and I bring the audience.

The team behind the wall today is a dynamic group, with the artists in its core, myself, friends helping and sometimes hired help. You can find links to the artists portfolios and my professional background at the bottom of the page.

Why crowdfunding with indiegogo?

Three years after the website launched it was clear that the Bulgarian market for digital art is small. The website is offering, and always will, very advantageous terms for the authors, which in combination with the price sensitivity of the market makes it difficult for the website to break even. So, we need to increase sales volume and expand geography. This is what we plan to do with the funds raised with your help:

  • build an English version of the website
  • provide an option for online payment and international delivery
  • rewrite the existing website
  • refresh the website design
  • offer a wider selection of print materials
  • create artist profile section on the website so that they have more exposure
  • cover the expenses for the crowdfunding campaign

What if we don’t reach our goal?

In case we don’t reach the campaign goal, we’ll still pursue our objectives, but with different tactics. Our top priority is an English version with an online payment and international delivery options. One way would be to switch the site to English only.

Other ways you can help

A crowdfunding campaign relies on contributions by a large group of people. The more people hear about it, the better chances the campaign stands for success. 

Help us spread the word by sharing our campaign with your friends on social media. Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. If the campaign has high traffic volume and a large number of social shares, the indiegogo platform will promote it as well.   

Get to know us

The website

www.thewalltoday.com

Ina Toncheva – creator of the wall today

The Artists

Biliana Velikova

Borislava Karadzova

Ventzislav Dikov

Valentina Boneva

Vlado Vesselinov

Diana Dachkova

Ina Bachvarova

Martina Andonova

Mila Lozanova

Milena Mutavchieva

Nedialko Ivanov - Necho

Pavlina Boneva

Petya Boyadjieva

Petya Konstantinova

Petya Savova

Rositsa Raleva

Stela Stamenkova

Tzveteliti

Yasen Zgurovski

Special thanks to:

Snik for helping with the video

Stela for helping with the visuals for the campaign

Soho holistic coworking company for welcoming us in their beautiful space

 

Stay tuned for updates on the campaign goal status on this page and on our Facebook page.

Thank you!

The team of the wall today

story:
About

Arena Triptych is an installation with three channels of video and eight channels of audio played through an Ambisonic sound system.  The piece will be on view at Harvestworks December 14-16, 2017.  

Arena Triptych

Arena Triptych is about my experience shooting Walter Dundervill’s work “ARENA”, which I found both intoxicating and hypnotic.  I want to offer these feelings of personal joy by creating this new work:  I use footage from ARENA mixed with footage of my own, shot around the same time, to create a visual and sonic collage for a sensual experience.  

Arena Triptych was first created and shown for the exhibition “Reexamine the space” curated by Josh Lubin-Levy at Abrons Center from September 26 to October 23, 2016.  For this new installation at Harvestworks, I’m re-designing the audio for an eight-channel surround-sound system in collaboration with Paul Geluso, who is the chief engineer at Harvestworks and an immersive-sound specialist.  I’m grateful for this opportunity to explore this new technology and to apply it to create a more visceral experience.   

 

Risks & Challenges

Walter Dundervill generously provided the opportunity for me to document his choreographic project, and provided the fee for recording the event.  All the video editing has been done using my own time and money.  All the equipment that is necessary to run the installation is being provided by Harvestworks.   

Your generous financial support will help to provide the fee for my collaborator Paul Geluso, and pay for our audio editing and programming for this new mix, a mix that can fully take advantage of the Ambisonic immersive sound system that Harvestworks offers. 

 

Rewards:

For your generous participation in helping to fund this exciting new edition of Arena Triptych, I've designed some original prints;

 

$300 or more - a set of three digital prints 
( 8"x10" each)-Signed Edition of 6

 

$600 or more - Signed digital print
( 24"x10" each)-Signed Edition of 3

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

The more people that know about this campaign, the greater opportunities I have to reach my goal! Please share and spread the word about this installation and the amazing opportunities it will provide! 

Thank you in advance for your support and taking the time out to visit my campaign page!

story:
Hello and thank you for visiting my Indiegogo page!  

I'm Amanda Martin, a 4th generation San Francisco native, a 14 year resident of the Bernal-Glen neighborhood, and a real estate agent with BarbCo Real Estate Group (aka Barbagelata, one of the oldest family run brokerages in San Francisco, since 1952) License #01386284. I have a deep love for San Francisco and am excited to kick off this small project to continue to bring community art to our beautiful and diverse neighborhoods!

It has been a dream of mine for the past 5 years to get a mural going in Glen Park. It's been a long road to get here (first looked into getting the mural painted on the side of Buddies Market, but after years of unsuccessful attempts to contact the owner of the building I gave up on that plan, Eventually I was connected with the Hayes family who own the property at 2852 Diamond St. and they were enthusiastic about the project, and have generously offered up the wall on the Kern Alley on the side of Pebbles Cafe for this project.

Here's a mock up of what the mural will look like on the wall:

I knew from the beginning that Amos Goldbaum (amosgoldbaum.com) would be the perfect artist for this project and we have been in contact for years now putting together the right artwork. The final artwork for the mural was inspired by this historical photo of Glen Canyon from 1942 (courtesy of OpenSFHistory.org). Glen Park Canyon, circa 1942 will be added to the mural for  context.

Amos is a great local muralist who has painted many neighborhood line drawing murals around the city. 

Perhaps you've seen the one in Noe Valley:

Or this one in Bernal Heights at Pinhole Coffee:

Or this one which is relatively new on Ocean Ave.:

What We Need

  • The full cost for the project will be approximately $7500. This money will go directly to the painters who will be prepping the surface wall and to Amos Goldbaum for painting the mural. 
  • I am running this Indiegogo fundraising for the next 60 days and starting the fundraiser off with $3000 of my own money. 
  • If we don't reach our goal at the end of the 60 days, I will either make up the difference to make the project happen if it's close enough, or return your money if there is some reason the
Please share this site on your social media or send to friends you think might be interested. Let's beautify Glen Park! Please don't hesitate to contact me with any questions you might have.

story:
East Of Color T-Shirts Now Available! 

Grab this cool, custom shirt when you donate $20 or more with your gift pack! 

Artwork by: Rocky Higine 

Button designs by: Camille Simone Lema

 

 

Who We Are

Free Rent ATX is an art sharing collective creating inclusive and diverse events in Austin to support working artists and musicians. Our team also produces submission-based magazines that feature artwork, poetry, short stories, photography, comics and more from independent artists. For over 4 years, Free Rent has traveled to zine/comic conventions around the US where we distribute our print and the publications of a variety of artists. We continue to work hard in contributing to the community with events that benefit local art, Austin non-profits, workshops for kids and so much more. 

 

 

 

Why is diversity so important?

With rapid change and growth of population in Austin, we must work hard to preserve art and culture in our town. By hosting markets that support artists of color, we believe this helps not only keep art in Austin, but also bring people into our community in a warm way. It's a chance to meet and connect with others who are also seeking out diversity and a creative community to be apart of. Supporting art in Austin makes this beautiful city the awesome place that is is to live in! Variety keeps it interesting and fun! Help us make our city an even better place to live!

 

 

Find our event on Facebook!

East Of Color Community Market

story:
Short Summary

This is all to raise funds for the rest of a trip to take an original musical(THE INSIDE OF HIS SEVERED HEAD) to NYC and do it right. 

I will write the plays and direct them as well by December 2018(I want to take my time writing these and do it right) 

What We Need & What You Get

20 dollars will get you a two page play, 30 dollars will get you a three page play. 100 dollars will get you a 10 pager. And so on. If we get to 25 plays, we will do a night of staged readings. You will get TWO FREE TICKETS to the staged readings and hell, you can even act in it. Let's have some fun with this!

 

The Impact

We will be helping new work get to NYC and giving performers a chance they may not have otherwise...by creating new content. 

Risks & Challenges

We could actually have so much fun, you may poop yourself. 

No seriously. You might. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out. Bring some TP. Or act in these when they go up.

story:
The Goal:

To reach $4,000 in support of L.Haz Presents: KRTS Art Show & Brand Debut. Funding will go toward the costs of the space, audio and visual equipment (i.e. speakers and projectors), merchandise, food and beverage, costs of frames and other needs related to my art.

The Story:

My name is Zahyr Lauren, otherwise known as the artist L. Haz and the creator of the brand Koro Rules The Sun (KRTS). I am a lawyer, organizer, youth leadership investor, and former human rights investigator with a gift for art discovered two years ago.

The passion for this project stems from over 10 years of educational, investigative, legal, and lived experience in communities touched by the criminal punishment system. The result of system engagement is often the long term contamination of community potential. 

This campaign is in pursuit of my vision of building a brand dedicated to the art of audio and visual storytelling, culture, fashion and law. Through fashion, art, and storytelling KRTS will enhance collective knowledge of the ways the legal field engages with our communities, in addition to bringing our communities together to strengthen connections with those working in the legal field.

The first incarnation of my vision occurs on November 4th - with an intergenerational community event debuting over 30 of my original art works, each of which invite people to engage with offerings of both information & meditation. 

This show is about blooming big through community engagement and creative education. My hope is that everyone touched by KRTS art and fashion can experience being nurtured by a community village like mine - a community that has incite into their challenges while supporting their dreams, and by extension- supports the prosperity of our collective human village. 

The Impact

The November 4th show aims to be the first of many around the country. This evening is a springboard for the deepening of relationships with community - creatives, youth, attorneys, political collaborators, and all those who wear intersecting hats. 

I don't aim to simply create an event. My intention is to bring into being a shared understanding of the conditions facing humans in this country-while fostering an atmosphere of peace, love and community connection that will continue to bloom outside of the space.

My community-inspired art debut builds on the formative production experience of co-producing the precedent-setting 2015 dapperQ fashion show at the Brooklyn Museum, which attracted over two thousand people and featured 70+ models, 8 designers, and 4 publications. I was energized by the work of manifesting this vision and am drawing upon that inspiration in this next chapter of my creative development in community. 

Other Ways You Can Support:

Volunteering the night of the event, sharing this campaign, and sending me love and prayers are all very appreciated ways to contribute! If you would like to volunteer or send me a meditation or prayer, please contact me at lhaz@kororulesthesun.ink. 

Please use the Indiegogo share tools and spread far and wide!
