story:
Short Summary

Hey there people from IdieGogo, TheInsaneDarkOne here once again, doing great?

For those who don´t know me, my name is Danilo and I work with drawings and I have a Deviantart account which got me the name of TheInsaneDarkOne and made me somewhat famous in the world of gaming fanart, specially with the Mortal Kombat based ones, where I did commissions picturing the brutal finishing moves based on the original game and even sometimes, with original creations for those universes!

Last year, I did a project here which idea was to do a full-artwork set of all Killer Instinct´s finishing moves and the project succeded to meet its goal, turning into a nice bunch of art pieces! 

What We Need & What You Get

Last year, I did a project here which idea was to do a full-artwork set of all Killer Instinct´s finishing moves and the project succeded to meet its goal, turning into a nice bunch of art pieces! 

Theidea was the way I´ve found to stil continue to do the brutal artworks I´ve been doing this last years on DA and also, try to get bigger as an artist in life, getting the support needed to change things up and start a new way of living doing these bigger artwork projects!

Now, instead of doing a second one based again in a single franchise, I´m willing to do a more creative proccess gathering characters from a lot of fighting games all together and creating from scratch some violent finishing moves for each one of them

The characters will be all ladies this time cause a large group of people who enjoy my artwork in DA  like to see such characters in brutal battles, so, that´s why the project here will be called "FEMME FATALE"

Each game will be represented by a couple of characters of my choice and, each one will have a finishing move portraited into panels showing a more violent side of the characters, just like they all were casted to a new "Mortal Kombat" type of game!

Of course, there will be respect for each characters´s moves and skills so then the created fatalities will make sense and, still, I wanna to see them impress people around to see how they could work in a "original game" if the characters had the opportunity to be portraited with this level of violence someday

The funding, of course, will serve for the panel´s production in the standard way I´m used to.. they will be done and posted in DA with watermarks for my page.

Also, everything funded will help me out to get more resources, things and stuff to help me improve my artwork, with time and dedication to it!

The Impact

So, if you wanna support and are interested to see those panels there on my page on Deviantart (cause again, if the project happens, they will all be there), please, support this project with the amount you can and yeah, be aware that, doing so, you´ll also win some nice rewards from this project and also be able to participate somehow depending on how much you can help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, if you do enjoy my artwork and are interested to see it happening, please, support with what you can and it´s already something for the whole idea! 

Also, if you are into my artwork but can´t support with money, please, share the project and the word to help me get more and more people interested on it!

My Deviantart will have journals about the project and, you can use the Indiegogo share tools just as well to help me out with this one!

Hope you guys enjoy the idea and, of course, help me make it happen!

Cheers to you all and, till next time!
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Hey there people from IdieGogo, TheInsaneDarkOne here once again, doing great?
For those who don´t know me, my name is Danilo and I work with drawings and I have a Deviantart account which got me the name of TheInsaneDarkOne and made me somewhat famous in the world of gaming fanart, specially with the Mortal Kombat based ones, where I did commissions picturing the brutal finishing moves based on the original game and even sometimes, with original creations for those universes!
Last year, I did a project here which idea was to do a full-artwork set of all Killer Instinct´s finishing moves and the project succeded to meet its goal, turning into a nice bunch of art pieces! 
   What We Need & What You Get 
Last year, I did a project here which idea was to do a full-artwork set of all Killer Instinct´s finishing moves and the project succeded to meet its goal, turning into a nice bunch of art pieces! 
Theidea was the way I´ve found to stil continue to do the brutal artworks I´ve been doing this last years on DA and also, try to get bigger as an artist in life, getting the support needed to change things up and start a new way of living doing these bigger artwork projects!
Now, instead of doing a second one based again in a single franchise, I´m willing to do a more creative proccess gathering characters from a lot of fighting games all together and creating from scratch some violent finishing moves for each one of them
The characters will be all ladies this time cause a large group of people who enjoy my artwork in DA  like to see such characters in brutal battles, so, that´s why the project here will be called "FEMME FATALE"
Each game will be represented by a couple of characters of my choice and, each one will have a finishing move portraited into panels showing a more violent side of the characters, just like they all were casted to a new "Mortal Kombat" type of game!
Of course, there will be respect for each characters´s moves and skills so then the created fatalities will make sense and, still, I wanna to see them impress people around to see how they could work in a "original game" if the characters had the opportunity to be portraited with this level of violence someday
The funding, of course, will serve for the panel´s production in the standard way I´m used to.. they will be done and posted in DA with watermarks for my page.
Also, everything funded will help me out to get more resources, things and stuff to help me improve my artwork, with time and dedication to it!   The Impact 
So, if you wanna support and are interested to see those panels there on my page on Deviantart (cause again, if the project happens, they will all be there), please, support this project with the amount you can and yeah, be aware that, doing so, you´ll also win some nice rewards from this project and also be able to participate somehow depending on how much you can help!

    Other Ways You Can Help 
Of course, if you do enjoy my artwork and are interested to see it happening, please, support with what you can and it´s already something for the whole idea! Also, if you are into my artwork but can´t support with money, please, share the project and the word to help me get more and more people interested on it!My Deviantart will have journals about the project and, you can use the Indiegogo share tools just as well to help me out with this one!Hope you guys enjoy the idea and, of course, help me make it happen!Cheers to you all and, till next time!

story:
Our Story

Modern Mythology is seeking to crowdsource funding through IndieGoGo in order to keep publishing thought-provoking pieces on pop culture philosophy and social commentary, and to keep expanding our audience. These funds will not only help us keep running, but also allow us to establish a podcast and classroom style series that could be of great use to anyone struggling in a chaotic world. 

There are tons of old, dead philosophers with books enshrined in the academic sphere. Modern Mythology takes a hammer and chisel to the "ivory tower" idea of academic research--the pantheon of philosophers of the past--and carves the voices of the new generation, sublime and ridiculous, into the side of that shrine, part graffiti, part sculpture, part literature, part philosophy, but in all cases necessary in order to truly explore the worlds we live in. 

Help us keep this literary and mental machine going by contributing and get some perks as a thank you!

Our History

Many of us at Modern Mythology have been at this a long time. ModernMythology.net started out as my personal blog in 2005. In 2006, P. Emerson Williams, Michael Szul, Tovarich Pizor and I joined forces to create Mythos Media, a platform for the production of modern myths that might slip through the cracks or be dismissed by mass-media publishers and outlets. This was my third full-out attempt at helping to germinate an indie media collective. (Previous ones have led to shared A/V production facilities that are no longer in existence, this one was more focused on virtual platforms due to the lower overhead.) 

Many years of hard work followed, where we produced and released books, comics, illustrated books, audio books with dedicated original soundtracks, albums, and collaborated a great deal with many other creative groups and production companies. Pictured above were our releases prior to 2009. 

Since then we made the concerted decision to maintain Mythos Media as a brand representing quality, off the path content. Anyone involved can forge their relationships with whatever publishing or distribution approach best suits their project, as Mythos Media is no longer a publisher itself. You will likely continue to see products popping up here and there, eBooks and paperbacks, DVDs and albums, that have our logo on it. You can take that as you will, but:

In February 2011, Modern Mythology.net was opened up as a group endeavor, a site dedicated to maintaining a platform for the discussion of mythology and the independently produced media that follows from this discussion. Anyone involved can forge their relationships with whatever publishing or distribution approach best suits their project. If you join, we don't own your shit: you own your shit. Make it good.

Since February, the site very quickly grew to a steady 20,000 - 30,000 visitors a month, all coming to investigate original content on mythology crossing and incorporating many supposedly disparate disciplines: art, writing, linguistics, philosophy, anthropology, systems theory, psychology, film. While this many visitors doesn’t represent a huge marketing success, as many world-class blogs such as Huffington Post easily see more than that many visitors in a day. However, when you consider the subject matter and our approach, it seems to indicate an interest in what is a rather enigmatic subject.

This project began a creative collective, and it remains one, for all of those who are interested in joining and driven enough to play on the level. --James Curcio

The Impact

Framing myth in this light makes the discussion of the subject anything but “coffeeshop talk.” Modern myth is on the lips, minds, and knife-points of those in the midst of active revolution, as well as those working in media. In fact, all that is represented, all that we could form an opinion on as we form an opinion on it, is in that process entering the realm of myth. 


Our over-arching goal is to show people how important myths and narratives are in their lives, and to help give them a tool-kit to better navigate this literary understanding of consciousness. See http://www.modernmythology.net/p/what-is-modern-myth.html to get a better sense of the scope of this project. 


What We Need & What You Get


The funds we are raising are for :
1. Setup and other fees for the publication of the "Apocalyptic Imaginary: Best of Modern Mythology 2011" anthology, which covers a wide range of important topics from the arts, culture, literature, all with our eclectic and often irreverent edge. 

2. Extended production for the launch of a Modern Mythology podcast. Funds will allow for us to provide on-site coverage and extend production, as well as development of this program as part of our ongoing classroom outreach that has already started at SUNY Binghamton.

3. The funds will also be used to spread awareness of all elements of this project-- brochures, flyers, and presence at relevant conventions and conferences in 2012. 

4. Tech- hosting, domains, etc.


Every little bit helps and those who contribute will receive special perks & publications! 


Other Ways You Can Help


Share this link, or pass your friends along to http://www.ModernMythology.net to see the extensive amount of work we've already done in 2011 and 2010.

story:
What would happen if many layers of a community came together 

to celebrate the special moments in their neighborhood children's lives? 

This is exactly what we will be doing in the 

City Heights neighborhood of San Diego over the next ten months, with

The Nature of a Door is to be Opened!!!

 

My name is Brandie Maddalena; I am a social sculptor and installation artist. The Nature of a Door is to be Opened (TNDO) came about after my husband and I attended a lecture on memory and the vulnerability of memory distortion by influences like: family photos, retold stories, and the ever-present passage of time. Much of the following evening we spent reflecting on the questionable reality of our childhood memories and ultimately the conversation turned to what will our young children remember from their experiences. For days after, I brewed on the topic a came to the conclusion that those small moments of our childhoods make up the rich tapestries of our lives, a true common ground experience that could be shared thoughout a community. The idea settled into the form of an installation of cabinets, voices, art, and video, however the process of creating the installation would unite and empower a community.

Installation

Walking into TNDO, one will see 60 varying sized cabinets, fitted together in a puzzle-like formation, utilizing a wide variety of salvaged cabinet doors. This collection of individually unique pieces will be stacked up to 5 feet tall against the walls. Above them, a series of silent videos of children playing will be projected on the walls. To allow the projections to be seen, the upper part of the room will be dim and the cabinets will be lit individually with low wattage bulbs. Upon opening any of the cabinet doors, one will hear an audio recording of a young child (6 to 12-years-old) recounting her or his favorite memory. Another, older child (13 to 17-year-old) will create a visual art piece inside the cabinet to complement the young storyteller’s memory. At any given moment, several viewers will be interacting with the installation simultaneously, creating a hushed meshing or overlapping of children’s voices telling the stories. The voices will complement the projected videos of the children playing, all of whom having collaborated on the installation.

Process

Working with the nonprofit, Young Audiences of San Diego (YASD) and their networks provides great access to the organizations and individuals who are helping to create this piece. The process of creating the installation will require interpersonal connections and collaboration between several subsets of the stakeholders. They are: artists and the children, artists and the nonprofits, nonprofits with each other, and the children with the nonprofits. I am framing the lateral unification of these combinations as a social sculpture, modeling a more constructive paradigm for community development.

Selecting a Population and Site

With the assistance of YASD, I am working with students in City Heights elementary, middle, and high schools. I chose City Heights because is a clearly under-represented and underserved community; it is my home. I will site the installation within the neighborhood as an accessible source of pride, empowerment, and inspiration for the children, their families, and their community. We have contacted managers of potential sites, including City Heights/Weingart Library, City Heights Recreation Center, Price Charities (regarding vacant storefronts).


Recording Memories

A YASD artist teacher is teaching a series of story telling workshops with students (ages 6-to-12) at Central Elementary School, focusing on teaching students to recount their favorite memories in narrative form. The young storytellers will retell their memories to produce an audio recording, which they can take home on a CD. A panel of judges and I will select 60 of the most intriguing stories. The subsequent recording will be heard upon opening the door of each individual cabinet of the installation.

Visual Art for Cabinet Interiors

Skilled young artists (ages 13-to-17) will be chose one memory to inspire them to create complementary works inside sleeves, made to fit the interior space of the cabinets. The pieces will use a diverse variety of traditional media, as well as elements such as scents, temperatures, kinetics, video, and the tactile. The students will be guided through the project by their art teachers and me – at Wilson Academy, Hoover High School, Urban Discovery Academy, and JCS San Diego Academy.

Video and Picnic

After the workshops are entirely complete, I will invite all of the participants and their families to a picnic at City Heights’ Teralta Park to further unite the project community and foster socializing, networking, and cultivating friendships. The event will also provide the venue for Media Arts Center of San Diego to video the children playing, having sack races, playing tag, and hide-n-seek. This footage will go on to be projected as a silent loop on the walls above the cabinets in the installation.

Where you come in...

How can you help?

Recently, I was fortunate enough to receive the Creative Catalyst Fund (CCF) Fellowship through San Diego Foundation and I am partnering with Young Audiences of San Diego. While the CCF Fellowship funding is making this project possible, there are critical aspects of the project budget that were not covered. This is, where you come in...

I am reaching out to you to help fill the financial voids, so this project can be as amazing as the children deserve it to be.

I am asking for support to cover:

  • Studio Rent for 3 months: A place to build the project & offer studio visits/artist talks to the children -$1050
  • Picnic Expenses: Park Permit, food, games supplies - 1500
  • Totaling - $2550

What do you get for your donation?

Besides the knowledge that you have helped to provide this project with a build site and the opportunity to celebrating community cooperation, you have given your support to uniting communities through art making! 
 
You are empowering children, their families, artists, and a under-served neighborhood!!!
 
You will also receive some pretty cool perks for your bucks too! Oh, and don't forget: my unending appreciation...  :)

Spread the word!!!! pretty please!

If this campaign is going to be successful, I NEED your help to spread the word. Please try any or all of these methods of sending a link to the campaign to your people:
  • Post  on Facebook and Twitter - "Share" it
  • Emails (Personalized or Group)
  • Talk to folks! Afterall, the point of the piece is to develop community!

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

story:
The Inspiration

This set of cards was inspired by conversations with friends about how our cycles harmonize with what's going on in nature around us.  I wanted to visualize these connections, so I created an image for each phase of the menstrual cycle, one for each season, and one for each lunar phase.  I created the images by collaging photographs of fabrics.

The images will be published as 2" x 6" cards, Tarot-style, so they can be laid out in various ways to reflect each woman's experience.  They can also be used as bookmarks.


The booklet is written with young women in mind.  It contains meditation prompts and information about how each phase may influence our emotions and stimulate spiritual growth.  It is not a complete guide to the menstrual cycle, but the card set would make a great menarche gift combined with other resources.

Please see the image gallery for pictures of the cards and other perks.

Next Steps
The cards and booklet are finished and ready to print.  I am working with a playing & tarot card printing company to ensure that the cards will be durable and beautiful.  

The minimum print run for this custom size is 1,000 sets, so the challenge now is to raise enough money to pay for it.  I hope to do that mainly through pre-orders.  My goal is to have the cards ready to ship to customers by mid-November.

About the Artist

Six years ago I started a business making and selling cloth menstrual pads at amysragbag.com.  For a couple years I had a booth at my local farmers market.  It has been incredibly rewarding to connect with women and have positive conversations about menstruation, which is too often considered taboo.  I love hearing women say that they're looking forward to their periods, sometimes for the first time in their lives.

I recently moved to Arcosanti, a community and an architectural experiment in central Arizona.  I am a student at Prescott College, studying social ecology and sustainable community development.

story: .

The Lady Sassafras:Funking Up The Playa

Do you love to get Funky on the Playa? The Lady Sassafras, the playa riverboat built in New Orleans, Louisiana,is looking to keep the jiveing music alive! And we need your Help! Our sound-system needs a new mixer, monitor and a plethora of cables in order to groove her custom built 12,000 watt sound-system. As guardians of the Funk and Groove for the past five Burning Mans, we have played the best in New Orleans Funk, Soul, Rhythm-and-Blues, and Hip-Hop on the Playa. The Lady Sassafras is a welcome alternative to the dub-step and electronica that you can hear everywhere else in Black Rock City. Help us keep the funk alive in 2013, and give a donation towards our missing sound pieces.
If you love the Lady Sassafras, and want to continue dancing to her Funky Sounds, please donate and help us keep the Funk alive! Shake what your Mama gave ya'!!!!!!

story:
WHO WE ARE

Project Dispatch is a mail order artwork subscription service that was started in 2009 with the idea of creating a space for artists to get exposure and sell their work, as well as a place for collectors to begin acquiring artwork and engaging directly with the artists involved.

Our subscriptions range from $30 per month to $90 per month, customizable for durations of 3, 6, or 12 months. We currently have 22 artist members, and subscribers can receive original artwork from the artist of their choice each month, or be surprised by a new artist with each installment. 

Project Dispatch is centered around collecting, and we want to take our ideas a step further and encouraging collecting on the most basic level...TRADING CARDS! This campaign is to raise money to professionally produce a large run of artist trading cards that will include reproductions of works made specifically for the project by all 22 artists.

We hope to expand our appeal with these trading cards by interacting with a variety of retail venues and broadening our reach to a wider audience to gain more exposure for our artists. These trading cards will encourage revenue that will sustain Project Dispatch and help us grow, so that we can continue to bring you artwork in the form of monthly subscriptions!  

 

WHAT WE NEED

Our goal for this project is to raise $8,500 to cover the costs of design, layout, and production of the cards, as well as payment to artists, shipping, and production costs of the awesome perks that we are offering as a thank you for your support. 

Here is the breakdown:

Digital Conversion of original cards - $100

Design and Layout of unique cards, front and back - $500

Cost to produce through Choice Marketing, Inc. Sports Cards - $5,350 (this quote includes 2,500 packs with 8 cards per pack and 44 unique cards, with foil imprinted wrapper)

Cost of gum to include in each pack - $450

Estimated cost of offered perks, payment to artists, and shipping - $2,100

TOTAL = $8,500

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Help us spread the word about our campaign by:

Directing people to our fundraising page: igg.me/at/projectdispatch

Sharing information about our campaign and following us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Project-Dispatch/144285334913

Subscribing to Project Dispatch on our website: www.projectdispatch.com

 

THANK YOU!!!
story_txt:
WHO WE ARE
Project Dispatch is a mail order artwork subscription service that was started in 2009 with the idea of creating a space for artists to get exposure and sell their work, as well as a place for collectors to begin acquiring artwork and engaging directly with the artists involved.
Our subscriptions range from $30 per month to $90 per month, customizable for durations of 3, 6, or 12 months. We currently have 22 artist members, and subscribers can receive original artwork from the artist of their choice each month, or be surprised by a new artist with each installment. 
Project Dispatch is centered around collecting, and we want to take our ideas a step further and encouraging collecting on the most basic level...TRADING CARDS! This campaign is to raise money to professionally produce a large run of artist trading cards that will include reproductions of works made specifically for the project by all 22 artists.
We hope to expand our appeal with these trading cards by interacting with a variety of retail venues and broadening our reach to a wider audience to gain more exposure for our artists. These trading cards will encourage revenue that will sustain Project Dispatch and help us grow, so that we can continue to bring you artwork in the form of monthly subscriptions!  
 


WHAT WE NEED
Our goal for this project is to raise $8,500 to cover the costs of design, layout, and production of the cards, as well as payment to artists, shipping, and production costs of the awesome perks that we are offering as a thank you for your support. 
Here is the breakdown:
Digital Conversion of original cards - $100
Design and Layout of unique cards, front and back - $500
Cost to produce through Choice Marketing, Inc. Sports Cards - $5,350 (this quote includes 2,500 packs with 8 cards per pack and 44 unique cards, with foil imprinted wrapper)
Cost of gum to include in each pack - $450
Estimated cost of offered perks, payment to artists, and shipping - $2,100
TOTAL = $8,500
 


OTHER WAYS TO HELP
Help us spread the word about our campaign by:
Directing people to our fundraising page: igg.me/at/projectdispatch
Sharing information about our campaign and following us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Project-Dispatch/144285334913
Subscribing to Project Dispatch on our website: www.projectdispatch.com
 
THANK YOU!!!

story:
PROJECT SUMMARY

The purpose of the trip is to bring a sound installation produced by myself and other Mass Art students to Edinburgh, Scotland to initiate an artistic exchange and relationship between the SIM department at Mass Art and the media programs at the Edinburgh College of Art (part of the University of Edinburgh). The exchange would begin in Boston with a composition specifically produced for the installation, which would then be installed in Edinburgh by me. I will then collaborate with and invite the artistic community there to respond in kind with their own interpretation for the installation, which would then be brought back and installed in Boston. This project has three key objectives: to gain greater exposure for and deepen the relevance of new media practices to contemporary art and life; to initiate a long-term artistic relationship between two significant institutions of art; to further my own work as a sound artist and designer by necessarily involving interaction and multi-sensory experience.


MORE DETAILS


The installation involves hanging a room with â€œsinging mirrorâ€ devices, which I have designed and will construct from two-way reflective glass, motion sensors, and programmed micro-controllers with audio speakers. They will at first appear like common bathroom cabinet style mirrors. Each device contains a recording of one voice, or track, of an audio composition written specifically for the piece.


This composition is a collaboration between myself and the Mass Art choir, a group spearheaded by DMI graduate student Amber Vistein. Over the coming summer, I will be meeting with interested students to conduct workshops in composition of a mulch-instrument piece of music that can be easily arranged multiple ways. This approach was partially inspired by artist Darren Solomonâ€™s http://inbflat.net/, which is a good example of a collaborative composition which functions in this way, although virtually. Up to ten other people who commit to the project will have one month to work independently and together to finish the composition. Participation is open to current Mass Art undergraduates, graduates, faculty, staff, and alumni who still have a significant relationship to the Mass Art community. During this time I will also be able to finish construction on the remaining devices.

The devices function when viewer-listeners approach the mirrors and trigger the sensor as they view themselves in the surface of the piece. The objective is to allow viewer-listeners to participate in a unique arrangement by absent performers in a hybrid experience of live event and documentation. By seeing themselves on the surface of the devices that control the aural dimension of the piece, the dis-embodied performers become re-embodied by their audience. This calls particular attention to questions of presence and absence of the body in performance, and the relationship between an intellectual and physical experience of a work of art. The arrangement of the music is not only determined by the presence of an audience, but is affected by the size of audience and the degree to which members of it work together.


WHY?

Edinburgh is a culturally rich city. It is the home of the famous Fringe festival, several royal and private galleries of art, and, in particular, the Edinburgh College of Art. When the College of Art fused with the University of Edinburgh this past summer, it came to include literary, musical, and new media departments it had never had before. Similarly, with the SIM program, Mass Art is one of the other few institutions in the world where mixed and new media can be deeply explored from a basis in the visual arts.

I have visited the University of Edinburgh before. I have recently been in contact with Dr. Michael Edwards, the program director of the Digital Composition and Performance department and staff in the Sound Design department. He has expressed strong interest in the project and allowed me to join a closed online network of students in those departments in order to discuss ideas.

By fostering an exchange between Mass Art and the University of Edinburgh specifically with new media work, this project will initiate a potentially rich relationship between two cutting edge artistic communities and clear a road for future collaboration, contacts, and experimentation. Like the mirrors within the work itself, the installation is both a self-contained piece of art and an invitation for the viewers to reflect back.


WHAT I NEED

Travel and housing is the most expensive part of this project, but the materials for the installation equally necessitate funding. $30 is one night of lodging! $80 is one device within the installation! Every little bit helps!


ROUND TRIP TICKET BETWEEN BOSTON AND EDINBURGH (off season): ~$1125

CHEAPEST POSSIBLE ACCOMMODATION IN THE UNIVERSITY DORMS (one month) ~$900

MATERIALS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF INSTALLATION (circuits, speakers, mirrors, tools, etc) ~960

TOTAL BEFORE COST OF FOOD, ADDITIONAL EXPENSES, LABOR ETC $3000!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Come over and solder circuits with me! But also, spread the word! Forward this to anyone you think would be interested in seeing this project happen.

story:
Short Summary

The Memphis Poetry Slam Team better known as The P.E.O.P.L.E. (Poets Embodying Only Perfected Live Entertainment) needs your help to send six amazing poets to the Southern Fried Poetry Slam this June in Greenville, SC! Our journeys have all come together to take Memphis back to a place where we have not gone in over a decade. We have been writing together, performing at open mics, and competing to earn our spot on the team. Now the time is here, we are rehearsing, spending time away from families, editing our poems, and preparing them to get ready for the regional stage. We are so excited to represent Memphis, TN the home of the blues in SC but we need to help to raise the money to get ourselves there before we have the blues.

Attending Southern Fried Slam is about more than competition. Though it will be exciting to go head-to-head with other poets and showcase the content of the writing that we are so proud of, Southern Fried is about the journey. We are a diverse group of fathers, mothers, broken homes, lost friends, rookie competitors, religions, backgrounds, and lifestyles. What is absolutely special is that this journey has bonded us to the art. It is an opportunity to be exposed to all kinds of poets, new ways of expressing ourselves, and to see if we can conquer the stage. We will come home even more excited about this art form and its possibilities to share with the next generation of slam poets to start a legacy and true revitalization of the slam scene in Memphis.

The main expenses for our trip are registration, transportation, and lodging. Registration has been paid for out of our own pockets. We are also covering our meals, pooling our resources for practice space and travel. We are working individuals whom understand the value of the dollar. Your contribution to the campaign will go directly to expenses for travel and lodging and will open the way for us to reach the goal we've worked towards since our formation.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for fundraising is to raise $2,000 in one month. Registration cost $350 (which we paid ourselves) As of now, the most budget efficient method of travel is a passenger van. But the cost of gas and rental are expensive. 

To make it to Southern Fried with our 6 person team, we need to account for:

Passenger van rental + gas : $900

Accommodations: $1668

Registration: $350

____________________________________________________________________

Total: $2918

We have made installments as a unit to participate as a representative and collaborative effort. Any additional funds, we raise will go to feeding us while we're there and then to providing a workshop to develop and encourage the next year’s team. 

We hope that the chance to help send six poets to a national poetry event is a reward in itself, but beyond our unending gratitude, there are some other perks for all you generous P.E.O.P.L.E out there aiming to support some dream chasers. 

The Impact

Spoken word poetry is one of many branches of the ancient oral tradition. Young and old alike are empowered to speak their own truths and also learn to listen to what other people are trying to convey. That is true COMMUNICATION and true UNITY, which for The P.E.O.P.L.E. equates to COMMUNITY. Yes, competing on a national scale is a wonderful endeavor, but our ultimate goal is present our city in a positive light and show the world that Memphis is STILL viable factor in the poetry.

We haven’t gone anywhere. We have been here all along.  Now is the time for the world to see what we have known all along. Good things come from Memphis TN!

Other Ways You Can Help

And of course, there are other ways to support our effort without money! Our fans, friends and families can help by spreading the word about our campaign to people they know. Use your social media site accounts (Facebook, Twitter, InstaGram, etc…), smoke signals or whatever and let the world know what  The P.E.O.P.L.E. are doing and how they can help. IndieGoGo even has “share” tools, to facilitate the passing along of this awesome (and historic) campaign.

Thank you SO much for your help. Without the audience, there would be no poetry slam. We are writing for you!

Please stay tuned for updates from our team! We're so excited to share our work with you.

story:
Kente Cloth

Kente cloth is one of the most treasured textiles in all of Africa.  It has traditionally been worn by kings, chiefs and queen mothers’ during celebrations, ceremonies, and other important events.  There are hundreds of kente patterns, each with a unique meaning.  The tradition of weaving is generally passed from generation to generation within the same family.  This labor intense process produces a tightly woven patterned fabric still used by village leaders to this day.  Popularity of the fabric has led to many contemporary uses including clothing, bags, and wall décor to name a few.

Goal $2000

Featured Artisan / Kente Cloth Weaver

Currently there are six weavers who will participate in the collective project.  Christian Atsu is one our featured artisans from the area.  He is from a family of weavers going back three generations in his family.  This tradition will be passed down from him to the next generation to carry on this beautiful art form for both its utilitarian and decorative purposes. 

Project Collaborators

Jahzara Mayes Otoo, is a graduate student in Educational Leadership.  Jahzara has traveled back and forth to Ghana several times over the last three years.  The experience proved to be life changing.  After the first visit to Ghana, Jahzara garnered the assistance of family, friends, and local community members to support a library project for a small school in Ayensudo, Ghana, West Africa.  The project was well received and the children received books to add their collection at their school.  After her most recent visit Jahzara was inspired to work on a new project in collaboration with Armour of Hope Foundation, a small NGO in Ghana.  Jahzara lives in Detroit, Michigan.

Lailai Otoo, Founder of Armour of Hope Foundation, Ghana, West Africa is a Ghanaian national who knows the plight of his people.  In his words “When people are in need and no one assists them, it reflects on the entire society in which you and I dwell and is a concern for all humanity”.  After surveying the Volta Region, Lailai’s heart was touched to help the talented Ewe weavers in the area.  He recognized that with a small amount of money, the lives of the artisans families could be greatly impacted.  The artisans are talented and experts in their field but lack the business acumen to move forward and grow their craft industry.  Mr. Otoo has pledged to help these artisans maintain this wonderful artistic craft of kente weaving in the Volta Region.

 

Funds will be used to:

  • Purchase materials for kente weaving
  • Repair and maintain weaving equipment
  • Begin a training program to train young weavers to carry on the tradition
  • Net funds gained from sales will be used to reinvest in the project to create self-sufficiency

Join Us

We are so passionate about this project and we grateful to all of you who will be joining us to support the kente cloth weavers in the Volta Region of Ghana, West Africa.  Your support can have a real impact and you get to be a part of bringing these weavers the support they need so their artisan collective can reach its full potential.

 

So if you feel inspired to take action with us, please do so. 

  1. Create your indiegogo account and make your pledge.
  2. You will receive your perk approximately by September 30, 2013.
  3. Please spread the word to all your friends and family so they too can join us.  Use the indiegogo share tools.

Acknowledgements

Thanks to everyone who is helping us achieve the dream of bringing self-sufficiency and growth to the artisan kente weavers of Sanga in the Volta Region of Ghana, West Africa.  We are extremely excited about bringing this project to its full capacity!

story:
Maybe some of you know I have this obsession with old things, especially those made out of metal... old cars, trains, typewriters, machinery and gears, European motorcycles, planes from the 20's & 30's, cameras, etc. I am not sure when this started but doing photography I noticed that these are the things I seek out.

I first spotted this beautiful piece of wintergreen metal a few years ago sitting outside a friends house and when I got my tax returns earlier this year, considering the car hadn't moved at all in that amount of time, I talked him into letting me buy it. I knew the car was going to be a big project when I bought it because you could get high off the smell of the fungus growing on the floorboards. But I thought the work needed would be more aesthetic stuff like redoing the interior versus all the mechanical problems that have been created from the car just sitting for to long. The body itself though is close to mint condition with barely any rust or dings.
I have been lucky enough to have a friend do a ton of work on it already these last few months and I have learned a lot myself in the process by helping and mostly watching. Rather then give up now and sell the car, I really want to try and raise enough money to get it in working condition. The money is for a variety of things, but the major two expenses are a new gas tank and new tires, and I also might have to take it to a mechanic for recommendation on some issues.
The fact I haven't owned a car for the past five years and only commute by bike or bus might not give me the right to own a gas guzzling 64' Rambler but that could be a debatable subject. Considering I will only be using the car on occasion its more cost effective for me to own a classic car then it is to buy something newer. Not only is it already paid off but my insurance is half of what it would be then if it was a newer car that i had to make payments on. And in the future chances are if something goes wrong it will be something I can fix myself or with the help of a friend.

When I heard about a similar website like this I did some research and voila this is what I got.
In exchange for donations to help get my car working you will receive art made by me. I will be doing a new series of 25-8x10" pen & ink drawings of classic cars (mostly derived from photographs I have shot). If you make a donation and have a specific kind of car you would like to be included in series please let me know asap and I can add it.


Questions you might have...

What if you don't have any interest in classic cars but still want to donate?
A)If you are seeking no perks you can call it a birthday present because my b-day is coming up on June 19th or B)You have the option to pick another subject matter for drawings. However, I cannot do this for every donation so I am saying if you donate $50 or more the subject matter can be negotiable.

Why do I need a car?
I would really like to be able to do some things most people take for granted. For example: Not have to ride my bike during the winter for groceries or have to make two trips when need things like cat litter, be able to go to all the close-by hiking spots and not have to rely on only being able to go when friends can, be able to go across town and not have it be an hour (one-way) bus trip and most importantly being able to transport art to/from shows.

What if I don't reach my goal amount? 

If I don't reach your entire goal I still be using the money as I get it towards fixing up the car. That way in case I don't make all the money and get it running it will be of better value if I am forced to sell it :(

The worse consequence will be that I will most likely move away this fall. I can not survive another winter here mentally without having means of transportation to get out once in awhile.


What is the money going towards exactly?

In rough order of priority:

Fuel sending unit and gas tank - $390+
Filters and hoses - $40
Oil change - $30
Battery cable - $15
Tires & brakes - $400
Windshield wipers - $15
Weatherstripping -$200?
Carpet kit - $150
Upholstery - $200
Labor - $500+ (this cost will depend on if I have to take it somewhere)
As you may notice this is more then desired amount of $1500 but I am hoping a few months from now I will have found an additional PT job.


FYI: I recommend PayPal over credit cards because there are less fees involved.

If you do not want to pay by credit card or PayPal you can send checks to 4929 SE Hawthorne Blvd. #305, Portland, OR 97215

If you are poor like me and can't donate I totally understand but you can still help me by getting the word out to as many friends and family as possible.

Thank you very much for your time, and stay tuned for more updates on here and then I will be posting pics on Flickr acct http://www.flickr.com/photos/lizmacgregorart/
story_txt:
Maybe some of you know I have this obsession with old things, especially those made out of metal... old cars, trains, typewriters, machinery and gears, European motorcycles, planes from the 20's & 30's, cameras, etc. I am not sure when this started but doing photography I noticed that these are the things I seek out.I first spotted this beautiful piece of wintergreen metal a few years ago sitting outside a friends house and when I got my tax returns earlier this year, considering the car hadn't moved at all in that amount of time, I talked him into letting me buy it. I knew the car was going to be a big project when I bought it because you could get high off the smell of the fungus growing on the floorboards. But I thought the work needed would be more aesthetic stuff like redoing the interior versus all the mechanical problems that have been created from the car just sitting for to long. The body itself though is close to mint condition with barely any rust or dings.I have been lucky enough to have a friend do a ton of work on it already these last few months and I have learned a lot myself in the process by helping and mostly watching. Rather then give up now and sell the car, I really want to try and raise enough money to get it in working condition. The money is for a variety of things, but the major two expenses are a new gas tank and new tires, and I also might have to take it to a mechanic for recommendation on some issues.The fact I haven't owned a car for the past five years and only commute by bike or bus might not give me the right to own a gas guzzling 64' Rambler but that could be a debatable subject. Considering I will only be using the car on occasion its more cost effective for me to own a classic car then it is to buy something newer. Not only is it already paid off but my insurance is half of what it would be then if it was a newer car that i had to make payments on. And in the future chances are if something goes wrong it will be something I can fix myself or with the help of a friend. When I heard about a similar website like this I did some research and voila this is what I got. In exchange for donations to help get my car working you will receive art made by me. I will be doing a new series of 25-8x10" pen & ink drawings of classic cars (mostly derived from photographs I have shot). If you make a donation and have a specific kind of car you would like to be included in series please let me know asap and I can add it.Questions you might have...What if you don't have any interest in classic cars but still want to donate?A)If you are seeking no perks you can call it a birthday present because my b-day is coming up on June 19th or B)You have the option to pick another subject matter for drawings. However, I cannot do 
this for every donation so I am saying if you donate $50 or more the 
subject matter can be negotiable.Why do I need a car?I would really like to be able to do some things most people take for granted. For example: Not have to ride my bike during the winter for groceries or have to make two trips when need things like cat litter, be able to go to all the close-by hiking spots and not have to rely on only being able to go when friends can, be able to go across town and not have it be an hour (one-way) bus trip and most importantly being able to transport art to/from shows.
What if I don't reach my goal amount? If I don't reach your entire goal I still be using the 
money as I get it towards fixing up the car. That way in case I don't 
make all the money and get it running it will be of better value if I 
am forced to sell it :( 
The worse consequence will be that I will most likely move away this fall. I can not survive another winter here mentally without having means of transportation to get out once in awhile.

What is the money going towards exactly?
In rough order of priority:
Fuel sending unit and gas tank - $390+Filters and hoses - $40Oil change - $30Battery cable - $15Tires & brakes - $400Windshield wipers - $15Weatherstripping -$200?Carpet kit - $150Upholstery - $200Labor - $500+ (this cost will depend on if I have to take it somewhere)As you may notice this is more then desired amount of $1500 but I am hoping a few months from now I will have found an additional PT job.

FYI: I recommend PayPal over credit cards because there are less fees involved.

If you do not want to pay by credit card or PayPal you can send checks to 4929 SE Hawthorne Blvd. #305, Portland, OR 97215


If you are poor like me and can't donate I totally understand but you can still help me by getting the word out to as many friends and family as possible.
Thank you very much for your time, and stay tuned for more updates on here and then I will be posting pics on Flickr acct http://www.flickr.com/photos/lizmacgregorart/

story:
Short Summary

Hello world!

I am Georgios Ernesto Mourelatos, actor, theatre director and writer. Many of you know me personally or are familiar with my work.

If not or to refresh your mind, take a look here: http://giorgosmourelatos.com.

For the past 31 years I was living in Greece, where I was involved with what I absolutely love in life, arts. Last year I decided to move to London, to chase my dream for personal and artistic development, to find new ways of expression and widening my knowledge in arts. Also to study about researching new ways of artistic expression.

Moving to London means having a difficult life. The cost of life is enormous. Food is ok but the rent, the bills, the taxes are quite difficult to manage. For example, my rent is 415 pounds per month, bills are 200 pounds per month (eating/heating etc), transpot is 140 pounds per month, coucil tax is 100 pounds per month and other expenses such pocket money is what is left from my monthly payment. I can manage with dignity and pride thus I am really proud about that. And all this in about 4 months time starting from zero.

I have to work 12 hours per day in all sorts of jobs and works, so I can afford my staying here. I do not mind working and I do not mind being exhausted. Though, I did not come here to be magnificent at a restaurant work. I came here to advance in art. One of the things I was planning to do arriving in the UK is to publish my written work. My play, called "A Stone in the Water", is my next book to be published. Also, besides this I have all sorts of stuff in mind as my next projects. 

For creating my new book, which is about deafness, and doing everyday artistic and not only tasks, a strong computer is required. Unfortunately, I only have a small netbook, which can barely make it through simple processes, for example opening chrome tabs. So, I find myself in desperate need of a new computer, that will help me not only finish and publish my new book but will also allow me to continue doing so in the future. It will be a great help with my university studies, here in the UK as well.

My Previous Two Published Books

So far, I have published two poetry books, both in Greek. This one, "A Stone in the Water", will be in both English and Greek. Please, take a look on the links below:

  • "En Archi In to Telos" ("The End was at the Beginning") 

http://www.blurb.co.uk/books/2523793

  • "Allergies" (Allergies")

http://www.blurb.co.uk/books/3464551

What I Need

Living in London is really difficult and expensive. I cannot bear the cost of a new or even a used computer. I need to gather some funds so I can afford one. And for this, I could really use your help.

How You Can Help

Your help is and will be really appreciated. 

I am not asking for much. Even 1 pound is enough. Though, by donating one of the following ammounts below, you will be getting some small presents by me. :)

(P.S. you can donate in euros or dollars as well. The conversion happens automatically.)

  • By donating 1 pound, you will be getting my new book in an e-book format, in the language of your preference (Greek or English). 
  • By donating 10 pounds, you enlist for my next 5 books, in an e-book format, in the language of your preference (Greek or English).
  • By donating 20-49 pounds, you will receive my next 10 books in an e-book version, in the language of your preference (Greek or English).
  • By donating 50-99 pounds you will be getting a real, signed copy of my book to your address, in the language of your preference (Greek or English).-
  • By donating 100 pounds or more you will be getting a real, signed copy of my book to your address, in the language of your preference (Greek or English) and a lifetime subscription of my books, in an e-book format.

A Promise

For all of you that know me, you already know I am not a person that asks for things. It is really difficult for me and took me a lot of time to finally go through with this campaign.

For those of you that do not know me personally, you might find it as a weird request. You might not trust me enough to help me. What I can say about me is that  I am just an artist trying to find his way and his tools for creating genuine art. How would someone describe me:

"He is a passing shadow amongst people, trying to leave some kind of a footprint…"

I personally promise to you that any funds gathered from this campaign will solely be used for the purpose of acquiring a new laptop computer. And by that I do mean solely.

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to contibute to my campaign with a donation. It is understandable. This doesn’t mean you cannot help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools for that but also facebook, twitter and anything else you might think it would a good idea.
  • Help me reach my goal and get a new computer, so I can continue my artistic work!

And many thanks for taking the time to read my long description. 

Please, remember to spread the word about my campaign, to friends, family and the rest of the world!

Other Ways You Can Help
You might not be able to contibute to my campaign with a donation. It is understandable. This doesn’t mean you cannot help:

Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools for that but also facebook, twitter and anything else you might think it would a good idea.
Help me reach my goal and get a new computer, so I can continue my artistic work!

And many thanks for taking the time to read my long description. 

Please, remember to spread the word about my campaign, to friends, family and the rest of the world!

story:
http://vimeo.com/66173360

    August 21st, 2013 marks the 150th anniversary of the destruction and subsequent rebirth of the city of LAWRENCE Kansas. That day William Quantrill and his pro-slavery raiders ravaged the community with carnage and arson. Nearly 200 men and boys were slaughtered, and according to one report “the dead lay all along the street”. All but two businesses were burned to the ground, countless homes were destroyed and the city was left in smoldering ruins.     

The spirit of our community was NOT extinguished that day; instead we arose –LIKE THE PHOENIX- out of the ashes.

     The Phoenix is a universally recognized symbol representing the cycle of life, death and rebirth. Lawrence adopted this icon after the raid, as featured on our city’s seal.

 

 

     The Phoenix sculpture, measuring nearly 20 foot tall, with an equally impressive wingspan, will be constructed primarily out of western red cedar. Once erected the sculpture will weather on site, giving the community time to view the Phoenix and contemplate its pending destruction

     The destruction ceremony, planned for Labor Day Weekend, will include historical speakers, live music (organized by Tyler Gregory) and performances by Foxy by Proxy Revue. The bird will be set ablaze by members of the Lawrence community and/or campaign contributors.

    I would like to thank the people of Phoenixville Pennsylvania's Firebird Festival for allowing me to capitalize on thier 2006 Phoenix design. The main armature (pictured) will remain almost identical. The re-design for the Lawrence Phoenix Festival is slightly more elongated at the wings and tail and will sit upon a four foot pedastal for added height. 

 

      Your donations will be used to purchase building materials needed to construct this immense work, and to offset the various fees/overhead costs of the festival itself. Any amount is appreciated. If you aren’t able to contribute PLEASE SHARE THIS with everyone you can!

By contributing to this campaign you will help bring to life a grassroots festival that truly represents the creative spirit, uniqueness and resilience of Lawrence Kansas and it's people.

-Rexy Bodean, Project Creator

 

 

Original Artwork by Julia Wagner that will be featured on a decal, coffee mug and t-shirt.

story:
Short Summary - Mobile Visionary Art Temple

The iTemple Voyager is the concept of a traveling exhibit of spiritual and healing art from nationally recognized, Oregon-based, artist Aaron Michael Pyne. The traveling exhibit will include a large scale outdoor Visionary Art gallery, meditation workshops, projections, chill space, and energy healing sessions. The temple will also include a marketplace of spiritual and holistic products for sale.  Each community visited by the iTemple Voyager will be exposed to a new, deeper, spirituality through it's offerings.

The iTemple Voyager will be Aaron Pyne’s widest reaching expression yet.

The goal is to take the exhibit to as many places as possible , including art, music and spirituality festivals in Washington, Oregon, and California. After our first run this summer, we intend to find avenues to take the iTemple further heading east across the country to festivals.

Breif bio of the creator
Aaron Michael Pyne

Over the last 11 years I have worked to share my understanding of basic spiritual truths and practices through various creative channels. I have done web, graphic, and video design for large and small scale spiritual and holistic businesses. I have created more than 140 visionary pieces of art that are encoded with spiritual symbolism to serve as portals for the viewer to access their own inner divinity. My artwork has been featured in shows, events, and magazines across the country. I have taught a wide variety of meditation styles including: breath work, chakra work, advanced energy healing techniques, spiritual dance, shamanic journeying and other various formats to access one’s spirit guides, angelic guides, and other multi-dimensional beings. I am trained and certified in a variety of energy healing/holistic moralities. I also avidly promote the ability for each individual to access the infinite divine potential within them.

Currently in my home town of Bend, Oregon I have started the iTemple – a community gathering space where I have been hosting a variety of spiritual events including:

• Ecstatic Free Form Dance (which gave birth to the co-operative team-run www.pulsebend.com group)
• Ecstatic/Meditative Music Making Circles (participants bring whatever instruments they have and we come together in shared music making)
• Meditation Classes
• Healing Circles
• Solstice & Equinox Ceremonies

Inspirational Background

The concept of a Mobile Visionary Art Temple was channeled to/through me while I was in meditation. Through a series of synchronistic events and manifestations, the camper trailer and a car suitable to pull it already came to be an actuality! The idea of this project and its birthing were entirely inspired and made manifest by a higher purpose.

The Plan

The Traveling iTemple Voyager includes many facets that give those that interact with it a variety of paths for spiritual experience.


1. ART | The main feature will be the visionary art. The art will be shared in the following formats:

  1. On 6’x6’ vinyl curtains. The trailer will be wrapped with one in the front, one in back, and two on the side.

  2. There will need to be space for ropes extended off the trailer in all directions with more curtains hanging from it. Depending on finances available, an extensive network of curtains hanging from ropes could be emerging from the trailer tied to poles or trees, creating a sort of visionary art gallery/maze. Pillows will be placed in front of each piece of art to offer each passerby an opportunity to sit with and interact with the art. Small lights will be in front of each piece on display, for night viewing.

  3. During evenings, one or two projectors will be mounted on the trailer projecting out onto a screen or sheet for an animated journey through my art work.

  4. In the vending area (see below) the art will be available for sale in various formats including the curtains, blankets, canvas, prints, and tiles.

  5. The Trailer itself will also be decorated with LED lights and sacred ornaments to compliment the artwork.

2. ALTARS | There is the potential for those who wish to create altars and sit with altars that integrate and expand out from the art gallery.

3. HEALING | Aaron will offer “Energetic Vitalization” energy healing sessions inside the comforts of the trailer. These will be 30 minute or 1 hour sessions for a set fee or sliding scale. The participant will come into the trailer where a twin bed will be setup as sacred space for a healing journey. The session includes discussion, meditation guidance/journey, and light touch healing work. (*There is a possibility of other practitioners/body workers to use the space). The interior will be decorated in sacred alignment.

4. MEDITATION | Aaron will offer one or two guided meditation workshop/classes near the trailer. Participants will be surrounded by the art and be guided through a meditation. A variety of meditation topics are available that can be decided upon before the festival as needed for marketing purposes.

5. CHILL SPACE | In the evenings pillows/cushions can be setup near the trailer and art as a small communal chill/relaxation space. Tea could be served from the trailer. Also a small music system can be playing relaxing/ambient music for those using the space.

6. VENDING – SPIRITUAL MARKETPLACE | In front of the trailer (under an awning) will be a small magical marketplace that will a variety of items from artists, healers, and businesses Aaron has worked with.

Potential retail items include:

  1. Aaron’s visionary artwork

  2. Locally made/organic/natural body products

  3. JEM Organic Nut Butters

  4. Meditation CDs

  5. Health supplements

  6. Hand crafted jewelry and leatherwork by Oregon artists

  7. Oregon made healthy/organic snacks/drinks including Top Leaf Yerba Maté

A few vendors on board so far: 

  • Jam Raw Chocolate
  • Jonathan Goldman's Healing Sounds
  • Top Leaf Yerba Maté
  • Elf Mountain

"Rising through the Dimensions of Your Divinity"

Current Status | Fund Needs

Currently we have the trailer, speaker system, and several curtains. We are also in discussion with a variety of businesses to provide items for the magical marketplace. We need funding from you to help with : cost of art gallery, power systems, projectors, lighting systems, meditation pads/cushions, systems, and trailer modifications.

For You

To contributors, we will be giving away valuable goods and services including art prints, healing sessions, and even custom soul art.

  1. Constant Reminder: $5 Receive a high resolution wallpaper download (sneak peak above) of Aaron's newest artwork. This piece is currently only available here on indiegogo. Get it before the public!

  2. Divinity & Blessings: $15 Receive the above plus a 6" x 6" print of Aaron's artwork "Tree of Divine Oneness" mailed to you.

  3. Art to Inspire: $55 Receive everything above, plus an 8 1/2" x 10" print of your choice mailed to you. Over 140 artworks to choose from our Art Gallery

  4. Art & Energy Healing: $105 Receive everything listed above, plus a 15 minute energetic phone vitalization healing/ reading from Aaron.

  5. Extra Healing: $155 Receive everything listed above, but instead of a 15 minute reading, sit with Aaron for 30 minutes.

  6. Awakened Vision: $205 Receive everything above, plus an autographed 11" x 17" artwork of your choice. Over 140 artworks to choose from our Art Gallery

  7. Awakening: $555 Receive everything above plus an art blanket or an art 6' x 6' shower curtain with your choice of artwork. Over 140 artworks to choose from our Art Gallery. At this level, if you're going to be at one of our northwest festivals, your healing can be redeemed in person.


  8. Unveil Your Divinity: $1005 Receive everything above, plus a custom soul art by Aaron. An artwork with your photograph and spiritual connections. See more about this here: http://www.sacredvisiondesigns.com/personal-custom-soul-art/

  9. Transformation: $1555 Receive everything above, plus an additional two hours (making the total 2.5 hours) worth of phone readings, vitalization energetic healing, and guided meditation. (All of this could also be redeemed at a northwest event that we attend in 2014.

Festivals we are currently in discussion with (more to come!)

  1. Kalidescope Music Festival
  2. Burning Man Portland 
  3. Beloved
  4. Coyote Spirit Festival
  5. Pranafest
  6. Photosynthesis
  7. What the Festival
  8. Enchanted Forest

Nine Minute Art Presentation Demo:


Stretch Goals

If we can reach:

$8000 : This will allow us to expand our art gallery, include more meditation cushions/spacing, and offer more meditation workshops. This would also help to increase the amount of our marketplace stock

$10,000 : This will allow us to extend our reach further in the west coast as well as begin to extend our night time art display with more projected animations and larger scale sound systems for immersive multi-media spiritual presentations.

$13000 : This will open the door for us to really go on the move and take the iTemple Voyager across the country towards the east coast, setting up at events and festivals across the country.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • Sharing is caring... If this project resonates with you, please share it with those around you... send out links to your contacts, talk about it with friends. Word of mouth is always the best marketing. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share buttons to get the word out across your social networks!
  • Click the comment tab, and leave us your feedback!

Like Us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/itemplevoyager

More about the Energetic Vitalization Healing Sessions

Energetic vitalization is a method of energy healing using light-touch to help restructure and reenergize the auric field and chakra system to help bring forth, experience, and release emotional & mental patterns that are restricting the flow of Chi or Prana (life force energy) through one’s system. This Energetic Vitalization can help the receiver move through energetic blocks and open one up to a more harmonious state of being connecting more deeply with the Divinity within them.

Aaron Pyne’s Energetic Vitalization is a new method built upon over 10 years of combining various spiritual/holistic forms of energy healing. Through extensive practice, experience, and intuitive guidance, Aaron has developed his own method interweaving various spiritual understandings to help bring others into a deeper state of well-being and wholeness, leading to an intensive presence and connection with Spirit (aka God, The Divine, The Universe). Aaron helps individuals access their highest potential energies and bring them forth into current energy systems while helping to clear old emotional and mental patterns that are limiting any flow of energy and restricting one from experiencing the highest level of their reality possibilities.
