suitable to pull it already came to be an actuality! The idea of this
project and its birthing were entirely inspired and made manifest by
a higher purpose.

The
Plan

The
Traveling iTemple Voyager includes many facets that give those that interact with it a
variety of paths for spiritual experience.

1. ART
| The main feature will be the visionary art. The art will be shared
in the following formats:



	On 6’x6’ vinyl curtains. The trailer will be wrapped with one in
	the front, one in back, and two on the side.



	There will need to be space for ropes extended off the trailer in
	all directions with more curtains hanging from it. Depending on
	finances available, an extensive network of curtains hanging from
	ropes could be emerging from the trailer tied to poles or trees,
	creating a sort of visionary art gallery/maze. Pillows will be
	placed in front of each piece of art to offer each passerby an
	opportunity to sit with and interact with the art. Small lights will
	be in front of each piece on display, for night viewing.



	During evenings, one or two projectors will be mounted on the
	trailer projecting out onto a screen or sheet for an animated
	journey through my art work. 
	



	In the vending area (see below) the art will be available for sale
	in various formats including the curtains, blankets, canvas, prints,
	and tiles.



	The Trailer itself will also be decorated with LED lights and sacred
	ornaments to compliment the artwork.


2.	ALTARS
| There is the potential for those who wish to create altars and sit
with altars that integrate and expand out from the art gallery.
3.	HEALING
| Aaron will offer “Energetic Vitalization” energy healing
sessions inside the comforts of the trailer. These will be 30 minute
or 1 hour sessions for a set fee or sliding scale. The participant
will come into the trailer where a twin bed will be setup as sacred
space for a healing journey. The session includes discussion,
meditation guidance/journey, and light touch healing work. (*There is
a possibility of other practitioners/body workers to use the space).
The interior will be decorated in sacred alignment.
4.	MEDITATION
| Aaron will offer one or two guided meditation workshop/classes near
the trailer. Participants will be surrounded by the art and be guided
through a meditation. A variety of meditation topics are available
that can be decided upon before the festival as needed for marketing
purposes.
5.	CHILL
SPACE | In the evenings pillows/cushions can be setup near the
trailer and art as a small communal chill/relaxation space. Tea could
be served from the trailer. Also a small music system can be playing
relaxing/ambient music for those using the space.
6.	VENDING
– SPIRITUAL MARKETPLACE | In 
front of the trailer (under an awning) will be a small magical marketplace that 
will a variety of items from artists, healers, and businesses Aaron has worked 
with. 

Potential retail items include:



	Aaron’s visionary artwork



	Locally made/organic/natural body products



	JEM Organic Nut Butters



	Meditation CDs



	Health supplements



	Hand crafted jewelry and leatherwork by Oregon artists


Oregon made healthy/organic snacks/drinks including Top Leaf Yerba Maté

A few vendors on board so far: 

Jam Raw Chocolate

Jonathan Goldman's Healing Sounds
Top Leaf Yerba Maté
Elf Mountain





"Rising through the Dimensions of Your Divinity"Current
Status | Fund Needs

Currently
we have the trailer, speaker system, and several curtains. We are
also in discussion with a variety of businesses to provide items for
the magical marketplace. We need funding from you to help with : cost of art gallery, power systems, projectors, lighting systems, meditation pads/cushions, systems, and trailer modifications.
For
You
To
contributors, we will be giving away valuable goods and services
including art prints, healing sessions, and even custom soul art. 




	Constant Reminder: $5 Receive a high resolution wallpaper download 
	(sneak peak above) of Aaron's newest artwork. This piece is currently only
	available here on indiegogo. Get it before the public!




Divinity & Blessings: $15 Receive the above plus a 6" x 6"
	print of Aaron's artwork "Tree of Divine Oneness" mailed to you.








	Art to Inspire: $55 Receive everything above, plus an 8 1/2"
	x 10" print of your choice mailed to you. Over 140 artworks to choose from our Art Gallery



	Art & Energy Healing: $105 Receive everything listed above, plus a 15 minute energetic phone vitalization healing/ reading from Aaron.  
	



	Extra Healing: $155 Receive everything listed above, but instead of a 15
	minute reading, sit with Aaron for 30 minutes. 
	



	Awakened Vision: $205 Receive everything above, plus an autographed 11"
	x 17" artwork of your choice. Over 140 artworks to choose from our Art Gallery



	Awakening: $555 Receive everything above plus an art blanket or an art 6' x 6' shower curtain with your choice of artwork. Over 140 artworks to choose from our Art Gallery. At this level, if you're going to be at one of our northwest festivals, your healing can be redeemed in person. 
	





	Unveil Your Divinity: $1005 Receive everything above, plus a custom
	soul art by Aaron. An artwork with your photograph and spiritual connections. See more about this here:
	http://www.sacredvisiondesigns.com/personal-custom-soul-art/
Transformation: $1555 Receive everything above, plus an additional two
	hours (making the total 2.5 hours) worth of phone readings,
	vitalization energetic healing, and guided meditation. (All of this
	could also be redeemed at a northwest event that we attend in 2014.
Festivals we are currently in discussion with (more to come!)

Kalidescope Music Festival


Burning Man Portland 


Beloved


Coyote Spirit Festival


Pranafest


Photosynthesis

What the Festival
Enchanted Forest

Nine
Minute Art Presentation Demo:
Stretch GoalsIf we can reach:$8000 : This will allow us to expand our art gallery, include more meditation cushions/spacing, and offer more meditation workshops. This would also help to increase the amount of our marketplace stock$10,000 : This will allow us to extend our reach further in the west coast as well as begin to extend our night time art display with more projected animations and larger scale sound systems for immersive multi-media spiritual presentations.$13000 : This will open the door for us to really go on the move and take the iTemple Voyager across the country towards the east coast, setting up at events and festivals across the country.Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:
Sharing is caring... If this project resonates with you, please share it with those around you... send out links to your contacts, talk about it with friends. Word of mouth is always the best marketing. 
Use the Indiegogo share buttons to get the word out across your social networks!
Click the comment tab, and leave us your feedback!

Like Us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/itemplevoyagerMore
about the Energetic
Vitalization Healing Sessions

Energetic
vitalization is a method of energy healing using light-touch to help
restructure and reenergize the auric field and chakra system to help
bring forth, experience, and release emotional & mental patterns
that are restricting the flow of Chi or Prana (life force energy)
through one’s system. This Energetic Vitalization can help the
receiver move through energetic blocks and open one up to a more harmonious
state of being connecting more deeply with the Divinity within them. 


Aaron
Pyne’s Energetic Vitalization is a new method built upon
over 10 years of combining various spiritual/holistic forms of energy
healing. Through extensive practice, experience, and
intuitive guidance, Aaron has developed his own method interweaving
various spiritual understandings to help bring others into a deeper
state of well-being and wholeness, leading to an intensive presence
and connection with Spirit (aka God, The Divine, The Universe). Aaron
helps individuals access their highest potential energies and bring
them forth into current energy systems while helping to clear old
emotional and mental patterns that are limiting any flow of energy
and restricting one from experiencing the highest level of their
reality possibilities.

story:
What: Interior Form Art Exhibition curated by Brittni Winkler/ MFA thesis (FIU)

When: November 2015

Who: Artists including Matt Roy, Meifung Su, Natalia Vasquez, Susanna Harwood Rubin, Robert Sturnman, and Katie Cercone

Where: Bakehouse Art Complex/ Miami, FL


Brittni Winkler by Michael Cuartas

Intention

    Yoga and art share the ability to instantiate a disembodied, self-created experience through their connection to self-expression and healing/wellness. The practice of yoga accompanies with it the spiritual elements of the yamas and niyamas, being ethical and very connected to the internal state of being. In creating artwork this is also imminent. Karen Gibbons shares the attributes that yoga and art have in common in her book "Integrating Art and Yoga Therapy". 

These shared attributes include: a promotion of self-awareness, encouragement of a flow state, activation of the limbic brain, reduction of stress, encouragement of observation rather than judgment, encouraging change and healing. The Eastern practice of yoga is much more than just a physical workout or a great way to manage stress, it is deeply related to self-expression both scientifically and philosophically. This fundamental point shows that to practice yoga in its true form is to see it as a spiritual to physical practice, whereas in the West it is mostly seen as a purely physical workout. Swami Jnaneshvara writes in defense of yoga that it is a spiritual system with a physical component and not a physical practice with a spiritual one (http://www.swamij.com/traditional-yoga.htm). 

Katie Cercone

There have been a number of recent artistic projects that explore wellness and community. The Chill Concept (TCC) opened its international residency program for contemporary art practices in Miami, FL in October of 2013 with the purpose of creating a meeting space and exchange opportunity between creators and curators from Miami and abroad. TCC opened its doors with an extensive calendar of wellness workshops and activities like “OM Now Yoga Class” which is free and open to the public upon request. An additional example by Simone Leigh, recently collaborated with Stuyvesant Mansion to create a “Free People’s Medical Clinic” that provided a diverse schedule of events, such as the yoga class titled “‘Earth, Wind, and Fire’ Vinyasa” in Brooklyn where the artist is based.  Another instance is the Brooklyn-based Yemenwed art collective that has curated an “Empatheatre” at the Perez Art Museum Miami (PAMM) where visitors can partake in a wellness/cultural center, coming to participate in guided meditations, see performances, and more.

  I propose an exhibition that will further explore the blurred lines between art and wellness, in particular through the lens of both the practice of yoga and its relation to the visual and performance arts. It is when Maurice-Merleau Ponty says, “human reality is not body or soul, but rather that which can give rise to either of these concepts,” that both yoga and art can be seen in the same frame. That is, both art and yoga instantiate human reality as both body and the “soul.” That is where the political aspects of Western appropriation of yoga have been well rehearsed, what has been less clear is the visual implications and their connections to the interior experiences.

Natalia Vasquez

To that end, the exhibition will include artworks by artists such as Susanna Harwood Rubin and Katie Cercone who explicitly incorporate yoga into their artistic practices as well as those that bring into being the intertwining of body and mind; and yoga practices that are not coded as art. There are also artists like Natalia Vasquez that incorporate healing and wellness to her artistic practice, while also teaching yoga. 

 In the process, the exhibition will bring to the fore discussions of the body in art—where the practice of yoga and art together creates a community for participants that becomes just as much a part of the exhibition as the artworks on the walls. The intention of this exhibition is to visualize the invisible sensations of yoga and art to study these interior states of being and self-creation.

Matt Roy

The programs I intend to include in my exhibition will explore the productive intersections between “community” and art with and through the practice of yoga. Grant Kester’s essay Conversation Pieces: The Role of Dialogue in Socially- Engaged Art, lists different versions of “new genre public art”, such as Homi K. Bhabha’s “conversational art”, and Bourriard’s relational aesthetics. I would instead like to envision the exhibition as what Kester appropriates from the Russian theorist Mikhail Bakhtin’s  “dialogical art practice”, where the work of art can be viewed as a conversation or a locus of differing meanings, interpretations, and points of view. In analyzing yoga on several different levels with process-driven results, I am engaging in this “aesthetic experience that is durational rather than immediate” (Kester).


Essentials

In organizing this exhibition there will be funding needed--getting artists and/or their art work shipped, paying instructors/speakers/artists to come be a part of the exhibition in Miami, as well as a substantial, printed exhibition catalogue and materials for the yoga/art workshops. 

The breakdown of funding is as follows:

-Shipping: $1,600

-Studio Teachers/Speakers for Exhibition: $1,000

-Equipment/Materials for Exhibition: $500

-Refreshments/Sponsors: $350

- Marketing/Promoting/Printing: $300

-Online/Printed Exhibition Catalogue: $400


If my entire goal is not reached, money will be distributed as necessary and certain aspects of the exhibition may have to be cut due to budgeting. There will be a fundraising dinner in September that will be catered after a short, restorative yoga class. Pre-sale tickets for this dinner and other give-aways will be announced at: 

The Still Life, L.L.C./ Instagram: @the_still_life_ / Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/stilllifeyoga

Follow today for updates!


Brittni Winkler by HGAB Mag

Practice

 In uniting yoga and art, I will be combining two independent communities; a yoga studio community and an art gallery/university community (Florida International University). The yoga studio (Bala Vinyasa Yoga Miami) will benefit from self-promotion of their yoga instructors who will teach in conjunction with the exhibition for 3 workshops that tie together art and yoga within the gallery space. 

-Body as Brush: Paint and Yoga Workshop

- Glowing Light and Photo Yoga Workshop

-Intuitive Zen Painting/Yoga Workshop

Body as Brush Workshop (Paint/Yoga)

The reciprocal relationship in which the community can learn about the creativity  aspects of using the body to create art  and how it relates to yoga and the way that yogi's can connect to the performance and grace of their own practice in a more visual manner. This is tied together through the study of "creating space", both as a curator making art exhibitions/ literally dictating how others will interact with the gallery space, and as a yogi creating the body and mind.

story:
My name's Turner and I'm living part time and doing art in Prague, Czech Republic. I've been painting, drawing, and doing collage all my life, and though music took center stage in my life in the past few years, art has always been what I go back to when I need to clear my head and get a fresh outlook on life. I have been involved in many collaborative exhibitions in the past, showing mostly illustrations and collage. Now I'm trying my hand at large scale canvas painting, implementing the various media that I love to form a colorful final product. I start with a few layers of spray paint to form a backdrop. The multiple layers and complicated shapes formed by patterns in tape and paper afford my paintings an interesting depth and atmosphere that I think awards me a unique style. I am also fascinated by the use of precious metals in paintings. The glistening effect makes the painting completely different from different angles. In a sense, the viewer can in this way interact with the painting by playing with light and space.        This series of paintings is my first adventure into the world of personal exhibition, which makes me extremely nervous. I have always been my own worst critic, and the prospect of hanging 20 large pieces of my creative psyche on the wall in a popular gallery in Europe for the whole world to see is pretty intimidating. I've had a lot of positive feedback and support already, however, and even sold 3 of the paintings months before the exhibition! So I'm feeling more and more confident as the exhibition date approaches.

I've hit a snag though, in the form of funding for the materials. I have 9 paintings finished and materials for a couple of more in stock, but that is the end of the line for me unfortunately unless I find additional funding from another source. Of course, selling a few of the paintings is the best way to fund it, but that's only a possibility through contacts and such until I can show the paintings in an exhibition. That's where you guys can help! Like what you see? Get a limited edition print signed and numbered, or even buy a painting right here! The exhibition is in the late part of August, so I need to get my hands on the materials I need well before that, hence the quick deadline. Thanks so much for taking the time to check my project out, take care of yourselves and your loved ones, sending positivity to you all from Prague!

Turner

ps- check out the gallery tab for pics of some of my work!

story:
Stretch Goal: $825

Now that we've crossed the finish line, I want to thank everyone who has so generously backed my campaigned.  I've added a stretch goal -- one that would help me to make sure that my presence at the Buyers Market of Fine Craft is noticed and that buyers who want to order can do it easily and in a professional manner.  Stretch goal funding would be used toward:

  • Marketing -- being able to put a small ad in Niche Magazine that would draw those galleries already going to the Buyers Market to my booth would give me a "leg up" in reaching out to those galleries most likely to order my work.  
  • Catalogs - Printing a limited number of catalogs for select galleries, making future ordering easier. 
  • Printing carbonless order forms, which would ease the ordering process and allowing galleries to walk away with the exact same ordering form that I will use to fulfill the order.  .   

---------------------------------------------------------

My Pottery

For many years, I dreamed about working in clay.  Finally in 2007, a good friend gave me an amazing gift of 25 lbs of clay.  From my first touch, I knew that this would become my life's work. There is something calming and centering about clay.  It fully allows me to express who I am in my creations.  I quickly got serious about my dream.  

I create unique, high-quality sculptural and functional pottery. People -- not just my friends and family -- love the unusual exaggerated shapes, clean lines, color and texture in my work. I design and build all my work as a solo artist in my studio at the Clay Center of St. Petersburg in Florida.

I've been happily immersed in clay for the last 7 years...and am ready for the next step -- taking my handcrafted work, with your help, to the Buyers Market of American Craft in Philadelphia.

My project

Displaying at the Buyers Market of American Craft is all about launching a wholesale line of my pottery in Philadelphia - the City of Brotherly (& sisterly) Love. One of the industry's premier wholesale trade shows, BMAC will enable me to have my work seen (and hopefully purchased) by galleries, designers and other buyers from all over the United States. I've already been accepted.  It's an exciting (and slightly frightening!) opportunity. I'm ready for the challenge but I need your help to get to the show and make the very best possible first impression.  

Taking the leap into the competitive wholesale trade market is a huge step and very difficult for a small handcraft business such as mine. Even just a basic setup comes with prohibitive costs. Booth rental, shipping costs, and booth design will cost more than the $5,000 that I am trying to raise in this campaign. 


Floating Platters

 Elliptical Vases

Challenges

My challenge is to make sure I choose a selection of work in color palettes that will appeal to buyers. I am working with several local galleries and the head of the Arts Business Institute to make sure my pricing is fair and competitive.

There are many details to coordinate ... but this is a strength of mine as I worked as an executive director in the nonprofit world for more than 30 years. I am an excellent problem solver and understand good communication and planning.


Handmade Hearts


I honestly love what I do, and am truly thrilled each time customers tell me how pleased they are to have a piece of art in their home or office.

My work has received regional and national recognition and am confident that with your help I can successfully put my best foot forward in entering the wholesale world of craft on the national "stage".  So please contribute what you are able and share my project with your friends and family on your social networks or via email.


Long Boats

What makes me think I will succeed, you ask?

This year, I took an experimental baby step into the world of wholesaling at a small, local show ... and the response was very encouraging. However, trusted professionals told me that I should be at a larger show with a national representation of galleries and design firms. And literally thousands of buyers attend this particular show in Philadelphia.  

So, I have been busy developing new work and producing a stock of current work that lends itself to the wholesale market.  I have already been accepted to the show and am confident that it will propel my work into an expanded world of galleries and designers.


Summo Vessels

Saggar Fired Wall Hangings

 Here are some highlights from the last few years:

In 2013, I was a NICHE Award Finalist, a “Featured Artist” on the Arts Business Institute and in "I Love the 'Burg" web pages, and received a "Best of Houzz" Award. Additionally my Blue Lotus was chosen for the Great Mother's Day Handmade Gift Guide.  In 2011 & 2012, my work was selected for ABI's "Great Handmade Holiday Gift Guides," and I represented Florida in "50 States Fire Up: an American Clay Invitational" at the Margaret Harwell Art Museum in 2011. 


Anemone Bowls


A few testimonials:

"Wendy Durand's hand-built ceramics are beautiful and professionally executed. You are assured quality work that can serve functional purposes and also be viewed as art.  We've purchased her work and we enjoyed working with her."  Holly Collins, Texas.

"Wendy is a creative professional artist. She creates unique pottery, which is not only beautiful, but functional. Her work is impeccable, using traditional and innovative techniques. Wendy is a pleasure to work with, hardworking and enthusiastic. I admire her."  Andrea Pawlisz, artist, Florida.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

My experience at the small local wholesale show, the national recognition I received for my work and many satisfied collectors across the country tell me that it is time to leap into the larger wholesale market.  I will get greater exposure and expand my business into better galleries across America.  

Thanks for your help.  

Wendy Durand Pottery:  for artful living and artful giving.  I believe that art makes the world a better place.  Producing functional and sculptural pottery at affordable prices allows people to have art in their homes, places of work, and to give thoughtful and special gifts. 


Note Cards
story_txt:
Stretch Goal: $825
Now that we've crossed the finish line, I want to thank everyone who has so generously backed my campaigned.  I've added a stretch goal -- one that would help me to make sure that my presence at the Buyers Market of Fine Craft is noticed and that buyers who want to order can do it easily and in a professional manner.  Stretch goal funding would be used toward:


Marketing -- being able to put a small ad in Niche Magazine that would draw those galleries already going to the Buyers Market to my booth would give me a "leg up" in reaching out to those galleries most likely to order my work.  
Catalogs - Printing a limited number of catalogs for select galleries, making future ordering easier. 

Printing carbonless order forms, which would ease the ordering process and allowing galleries to walk away with the exact same ordering form that I will use to fulfill the order.  .   



---------------------------------------------------------

My Pottery

For many years, I dreamed about working in clay.  Finally in 2007, a good friend gave me an amazing gift of 25 lbs of clay.  From my first touch, I knew that this would become my life's work. There is something calming and centering about clay.  It fully allows me to express who I am in my creations.  I quickly got serious about my dream.  
I create unique, high-quality sculptural and functional pottery. People -- not just my friends and family -- love the unusual exaggerated shapes, clean lines, color and texture in my work. I design and build all my work as a solo artist in my studio at the Clay Center of St. Petersburg in Florida.
I've been happily immersed in clay for the last 7 years...and am ready for the next step -- taking my handcrafted work, with your help, to the Buyers Market of American Craft in Philadelphia.
My project
Displaying at the Buyers Market of American Craft is all about launching a wholesale line of my pottery in Philadelphia - the City of Brotherly (& sisterly) Love. One of the industry's premier wholesale trade shows, BMAC will enable me to have my work seen (and hopefully purchased) by galleries, designers and other buyers from all over the United States. I've already been accepted.  It's an exciting (and slightly frightening!) opportunity. I'm ready for the challenge but I need your help to get to the show and make the very best possible first impression.  

Taking the leap into the competitive wholesale trade market is a huge step and very difficult for a small handcraft business such as mine. Even just a basic setup comes with prohibitive costs. Booth rental, shipping costs, and booth design will cost more than the $5,000 that I am trying to raise in this campaign. 

Floating Platters

 Elliptical Vases


Challenges
My challenge is to make sure I choose a selection of work in color palettes that will appeal to buyers. I am working with several local galleries and the head of the Arts Business Institute to make sure my pricing is fair and competitive.
There are many details to coordinate ... but this is a strength of mine as I worked as an executive director in the nonprofit world for more than 30 years. I am an excellent problem solver and understand good communication and planning.


Handmade Hearts



I honestly love what I do, and am truly thrilled each time customers tell me how pleased they are to have a piece of art in their home or office.
My work has received regional and national recognition and am confident that with your help I can successfully put my best foot forward in entering the wholesale world of craft on the national "stage".  So please contribute what you are able and share my project with your friends and family on your social networks or via email.


Long Boats


What makes me think I will succeed, you ask?
This year, I took an experimental baby step into the world of wholesaling at a small, local show ... and the response was very encouraging. However, trusted professionals told me that I should be at a larger show with a national representation of galleries and design firms. And literally thousands of buyers attend this particular show in Philadelphia.  
So, I have been busy developing new work and producing a stock of current work that lends itself to the wholesale market.  I have already been accepted to the show and am confident that it will propel my work into an expanded world of galleries and designers.

Summo Vessels


Saggar Fired Wall Hangings



 Here are some highlights from the last few years:
In 2013, I was a NICHE Award Finalist, a “Featured Artist” on the Arts Business Institute and in "I Love the 'Burg" web pages, and received a "Best of Houzz" Award. Additionally my Blue Lotus was chosen for the Great Mother's Day Handmade Gift Guide.  In 2011 & 2012, my work was selected for ABI's "Great Handmade Holiday Gift Guides," and I represented Florida in "50 States Fire Up: an American Clay Invitational" at the Margaret Harwell Art Museum in 2011. 

Anemone Bowls



A few testimonials:
"Wendy Durand's hand-built ceramics are beautiful and professionally executed. You are assured quality work that can serve functional purposes and also be viewed as art.  We've purchased her work and we enjoyed working with her."  Holly Collins, Texas.
"Wendy is a creative professional artist. She creates unique pottery, which is not only beautiful, but functional. Her work is impeccable, using traditional and innovative techniques. Wendy is a pleasure to work with, hardworking and enthusiastic. I admire her."  Andrea Pawlisz, artist, Florida.

-----------------------------------------------------------------
My experience at the small local wholesale show, the national recognition I received for my work and many satisfied collectors across the country tell me that it is time to leap into the larger wholesale market.  I will get greater exposure and expand my business into better galleries across America.  
Thanks for your help.  


Wendy Durand Pottery:  for artful living and artful giving.  I believe that art makes the world a better place.  Producing functional and sculptural pottery at affordable prices allows people to have art in their homes, places of work, and to give thoughtful and special gifts. 

Note Cards

story:
Frederick Eberhardt Jr., also known as Breeze “I Life This” The Poet, has spent the past 4 years electrifying stages around the country. Focused on enlightening, encouraging, and informing, and empowering through entertaining, Breeze uses this gift to set the world right at any open mic, poetry workshop, poetry event, slam, school function, church, or opportunity he can find.He is commended for his passion, drive, the excessive amount of faith he has in his craft, and the dedication he has to giving no less than all he has on every stage he performs on. He aspires to become an author, currently working on his first published collection of poems, and to also teach this craft and have a hand in helping to lead the next generation of this art into the right direction. Among all, he is dedicated to ensuring his kids see "that dreams only stay dreams if you keep sleeping. Should you decide to wakeup and put your heart, mind and faith towards those dreams, they can definitely become reality."   

     Today there is help needed in the efforts of possibly achieving a major accomplishment in his career.He has had the honor of being nominated for Spoken Word Artist of the Year by the National Poetry Awards being held this year in Louisville, Kentucky from August 23-25. In addition to the awards is the extremely prestigious 4th Annual Win or Go Home Slam. In order for him to be apart of this momentous occasion in his career, he has to get there, this is where your help is needed.

     With priorities in check and three kids to provide for with school starting in the very near future, it would be next to impossible to save the money neccesary (bus to and from, hotel for at least three days, food, ect.) to make this trip by himself. The goal set is the minmum required for this site, there is more needed, but I am in no way taking any of the load for this venture off of myself. I am asking for help, as i help myself, I am not looking for a handout. I am a firm believer in the phrase "faith without works is dead." My faith is an action word, and i plan on taking action to make this trip possible, i just need some help.

     If you cannot contribute, bless you just as much for even considering the thought. I am grateful for all the blessings that come my way, be it through contribution, a sharing of the page, an encouraging word, and even more so a prayer. I have always been as supportive as i possibly can be to anyone trying to achieve a positive goal or grind a dream into reality. I have faith that such support will be returned. Thank you all in advanced.

story:
About the Campaign

Who we are:

Hello there!

We are Justin, Calla, Brian, Harim and Naomi, and we represent the 2013 Queen City Poetry Slam Team!

We are going to the National Poetry Slam competition in Boston/Cambridge, MA!  

At Nationals, we will compete against 71 teams from all over the U.S. and Canada.  

This is the FIRST YEAR Queen City Poetry Slam is sending a team!  

What we need:

We need to cover hotel and travel expenses on the journey to Nationals.  The five of us might be working-class citizens, but we are having trouble trying to gather funds for the competition.  This is why we decided to create an Indiegogo campaign.  

You could donate $1, maybe $5, perhaps $20, or even $200!  We leave that up to you!  Ask yourself: "How much could I donate in order to help this team?"

We appreciate any amount you can give us.  ANY!  

What you receive:

We have listed perks on our campaign as a way of expressing how much we appreciate your help! The title of each perk is a poetry form. Read each description to see what you'll receive! There's plenty to choose from! 

Note: If you do not want a perk, you are still welcome to make a donation!  

What is the impact:

  • In this competition, we not only represent Queen City Poetry Slam...We also represent CINCINNATI!
  • We want to return with a ranking that sets us apart from everywhere else in the country!  

  • We want to be the chain reaction for Cincinnati that promotes even more growth in writing and performance!  

  • We want to turn this into a tradition: To send a Cincinnati poetry team each year! 

  • While at the competition, we will attend workshops and network with poets from across the country.  Everything we learn will return with us and help improve upon the current writing education we offer to our Cincinnati community.  

What is another way to help:

If you are unable to contribute or made your contribution and would like to do more, then help us get the word out!  Promote this campaign to your friends, family, loved ones, coworkers, and complete strangers.  

Copy the campaign's short link and send it to anyone you know! 

Short Link: igg.me/at/QueenCityPoetry 

Also, like our Queen City Poetry Slam Facebook page and 2013 National Poetry Slam Facebook page!

 

FAQ

What is Queen City Poetry Slam?  

Queen City Poetry Slam is the only poetry slam venue in Cincinnati, OH.  The venue hosts bi-weekly poetry events in order to enhance the writing community of the Greater Cincinnati & Northern Kentucky region.  

Who are the 2013 Queen City Poetry Slam Team Members?

They are Justin Williams, Calla Thomas, Brian Sullivan Jr, Harim C. Ellis, and Naomi Hanna Katz.  

What is the National Poetry Slam (NPS)?

National Poetry Slam is the largest team performance poetry event in the world. Teams from all over North America, and a few from other places, converge in a different city every summer for five days of poetry, revelry and competition.

What are the dates for the 2013 NPS and where is it being held?  

The 2013 National Poetry Slam is being held in the Boston/Cambridge area of Massachusettes from August 12th-17th.  

Where could I go if I would like more information on Queen City Poetry Slam, National Poetry Slam, or poetry slam in general?  

For Queen City Poetry Slam:

Check out the Queen City Poetry Slam Facebook page.

For National Poetry Slam:

Check out the 2013 National Poetry Slam website.

Check out the 2013 NPS Facebook page.

For poetry slam in general:

Check out the Poetry Slam, Inc. website.

Check out the PSI Facebook page.

story:
STRETCH GOAL: $1,000! from Bare bones to Beautiful!

Taking a moment to acknowledge the sheer magnitude of awesome that is my friends and fellow citizens Boston - you are amazing, and making a dream come true... to grace the streets and terrorize small children in a glittery blaze of sequinned fabric. Our initial number was the bare bones package - just enough to get the thing done as a proof of concept so we could make a better one later (and potentially one actually made of fire... but that's another story.) But why not just do it right the first time? This upgrade will allow us to go farther in weatherproofing the piece, making giant resin eyes, greasing up the moving parts with better pieces, making the handling more ergonomic, and adding a TON of detail like individual feather patterns, painted highlights, fringe pinion feathers, ruffled hackle, and whatever I can get away with on the tail. Let's take people's breathe away! Thank you so much for all your support, you make being an artist worth it.


** Update:  If we make $150 passed our goal to $650, I'll be casting the eyes out of transparent, emerald resin so they shine in the sun! The more we make over that, the more feathers, bells and lifelike details we can give him. Thanks everyone for your support! **

If you had the awesomeness to have been there (and of course, we understand if you didn't- accidents happen), you may remember the Asylum Red Dragon that paraded with HONK! the year before last, delighting Cambervillian children and captivating adults for the glory of art and Artisan's Asylum.  (if you missed it, check out this short video: http://www.flickr.com/photos/jaypee4227/6220120329/)

Well, the HONK! parade (http://honkfest.org/) organizers reached out to Ecco Pierce and I and asked us to bring the Asylum's special brand of wacky maker spectacle back this year, and we (with help from members of the community), have stepped up with...

The Firebird Project!

A 20+ foot long kinetic sculpture/puppet with two traffic lanes of gracefully operable wings, celebrating the creative act through movement, dance, and sculpture, and promoting the Cambervillian creative community (especially as embodied by the membership and community support of Artisan's Asylum).  The Firebird is scheduled to appear in this year's parade along with a cadre of dance and movement artists to delight onlooking children and inspire adults to manifest their own creative potential, but we need your help to get it there!

As you may well know, there's no money in community art, and while we have received some funding, we're not quite there to cover the cost of materials to make this happen (and we are piss-poor artists).  If you're a lover of art and want to help bring more of it to the public on this very special annual event or a supporter of our local maker community who wants to see it promoted, we encourage you to step up and help this spectacle take flight!

Sincerest gratitude,

Ecco, David, and the Firebird Team

story:
What GigaDazzle is All About

  • GigaDazzle Event Management System is a comprehensive, yet affordable online management option for anyone in the entertainment business.
  • Enjoy the freedom to access your client base and event calendar from any device, whether on your office PC, your laptop, tablet, or mobile smartphone. Take calls and book events anywhere, any time, without worry. Your data is safely stored on our secure servers, in your private, password-protected account.
  • No more lost gigs because you had to "check your calendar" before confirming availability. No more lost data when your PC crashes.
  • Create and send invoices, gig sheets and receipts. Manage customers, subcontractors and employees, all from one source, no matter where you are!
  • Affordable monthly subscription service that pays for itself several times over with only ONE booking per month!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goals in a nutshell:

  • We want to help YOU get organized. In order to do that, we have to raise a minimum startup fund of $5000.
  • Once this ball gets rolling, it will revolutionize the way those of us in the entertainment business keep track of our clients and our schedule.
  • This startup fund will go toward the first milestone goal of getting the GigaDazzle system online and available to everyone.

The Impact

We know that the GigaDazzle Event Management System will forever change the way our clients manage the day-to-day paperwork involved with any entertainment business, whether you are a one-person show, or a multi-entertainer company.

Wouldn't it be nice if you could take a customer call, check your event calendar, confirm availability and close the deal in just one easy process? That is exactly what GigaDazzle will offer, and YOU can be part of the creation of this amazing system!

Each and every contribution guarantees a doubled investment, so don't hesitate. The quicker this goal is reached, the faster we can get this show on the road!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you just can't find an extra dollar or two looking for a good home, please help us spread the word!

  • Please LIKE us on Facebook!

  • SHARE this page with your friends, or email this LINK!

THANK YOU!

story:
The Exhibition

Street Wall is an exhibition dedicated to artists that work on the urban and public canvas. The artists highlighted in the exhibition will be invited to do pieces directly on the walls. Each artist would be given a 2 to 4 panel section of wall space on the interior of the gallery for them to wheat paste work in the gallery much as it is done on the street. Temporary panelised plywood walls will be installed throughout the lining of the gallery for the artists' work.


Live silk-screen printing from Antidesigns.http://antidesigns.com/


The exhibtion will open at The Fourth Wall Project in Boston on February 4, 2012. 7pm-9pm.

http://fourthwallproject.com/


The 6 national street artists in the exhibition include:

The Phantom - http://www.facebook.com/el.fatom

Blackmath - http://www.flickr.com/photos/supersoaker

Zatara - http://www.flickr.com/photos/8427104@N02/

Nanook - http://cargocollective.com/nanook

LNY - http://www.flickr.com/people/lnylnylny/

Radical - http://www.munchgallery.com/erik_savage


Curated by William Stitt


Goals

We believe that the ephemeral art composed on public structures deserves a venue to be displayed within the context of a traditional gallery. We hope that this exhibition will allow the viewer to take a receptive and analytical attitude toward looking at the work. The exhibit will allow people to experience public works in a more intimate physical proximity and will enable a more personal emotional response in the viewer. This work carries great weight in its visual imagery. We want to showcase the messages of these artists. It is our hope the viewer will be immersed in a room covered with provocative and active imagery and that their experience in the space will leave an impression as bold as the work upon it.


Context

Other galleries have recently had success with exhibitions of street art. The Los Angeles show, Marxist Glue, showcased 13 artists who worked directly on the walls of the gallery and had an incredible turn out with a line going down the block. Other notable events include the Tate Modern's Street Art exhibition, Paste Modernism in Sydney and Swoon's New York installation at Deitch Projects. Even the recent documentary by Banksy, Exit Through The Gift Shop details the overnight fame of artist Mr. Brainwash and culminates in a solo street art exhibition with an over capacity turn out.

It is our hope the viewer will be immersed in a room covered with provocative and active imagery and that their experience in the space will leave an impression as bold as the work upon it.


Context
Other galleries have recently had success with exhibitions of street art. The Los Angeles show, Marxist Glue, showcased 13 artists who worked directly on the walls of the gallery and had an incredible turn out with a line going down the block. Other notable events include the Tate Modern's Street Art exhibition, Paste Modernism in Sydney and Swoon's New York installation at Deitch Projects. Even the recent documentary by Banksy, Exit Through The Gift Shop details the overnight fame of artist Mr. Brainwash and culminates in a solo street art exhibition with an over capacity turn out.

story:
Genesis at the Crossroads, our non-profit organization, believes that the indoctrination of hatred and the violence that stems from it remains one of the most alarming pandemics of the 21st century.

 

Our answer:   Use music to build bridges!

 

… and that is just what we have done since 1999.

 

Saffron Caravan, our signature ensemble, unites musicians from Iran, Afghanistan, Cuba, Morocco & the US. Their repertoire, spanning seven languages and multiple keys, explores Arab, Jewish and Persian musical traditions spiced with sub-Saharan roots of blues and jazz, Afro-Caribbean and South-American rhythms.  In their sacred shared musical space, we model dialogue, exchange, breaking down barriers and working together to share our common humanity, respectfully contributing individual and collective voices to Art.

(Please visit our website for their bios at www.gatc.org)

 

This September, Saffron Caravan will perform to thousands of people in Jordanian and Israeli areas and give 500+ student-hours of music instruction to gifted children and those who have never had the privilege of holding an instrument.

 

Genesis’ humanitarian program, Arm Them with Instruments, brings gently-used instruments and professional music education to at-risk youth, helping channel passion into constructive rather than potentially destructive activities.

 

Genesis’ digital arsenal: website, Facebook, Twitter, State Department sponsored webchats to 32 countries on 5 continents, live nationwide webstreaming of our performances & Genesis’ and our community partners’ listserve blasts reach thousands.

 

Leveraging INdieGoGo’s cause-marketing digital platform enables Genesis to reach thousands more  to generate critical funding and collect thousands of instrument donations to bring the gift of human expression and connection where precious lives are lost and childhood erased.

 

                                  BECAUSE… MUSIC CONNECTS HUMANITY.

 

Our brand of “arts-diplomacy” has attracted the attention of and funding by the US Department of State and the Illinois Arts Council, corporations and foundations, however, we are unable to continue our program’s full human reach without your contribution. 

 

Without this additional aid, we simply cannot impact all of the children we want to inspire and those communities that need any and every precious model for creating bridges to transcend cultural barriers. 

 

Please take a moment to envision what your tax-deductible donation to Genesis at the Crossroads can do for our troubled world and the future student artists and leaders we are deeply committed to educate.   

 

We believe the arts profoundly reach our common core and

link us all for the greater good of humankind.

 

Genesis at the Crossroads’ Saffron Caravan Middle Eastern Tour

with

Peter Yarrow (Peter, Paul & Mary)

September 12-22, 2011

 

 

MUSIC:  Five (two hour) concerts along with moderated post-performance discussions with the artists and audiences to explore adversarial cultures in creative exchange

 

Sites in Cultural Centers in the Middle East

Including The Jerusalem International YMCA & others

Saffron Caravan is the centerpiece for The Day of Cultures on Sept. 21st

 

… That’s reaching thousands of Middle Easterners of all ages!

 

MUSIC EDUCATION:

18+ master classes in music in 5 locations  

36+ hrs of instruction with professional musicians including Peter Yarrow

… That’s over 500 student hours

 

5 master classes for music educators with Yarrow (music & peacebuilding)

… That’s 150-200 instructor hours at 5 locations 

 

OUR MUSICAL LEGACY:

  • Jr Saffron Caravan Ensemble to be created with Israeli & Palestinian youth They will be the warm up ensemble for Saffron Caravan’s performances

… That’s building bridges, one musician at a time

 

  • Humanitarian instrument donation– Bedouin community site opening

(Arm Them with Instruments)

… That’s changing one life at a time

 

  • A four -part radio broadcast on WFMT & the WFMT Radio Network

… That’s sharing our message with 20 million listeners worldwide each time

 

 

Now...Here’s where you come in…

 

$25 - Receive a free Saffron Caravan Unfolding CD

 

$50 - Receive a Saffron Caravan CD & a set of 12 commemorative peace quilt cards

 

$100 – You support two hours of private professional music instruction (name in the program)

 

$250 – You support music education and get one of 500 raffle tickets to win a set of seven

             Hand-signed Bob Dylan Harmonicas (only 25 in the world)

The first 25 people to purchase an individual Dylan raffle ticket by Sept 1st are eligible for a drawing to win 2 more raffle tickets for the final Sept 30, 2011 drawing.

 

$500 – You get three Bob Dylan raffle tickets while supporting music education

The first 25 to purchase three Dylan raffle tickets by Sept 1st are eligible for a

drawing to win 5 more raffle tickets for the final Sept 30, 2011 drawing.

 

$1,000 – You get 10 Bob Dylan raffle tickets while supporting music education

The first 25 people to purchase 10 Dylan raffle tickets by Sept 1st are eligible for a drawing to win 10 more raffle tickets for the final Sept 30, 2011 drawing.

 

$1,800 – You support the development of a Junior Saffron Caravan cross-cultural ensemble

 

$2,500 – You co-sponsor this September 2011 Tour to the

               Your name listed in the Sept. 2011 program

  GATC web, Facebook & Twitter listing

 

The first person to purchase 150 Dylan raffle tickets wins two free roundtrip tickets to Israel and hotel for 7 nights (double occupancy) to join us on this September 2011 Tour!!!

 

Interested in donating more? – please contact info@gatc.org

 

AND … That’s 90% of your tax-deductible dollars going to the music & most importantly, the people!

 

Share this shamelessly in the name of world peace,

Share tools &

Send our link to all your friends & family!

story:
Short Summary

Upon realizing there was  a second slot to send a team to rep our Twin Cities (because yes, our talent pool is THAT big!) we decided to make the trek out west this August! Making this choice also means we are entirely self funded. For 3/4 of our team it is their first opportunity to attend the National Poetry Slam (NPS) and your generous contributions can help make that dream a reality!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our total estimated costs are $3000. We are hoping to raise at least $2400 through this online drive, and to pick up the rest at our show fundraisers.
  • Funds go to registration fees, housing, and transportation.
  • You get: Personalized poems! Chapbooks! Hugs! And original art!
  • All proceeds are helpful, even if we fall short of our goal. Please consider giving and more importantly, spread the word!

The Impact

  • The poets have poured their souls into their art, and the work they do is important. NPS offers some of the biggest stages for sharing and exposure.
  • There will be TWO Twin Cities teams representing at nationals!
  • For much of the team, this will be the first opportunity they've had to see the wonder that is the National Poetry Slam and with help from a supportive community we can get them out there!

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't the only help we can use!

  • Spread the word!
  • Share this page! 
  • Come to shows and events! 
  • Kind words and hugs!

story:
Fatima Fasih Watercolors' latest project called the “Children of Hope” is a series of paintings made from actual images of Syrian children affected by the current crisis within Syria and outside the country in various refugee camps. As an artist, Fatima Fasih has embarked upon this project to increase awareness, to make sure that the plight of these innocent children doesn't lose its voice, and to gain as much charity for their relief and rehabilitation.


A full day event at a new, socially responsible fair trade café, Studio 89, will be a start for this crucial conversation. The paintings will be silently auctioned at the venue and online. Along with this, the event will also include a cupcake workshop, face painting for kids and the highlight, a spoken word/open mic event to share creative thoughts of hope and peace. Click here for event details.


 Introducing Fatima Fasih's Series "Children of Hope" Tribute to the refugee child of Syria:


  Sale of Original paintings on Fatima Fasih Watercolors on Fb


     Those who contribute towards our goal of $1000 will receive reward packages with our exclusive t-shirts, prints from the series, and a chance to connect with Youtubers Saif Shawaf and Mohammed Zeyara! 


 All proceeds will go to Oxfam's emergency appeal for Syria

 Pick up of reward packages will take place at Studio 89 after we receive your donation. We will ship internationally for donors of $300+ CDN. All original paintings will include a complimentary frame. 




 A big thank you to Studio 89 for making this possible! 

http://www.studio89.org/ 

More of Fatima's work on her page here

story:
Yes Shetland are working for Yes vote in the independence referendum on 18 September.

We want to fund a campaign office in Lerwick town centre, from where we will run our campaign in the months leading up to the vote.

We want to offer local people soemwhere to drop in for a chat with our volunteers, and learn more about the independence campaign.

We need  to raise money to cover the cost of rental for a shop premises in Lerwick town centre until just after the referendum.

Funds raised will go towards rent, utility bills, and other campaign activities.

The shop would give us a permanent, visible presence, a space to organise  the campaign and somewhere to speak to voters.

Help us move the biggest political campaign in Shetland forward with your contribution, large or small, every pound will help.

You can donate with credit or debit cards.

 

Other ways You can help

Some people just can't contribute, but that does not mean you cannot help, get involved, contact Yes Shetland at

yesshetland@gmail.com

https://www.facebook.com/groups/yesshetland/  

https://www.facebook.com/womenforindyshetland

https://www.facebook.com/nationalcollectiveshetland

Put the word out for us as well.

story:
''Joy connects us with the eternal , pain links us to time '

Hello,

Thank you for taking the time to visit our page.  We are Joy Connects, a student-led company from the Royal Central School of Speech & Drama.  We are all currently in our 2nd year of studying Drama, Applied Theatre and Education.  From the 19th of may to the 25th of June we are excited to be running drama workshops in the Sam Beckman Day Centre in Hendon, a Jewish centre which caters for adults with memory impairment and/or a diagnosis of a type of dementia. 

Why are we doing this? 

A recent study by Russian brain surgeons suggests that two hours  of rigorous arts activities a day may be enough to stop the progression of dementia, due to stimulation of the area of the brain which deteriorates first.  You may agree with  us that this is a staggering concept .  We therefore aim to use the creative arts to provide a pleasant and enriching experience for everyone involved, even if it is somewhat momentary.

What are we aiming to do?

Our workshops will be based on the theme of travelling the world. We aim to give members a unique multi sensory immersive experience by visually transforming the day centre's space, as well as using arts-based activities such as improvisation and puppetry.

So how can you help?

We would be grateful if you could donate to our cause and support us in achieving our aim.

Primarily, we will need props, fabrics & craft materials. From the pyramids of Egypt to gushing waterfalls of the Amazon, we hope to transform the space each session and create a rich and vibrant setting. We also would like to create "passports", maps, postcards and puppets (to name a few) with the members of the centre during our project.  Your help would be greatly appreciated so that we can attempt to move away from purely verbal interactions and create an environment which stimulates the senses, the psyche and encourages creativity, and play - all of which have been suggested to help expression.

We welcome any donations in helping our cause.  If you are unable to support us financially, thank you for taking the time to read about our project, and we would be grateful if you could share this page.

Thank you for your time and support, from the Joy Connects team: (left to right) Liberty Ip, Kate Hill, Heloise Warden, Caroline James, Christina Ford.

story:
"Brigid's what?"

Brigid's Crossing is the brainchild of a team of designers, engineers, street philosophers and visionaries known collectively as the Reckless Rainbow. We have come together from the farthest reaches of the globe to share in the creation of this inhabitable sculpture for the citizens of Black Rock City, a temporary metropolis in the remote desert of northern Nevada.

Project leader Shane Sugrue and resident Rainbow Architect Amy Learmonth are responsible for the design of Brigid's Crossing. Along with Rainbow co-founder Art Scheunert we have assembled an astonishing crew of folks to realise this artwork and interweave it with an array of madness inducing interactive fun-filled games and activities. With your help we will be bringing it to life at Burning Man 2014.


"Great, but what is it?"

It is a wooden structure, roughly two storeys tall, composed entirely from standard length 2x4" timber studs. These members are woven together in a geometric pattern to create a volume which is filled with light & shadow.

On two sides the structure folds outward, creating the two covered staircases that allow participants to enter the space. Hammocks and rope seats in the interior invite festival-goers to escape the heat of the day, or the darkness of the night, and suspend themselves within this contemplative space, amongst a web of hanging lighting, mirrors and ephemera.  

We hope the experience of entering Brigid's Crossing might be something like this:



"Flip it, Twist it, Turn it, Bop it"

During design and prototyping, the structure took on a variety of forms before the final scheme was reached. Here's a peak at just a few: 

 



"Right, and how are you gonna build this thing?" 

 Firstly (and with your help!) we have to acquire 300 timber studs, 3000 screws, 250 LEDs with 750 batteries inside, 100' of steel cable, 1 pair of bunny ears and a truck to put 'em all in.

Then over the course of a frantic two days at the Generator workspace in Reno, we'll build the bottom half of the structure, test it for stability and load it back into the truck for transportation to the middle of nowhere.

Then over two more frantic days we'll place the thing, construct the top half, tie it down and hang all the lights, just in time for Black Rock City to open its gates to wandering art lovers from around the world.

If you think 4 days is cutting it a bit fine, check out what the Reckless Rainbow crew knocked out over the course of 4 sleepless days in April for the wonderful Microburn gathering in north Wales:


Step 1: THINK!

Step 2: CREATE!

Step 3: ASSEMBLE!

 Step 4: PLAY!

"Okay... this Brigid lady... who is she?" 

Brigid is the patron of the Celtic festival of Imbolg. She is the protector of hearth and home, the bringer of light and warmth. 

As fire and celebration herald a fresh understanding of the world, Brigid dispels the darkness imposed by her mischievous counterpart, Samhain. She crosses the threshold, bringing with her illumination and renewed fertility. This is manifested not only physically, but emotionally, by a new growth in awareness. Brigid is the embodiment of all elevated states, of the expanding individual and collective consciousness, the coming enlightenment.Brigid’s presence is customarily marked by a cruciform symbol of woven rushes or reeds. This ‘Brigid’s Cross’ is still fashioned each year on the 1st February by Irish schoolchildren and hung in homes throughout the country, where it is believed to afford protection against darkness.

With Brigid’s Crossing, we imagine Brigid reciprocating the welcome she receives in Irish homes. She now invites us to cross her threshold, to enter a place of refuge in one of the harshest environments on earth. During the day she will provide respite from the dust and glare of the Black Rock Desert, an ancient lakebed devoid of life. And at night she will be a lantern to wanderers lost at the farthest edge of of their temporary metropolis, known as Black Rock City. Brigid's Crossing draws on the symbolism of Imbolg to create a space for illuminated reflection.

"So, whaddaya want?"

 We are asking you to help us raise the princely sum of $4000. This amounts to half the total project cost, with the other half coming from the ticket contributions of crew members themselves.

The money you give will cover the purchase of construction materials - lumber, steel cabling, fixings and screws - while the contributions of our beautiful crew will cover transport, tools and all the other minor costs associated with a live construction project.

It must be stressed that no personal expenses - that's travel, food, drink, bunny ears, etc - are included in the project budget!

If we do not reach the stated target, well that's okay too! The beauty of the piece is that it is entirely composed from a standard length of structural lumber. If necessary we will down-scale to a smaller and shorter lumber dimension, thereby reducing both material and transport costs. It'll still look like this...


 

"And what's in it for me?"

 Aside from the satisfaction of making possible the creation of a unique artwork as part of the world's largest single gathering of artists, and of course  our perpetual awe and gratitude, you will be able to claim one of our incredible perks, listed on the right --->

We will keep you updated on our progress as the time draws near, with regular reports on our progress during preparation and construction. A detailed budget break down will be available to all who donate, whether you give one dollar or one-hundred dollars. And if you simply can't get enough, click on the dropbox link below to read more about and see more images of Brigid's Crossing.

"How else can i help?"

 We understand that some folks just can't contribute right now, but never fear! If you like the piece, if you're passionate about community-supported art or if you just feel like helping out, why not spread the word far and wide? 

Use them newfangled social media, use those share tools you've been graced with, tell your friends, your relatives, your dog - let them know about this international team of artists on a mission to build a simple thing of beauty.

No really..

On two sides the structure folds outward, creating the two covered staircases that allow participants to enter the space. Hammocks and rope seats in the interior invite festival-goers to escape the heat of the day, or the darkness of the night, and suspend themselves within this contemplative space, amongst a web of hanging lighting, mirrors and ephemera.  We hope the experience of entering Brigid's Crossing might be something like this:"Flip it, Twist it, Turn it, Bop it"During design and prototyping, the structure took on a variety of forms before the final scheme was reached. Here's a peak at just a few:  "Right, and how are you gonna build this thing?"  Firstly (and with your help!) we have to acquire 300 timber studs, 3000 screws, 250 LEDs with 750 batteries inside, 100' of steel cable, 1 pair of bunny ears and a truck to put 'em all in.Then over the course of a frantic two days at the Generator workspace in Reno, we'll build the bottom half of the structure, test it for stability and load it back into the truck for transportation to the middle of nowhere.Then over two more frantic days we'll place the thing, construct the top half, tie it down and hang all the lights, just in time for Black Rock City to open its gates to wandering art lovers from around the world.If you think 4 days is cutting it a bit fine, check out what the Reckless Rainbow crew knocked out over the course of 4 sleepless days in April for the wonderful Microburn gathering in north Wales:Step 1: THINK!Step 2: CREATE!Step 3: ASSEMBLE! Step 4: PLAY!"Okay... this Brigid lady... who is she?" Brigid is the patron of the Celtic festival of Imbolg. She is the protector of hearth and home, the bringer of light and warmth. As fire and celebration herald a fresh understanding of the world, Brigid dispels the darkness imposed by her mischievous counterpart, Samhain. She crosses the threshold, bringing with her illumination and renewed fertility. This is manifested not only physically, but emotionally, by a new growth in awareness. Brigid is the embodiment of all elevated states, of the expanding individual and collective consciousness, the coming enlightenment.Brigid’s presence is customarily marked by a cruciform symbol of woven rushes or reeds. This ‘Brigid’s Cross’ is still fashioned each year on the 1st February by Irish schoolchildren and hung in homes throughout the country, where it is believed to afford protection against darkness.With Brigid’s Crossing, we imagine Brigid reciprocating the welcome she receives in Irish homes. She now invites us to cross her threshold, to enter a place of refuge in one of the harshest environments on earth. During the day she will provide respite from the dust and glare of the Black Rock Desert, an ancient lakebed devoid of life. And at night she will be a lantern to wanderers lost at the farthest edge of of their temporary metropolis, known as Black Rock City. Brigid's Crossing draws on the symbolism of Imbolg to create a space for illuminated reflection."So, whaddaya want?" We are asking you to help us raise the princely sum of $4000. This amounts to half the total project cost, with the other half coming from the ticket contributions of crew members themselves.The money you give will cover the purchase of construction materials - lumber, steel cabling, fixings and screws - while the contributions of our beautiful crew will cover transport, tools and all the other minor costs associated with a live construction project.It must be stressed that no personal expenses - that's travel, food, drink, bunny ears, etc - are included in the project budget!If we do not reach the stated target, well that's okay too! The beauty of the piece is that it is entirely composed from a standard length of structural lumber. If necessary we will down-scale to a smaller and shorter lumber dimension, thereby reducing both material and transport costs. It'll still look like this... "And what's in it for me?" Aside from the satisfaction of making possible the creation of a unique artwork as part of the world's largest single gathering of artists, and of course  our perpetual awe and gratitude, you will be able to claim one of our incredible perks, listed on the right --->We will keep you updated on our progress as the time draws near, with regular reports on our progress during preparation and construction. A detailed budget break down will be available to all who donate, whether you give one dollar or one-hundred dollars. And if you simply can't get enough, click on the dropbox link below to read more about and see more images of Brigid's Crossing."How else can i help?" We understand that some folks just can't contribute right now, but never fear! If you like the piece, if you're passionate about community-supported art or if you just feel like helping out, why not spread the word far and wide? Use them newfangled social media, use those share tools you've been graced with, tell your friends, your relatives, your dog - let them know about this international team of artists on a mission to build a simple thing of beauty.No really..

story:
What it is you are trying to do 

Central Print is seeking $3,000 to restore a historic Vandercook 215 proof press to be made available for public use through an open studio program. Generously donated for preservation this press is ready to be restored and used for printmaking projects. 

The Vandercook 215 before restoration 

How you will do it

Printmaking professionals will train and guide volunteers through the restoration and bring this press back to working condition. Once complete the press will be made available by appointment for individuals who have completed a printmaking workshop and passed a test on the safe operation of the press.

How the funds will be used

The funds will be used to purchase the supplies necessary for the restoration, to pay professionals to teach restoration techniques to volunteers, to set up the system for reserving the press and testing, as well as any expenses required for upkeep.


Your qualifications to complete this project

The project will be complete when the press has been restored to working condition and open studio participants begin printing using the preserved equipment.

Eric Wood the owner of The Firecracker Press and Matty Kleinberg, the shop manager of The Firecracker Press.

The identities of the people on your team 

Eric Woods, the owner of The Firecracker Press, along with Matty Kleinberg, Maggie Filla, and Lauren Cardenas make up the Firecracker team. They will teach volunteers and oversee the restoration. Central Print staff will manage the open studio, schedule appointments and keep the open studio and press up and running.

Maggie Filla, a printmaker at The Firecracker Press,  giving a demonstration of the SP 20 to the Women and the Kemper.


Donate acquisitions from an ex-printer in Illinois.  

How far along your project is

The press has been donated to Central Print and is ready for restoration to begin.

Budget

Press – Donated! We are on our way

Rollers - $120

Rubber gloves, respirators, oil, steel wool, solvents, wire brushes, grease - $150

Misc. hardware as needed – unknown until we begin restoration - $100 - $1,000

Professional fees for teaching restoration, $20 per hour x 40 hours - $800

Printing equipment, cleaning supplies etc. - $100

Professionals to teach proper equipment use, $20 per hour, 30 minutes x 20 participants – $200

Gifts for supporters including postage, 150 donors - $500

Any remaining funds will be used for programming the open studio until exhausted


We would greatly appreciate your assistance on this amazing endeavor!

Thank you, 

Central Print and The Firecracker Team

story:
X♥U

 

Who are we?

  • we are two graduates of the Academy of Fine Arts in Bratislava in Slovakia, Slávka and Milan. We share together a passionate interest in drawing and so we have decided to found a magazine about contemporary drawing called X. Drawing is a phenomenon of present. We are observing an increased interest in drawing on artists today and feel the need to record and reflect it. We are trying to understand this trend and provide it with sufficient space for the presentation and discussion.

 About the magazine:

  • magazine of contemporary drawing called "X" is a platform focused on drawing medium. It provides space for the presentation of contemporary drawings and allows the theoretical reflection.

We try to:

  • make a map of forms of drawing in Slovak art scene and create an overview of current events. Our aim is to document and present exhibitions, authors and emerging works, workshops, competitions and other activities which belong to the contemporary discourse of drawing. We are trying to fill the existing gap in its expertise in Slovakia.
  • we open a scientific discussion, it is a source of important information for theoretical and artistic community.

What is inside:

  • each issue focuses on a specific topic. The magazine consists of two parts. First part presents the subject in the form of essays from invited theorists. The second part presents the visual works of contemporary authors in the form of high-quality reproductions in the form of loose sheets. An important element of the magazine is an interview with the artists, providing deeper insight into the issue. A practical overview of current events and activities related to drawing in Slovakia and the surrounding area we will add at the end of the magazine.

The aim:

  • is to focus the attention primarily on the Slovak art scene, while creating a constructive analogy with foreign authors to provide a picture of the current drawing in Slovakia in the context of the surrounding countries.

X:

  • the symbol and the name of the magazine are two crossed lines, representing one of the most basic drawings at all. This pictogram has many connotations and forms of exploitation, represents a specific point in space, the correct answer, expresses disagreement, goal, error or disagreement. That´s why we chose it for the brand of our new magazine.

 What do we need:

  • At the moment we have completely prepared the first issue of the magazine, which is waiting only for its printing. Through your financial contribution, we would like to pay the printing of the first two issues of the magazine X. Other issues will be hopefully funded from the sale or donations.

     

    http://casopix.blogspot.com/

story:
What is Wasabi Kisses?

We're a brand new camp coming to the playa to make a rad queer and trans* oriented bdsm playspace. We're still quite a tiny group, mostly from the Bay Area, with a mix of seasoned Burning Man veterans and playa virgins. Our goal is to create a space were sexuality and gender identity is respected and where queer, trans*, genderqueer, and gender variant folks can get their kink on. Our goal is to make the camp a safer space. This means calling out and and making our space(as much as possible) free of homophobia, misogyny, femmephobia, transphobia, abelism, racism, cultural appropriation, classism, sex worker-phobia, and rape culture.

Some areas of focus are:.

 

  • Creating a consent culture
  • Queering Burning Man
  • Free and safe expression of identity
  • Creating a queer and trans* kink community


Some features and events occuring at our camp:

  • A bar with weird and exciting wasabi cocktails
  • Consent workshops
  • A queer prom
  • An awesome queer playspace for awesome queer play parties!

What We Need & What You Get

Your generous donations will go towards helping us prepare for events we will be having at Burning Man as well as basic infrastructure and transportation which includes:

  • Booze for our awesome bar!
  • Shade structures and our playspace!
  • Supplies for us to make cool art for our camp!
  • Inflatable furniture!
  • A sound system!
  • A rental truck to haul all of our shit!

As our thankyou for your donation, you wil recieve one or more of our lovely and sexy perks!

Every dollar and cent helps! If we don't make our goal, what ever we get will still be tremendously helpful in creating this camp!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Come camp with us!
  • Come to one of our awesome fundraising events!
  • Tell your friends! Share this campaigne on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Pinterest, or any of your favorite social networking sites!
  • If you have spare equipment or supplies (camping supplies, food, water, tents, shade structures, art supplies or anything else you think would help) loan or donate it to Wasabi Kisses!

Thanks for your support in helping us get to the playa!

story:
Nadine and Alexandre like each other, they also like creating colourful fonts and colourful paintings. Recently Alexandre was accepted into his dream master program at the Royal Academy of Art in The Hague, Netherlands, where he gets to spend ten months designing and researching type amongst the best in the field.

Holland is also home to dutch realism, cheap studios and soon Alex; reasons why nadine has decided to make the move as well. In exchange for your contribution to the initial moving fund, we offer to you at a discounted rate our colourful paintings and typeface.

Thank you friends, we are lucky to have the opportunity to develop our likes further and appreciate your help.

Sincerly,

Nadine & Alexandre

———

Svenja

Etienne

Nadine

Alexandre

Harvey

 

Subscript and superscript

Make your numbers look like real signs

Fractions

Type down fractions and see the magic of OpenType operating

Standard ligatures

Dutch digraph ij

Titling Alternates

Choose between compact headings or better spacing

Stylistic Alternates

Imitate the upside down M and W like changeable letter signs

 

Character set

Harvey includes many diacritics and supports 35 languages

 3 of the many inspiring signs on Harvey

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Hass. I am a Blogger, Radio Host & a Music Activist. I host Saudi's first FM Hip Hop Radio Show & i am the founder of Re-Volt Radio ( an online radio blog) aimed to support non-commercial music & to expose good art to the masses. 
  • This is bascially a campaign to pledge for my ticket from Jeddah (Saudi Arabia) to Chicago (USA) to be able to attend the IMAN (takin it to the streets'13) festival happenning on June 15th'13. This is important to me because I want tp interview the artists involved & i want to be able to experience this great positive vibe that reflects the true essence of ART!
  • You guys can make this happen & giving me one great gift that I will never forget. An apportunity to document this great festival. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I would need 3,000 USD. This will cover my air tickets (since at this time of year) the tickets are Sky Rocketing! 
  • Main goal is to connect with the Muslim Community there & document te diversity, the true colors & the true essence of ART. 
  • Should by any means I dont reach this funding, i will try myself to complete it - but any help from you will be more than appreciated. 
  • You will get a shot to be hosted on the radio by myself (LIVE) & also a high quality DVD of the documentary.

 

The Impact

  • This is crucially important especially at this time where the religion of ISLAM is being hijacked/attacked. This is a great example of how diverse Muslims are & how beautiful they are in their own skin. 
  • I am all about being REAL & thats what I want to be part of through IMAN (Streets2013)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant help financially - no worries. Spread the link around & i would appreciate every single post. 

1 love
