story:
Hello, we are Kris and Sabrina

     We have woken up today in this time of economic woe, to find out a credit card company has drained our bank account of all funds by possible fraud or clerical error. While we are hoping to get this sorted out it will still leave us penniless for the time being. Anyone who has ever had to deal with banks and missing funds will know how long it can take to actually get your money back into your account.

  **update- it does to appear to be a clerical error related to our online bill pay. Hopefully we will find out more today.

What We Need & What You Get

     In order to make our bills and rent for the month, we are hoping to raise $1000 dollars in a short period of time. We can bounce back from this unfortunate turn of events but could really use a kind hand in helping us to do that.
     Kris is a talented up-and-coming painter/illustrator working on both fine art and cartoons and Sabrina is a wonderful craftsperson who regularly sells her handmade wares on Etsy.
     We are more than happy to offer great gifts to contributors ranging from handmade cards, handmade coffee cozee's, all the way up to commissioned paintings.
 
   **update- we are very flexible with perks, you ave something in mind? We will make it happen!
 
     Thanks for all the love, support and understanding from everyone it has been very uplifting.
 
     Please feel free to browse some of our artistic work at
https://www.facebook.com/KoArtsinCraft
and
http://www.etsy.com/shop/theDoubtfulPixie
Kris also is an active part of the deviantART community and the bulk of his artistic work can be seen there at
http://krisowrey.deviantart.com/
 

The Impact

     We are a young couple who just celebrated our one year anniversary and have the joy of welcoming our first child into the world in a few weeks time. Your contribution will go solely to help us survive while the bank tries to sort out this mess for us. We are hoping that through small contributions we can reach enough people with the means to help us from falling too far behind on the bills we struggle to pay everyday. We live a humble lifestyle with no frills just hard work and love and every penny will be put to good use.

    

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this posts with folks you know to help us try and win this battle with the ruthless economy.
Visit Sabrina's Etsy Page and buy her handmade goods directly from her!
Visit Kris's Facebook page and have a painting commissioned to your liking.
 
We thank you for taking the time to read this and hope we can come out the other side with our heads still above water.
story_txt:
Hello, we are Kris and Sabrina
     We have woken up today in this time of economic woe, to find out a credit card company has drained our bank account of all funds by possible fraud or clerical error. While we are hoping to get this sorted out it will still leave us penniless for the time being. Anyone who has ever had to deal with banks and missing funds will know how long it can take to actually get your money back into your account.
  **update- it does to appear to be a clerical error related to our online bill pay. Hopefully we will find out more today.

story:
Who We Are

Bent-Con is the world's largest LGBTQ geek event, a mixing ground for fans, creators, industry and allies of the science fiction, fantasy and horror genres, as seen in comics, movies, games, literature and technology, to meet and celebrate their  love of the unfettered realms of imagination. We bring together artists, writers, creators, publishers, directors, actors, producers and celebrities with fans, fan groups, collectors and the merely curious.

We joke that we're like Comic-Con, only gayer, but when you look at the collection of humans and aliens and interdimensional beings that join together on our floor, we really are.

What We're Doing 

This is the third year of the convention. We launched in 2010, here in Los Angeles, California, more as a whim than anything else. We had 20 vendors crammed into an old storefront and everyone brought books to read, thinking no one would show. 500 people flowed through over the course of an afternoon, hungry for genre media that spoke to them -- or where they could geek out on mainstream movies, books and games in a queer way.

Last year, we exploded in size. We held a larger event, over a weekend, at a downtown Los Angeles hotel.  2000 people beat down the door to see our guests, listen to our panels, view films, dance in our costume contest and celebrate with other members of the community. The founders and crew were gobsmacked. Everyone cried more! More!

This year, after listening to fans, vendors and guests, we're now two and half days long, in a bigger venue still -- the Burbank Marriott and Convention Center -- with the best lineup of guests we've ever put together. Authors Christopher Rice and David Gerrold, actress Claudia Christian, creator Jane Espenson, artist Phil Jimenez, and the legend Wendy Pini are just some of those attending. We have so many more you have to go to our website to see the ever growing Assembly of Awesomeness scheduled to attend.

But with all of this has come growing pains. Lots and lots of growing pains.

Why We Need Your Help 

We're a non-profit, a 501c3 foundation -- hey, it's why your donation is tax deductible -- so we aren't in it for the money. Celebrating, showcasing, appreciating and networking are what the convention is about.

But that also means that we do this by the skin of our teeth, with much fretting, no frills and lots of niceities left out for lack of funds. The dedication of our team and volunteers make up most of the slack, but not all of it.

We cut corners wherever we can, do without many things common to other, larger, for profit conventions, and continually remain panicked that our memberships won't cover all the bills.

We'd love for that to change.

What We Want

This year we're looking for helping to pay a host of expenses, big and small, before the con starts and to add back in the box-full of corners we've had to cut out.

Your donations will help us do things like create step-and-repeats, red carpets, internet-wifi, professional grade video recording of panels, internet streaming of panels, scholarships, larger and more numerous meeting spaces, guest services, t-shirts for our volunteers and if we’re lucky for every attendee at the festival, access and opportunity for guests in other countries to attend, advertising -- real blessed advertising. -- signs, individual convention guides,  oh, and the event-space rental bill paid off before the con starts.

The Powers That Be with this convention are a determined and dedicated assortment of misfits, characters and broken toys. We're all a bit crazy to put this thing together; with your help, awareness and donations, our crazy will go much further than it has ever gone before.

Yes, that's a Star Trek reference. We're geeks.

Bent-Con FAQ:

Who makes Bent-Con happen?
Bent-Con is a concerted effort by individuals who are themselves a part of the communities they seek to celebrate with the festival. Artists, Writers, Film-makers, Fans and the sort.

Given your established history, why go this route with Indiegogo?
Because we’re committed to having more for the community that nurtures and supports the ideals and mission with this festival. We want to raise the bar on what’s expected, create more variety and challenge ourselves to see if we can continue to both grow and expand Bent-Con’s presence.

Why are you called,”Bent-Con?” Why not something else?
Being “Bent” isn’t straight, being Bent is also different and typically perceived as broken, damaged or not “right.” We wanted to say and celebrate that being different is perfectly okay, acceptable and welcome in this instance. We celebrate Difference.

Is the convention just about comic books?
No! It's about all things media. Comics are where we started, but we've quickly grown to include movies, books, TV, games... even a bit of technology, because our crowd loves the gadgets.

I thought there was a gay convention for video games?
There is! Gaymer Con is getting off the ground in 2013. (We're even showcasing them at our event.) While video and table-top games aren't our main focus as you can't geek out without gaming, too.

I’m not LGBT, can I come?
Absolutely! It’s in our mission statement: LGBT AND LGBT-friendly. Anyone who includes us or simply want to make it known they support, appreciate and celebrate with us are welcome. Even some of our exhibitors and guests are non-LGBT identified. Bent-Con is an educational foundation and we strive to share and include anyone and everyone who shares the same vision.

Why are you segregating yourselves? Isn’t that part of the problem?
Not at all. Bent-Con is committed to sharing and celebrating the contributions of those that are often times overlooked in a mainstream setting. And Bent-Con is simply acknowledging those contributions and celebrating our presence out loud.

Who are the gaylebrities available for lunch? 

They include: Justin Hall, Jon Macy, Zan Christensen, Mark Andreyko, Joe Phillips, Phil Jimenez, Patrick Fillion, Dave Davenport, Sean Z., Jeff Krell, Brian Anderson, David Gerrold. More are being added.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Jennifer. Im from Australia and my beautiful boyfriend Nantachai, who is from Thailand, is an amazing and truely gifted fire twirler and acrobat!

Born on a dirt floor in the remote town of Khon Kaen, Thailand, his family couldnt afford to send him to highschool. Instead he moved to Bangkok and started building bungalows at age 13. Then, at age 17, after spending a few years on a fishing boat he ended up swimming to shore at the beautiful island of Koh Tao. Here he started to learn how to spin fire for the passing tourists. Its 10 years later and he is one of the islands finest fire spinners, having taught himself to do back layouts using only the ocean. He is now  known throughout koh Tao, Koh Phangan and Koh Samui for his skills but sadly he is only ever able to work for tip money.

I myself am a circus performer and am studying at the Beijing International Acrobatics school which holds some of the worlds best teachers and, this year, I made an appliaction for him to attend. If we can raise the money for him to go, I believe this opportunity could change his life and the life to his family.

What We Need & What You Get

The school fees will be mostly covered by the chinese government and I myself am contributing $1000 of my saving to help with this. All that we need now is his airfare to and from beijing (estimated $600) and money to cover his accomodation and food for a years stay at the school(estimated$1900).All money raised will be going directly to Nantachai. And if we dont reach the goal I will endevour to find alternative ways to bridge the finacial gap for I dont want him to miss out on this once in a lifetime opportunity.

The Impact

In Thailand, Nantachai was only ever able to work for tip money, just enough to eat. At this school he will train in acrobatics, taking classes in tumbling, handstand, martial arts and tight rope. He will train with other artists from around the world, sharing ideas and creating good industry contacts. And, with his existing skills and natural ability I believe this opportunity would give him a chance to enter the world stage, performing in western coutnries and being able to earn enough money to support his family and give himself a far better life. For at the moment he can't afford to rent a bungalow and his mother is struggling to buy formula for his baby brother.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help I thank you for taking the time to read this and  please tell all your friends about him for every dollar will help!

story:
About Danger

Born and bred in the Garden State, I hail from the shores of the Atlantic Ocean in Asbury Park, NJ. In my childhood I was surrounded by performers and their art, where my imagination was encouraged to flourish. I have been writing for 10 years and have been participating at Loser Slam for the past 3. Aside from honing my craft as a writer, I have set my sights on competing nationally for my venue.

As most poets are wont to do, I try to capture otherwise faint blips of emotion, and use them to connect, inspire, and motivate. My writing is usually image heavy and tends to pack a punch. Every piece is crafted with the intention of being able to share my story as vividly and as beautifully as I can.

I am excited to announce that I will be competing at WOWps (Women of the World Poetry Slam) as Loser Slam's representative.

What is WOWps?

Poetry slam is a performance poetry competition in which the competitors are judged and scored by members of the audience. Women of the World Poetry Slam is one of the three national events for poetry slam. It started in 2008 as a way to offer women a national-level competition to express their voices. Our host city this year is Minneapolis, Minnesota.

How you can help

Every single cent that is raised will be going for registration, transportation (car rental and gas money), lodging, and food. Anything left over will go straight back to the Loser Slam hat. 

There are some pretty fantastic things you could receive from me if you help me fund this trip, every item will be passing through my hands and right into your's. (While possibly passing through a couple postal worker's hands as well.)

  • For just $5 I will leave you a special message on your facebook wall for you and your friends to see.
  • For $5 more you get 5 haiku. These will be all brand spankin new and will help me practice the art of brevity for your enjoyment.
  • When you contribute $25 you'll receive some facebook love, 5 haiku, and a bookmark made by your's truly! 
  • Contribute $40 and you'll get all the previous prizes as well as a signed copy of my first book, "Journey to the Heart of Danger"
  • Interested in contributing $65? Great! You'll get everything listed above and a copy of my voice melting sweetly into your ears (in the form of spoken word, of course.)
  • Really into the big guns? Alright--contribute $150 and you got yourself everything listed above plus a super relaxing back massage, complete with soothing music!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford anything I've listed? That's okay, I'm sure you know someone that can. Team up with me and get the word out to your friends and family. Forward this link to someone you know that loves poetry. Or just art. Or has a big heart. 

 

Thank you so much for your interest and support!

story:
It's the first warm, beautiful day of spring. You've been itching all winter to go riding. You jump on your quad and take off. Ten minutes later you stop. Why? To ease the pain in your throbbing thumb.

The patented DXTrigger is engineered to reduce pain and improve riding dynamics. Our inspiration materialized from the pain and difficulty of long ATV rides. The unique design delivers comfort and performance and works with the standard OEM throttle. 

The unique design enables 3 throttle options:

  • "Push" Traditional thumb throttle
  • "Trigger Pull" Comfortable finger throttle
  • "Pinch" Dynamic control using fingers and thumb

Benefits:

  • More comfortable ride
  • Better grip enhances throttle control over rough terrain
  • A more natural hand movement with the "pinch"
  • Easier for women, children, and small-handed creatures
  • Benefits people with thumb disabilities or arthritic conditions

We took it to the riders, both recreational and professional, and enjoyed watching their eyes light up and smiles grow big as they used the DXTrigger.

Who we are

We are a team of 10 creative minds with expertise in engineering, robotics, manufacturing, quality assurance and business. Most importantly, we all share the same passion and drive: innovating, inventing, and improving the world.

We have enjoyed the DXTrigger for years and think it's time that you should, too.  

 

What you can do

We have built and tested the DXTrigger for Honda, and now we need your support to begin production and bring it to riders everywhere. We will provide both durable plastic injection molded units as well as CNC machined aluminum units. All units will be manufactured and assembled in the U.S.A.

Don't own a Honda? Back us! Make this project a success and enable us to complete engineering the DXTrigger for ATVs made by other manufacturers.

Risks and challenges

All projects have risks, and as an experienced team we know how to manage them and achieve success. Our strategy includes good planning and continuous communication with suppliers.

We have inspected and selected a partner to make our molds and produce all plastic components. We have a good working relationship with them.

We also have machine shops ready to manufacture our metal components. Each company is professional and experienced, local to our community, and easy for us to work with.

We love quality and reliability. The first 1000 DXTriggers will be tested in-house against our stringent engineering standards. Further orders will continue to be inspected by dedicated Quality Control personnel.

By now you know that the DXTrigger delivers the ultimate comfort and performance long sought by the ATV community. We’re here for you, and ask that your return the favor.

Please pledge now!

story:
What?

It is the biggest beer on Playa, the Czech beer tradition embodied in huge beer mug. The well known mug - chubby glass with handle, with golden body and white fluffy foam hat. Mirage. When you see mirages on the Playa and the heat is making your mind see the things you want to see, suddenly there is a giant beer mug standing in front of you and stream for it - and you are saved in the middle of the desert.

The Czech Oasis will be part of the CORE (Circle Of Regionals Effigies) at Burning Man 2013.

And yes, it will be a giant beer! It will have shape of typical (Czech) beer mug with handle, with the beer foam on top. Made of ribbed wooden structure from solid wooden beams with white foam from balloons on top. The effigy is of round shape and it will look as a huge beer mug from every direction. We want to place the handle on the side, parallel to the man. We are sure people will love to pose for pictures as "holding" the beer with the man in background. (At least our team is excited to do so.)

 

Who?

This will be the first Czech project at Burning Man. The community in Czech Republic is slowly forming and this is for the first time when we are getting together as a group to travel to BRC and work on a project for all of its citizens.

 

We are group of...as you can see...fun people, who will pack our backpacks, fly over the ocean, get ready in Reno and build this great madness in the dust.

Why?

Oh, c'mon! Who would not want have giant beer on playa! :D

 

What We Need?

We are travelling from far away and unfortunately we won't have garage full of tools or materials we could use. That is the reason why set our funding goal for 6000 USD.

This amount will help us cover the material to built our project, tools and its transportation from Reno to playa.

We need - lumber (beams, plywood), ropes, nets, baloons, lights, extension wires, LED wire, basic tools as a saw, drills, hammers (you can imagine), tarp, fire extinguisher, transportation for the material...and of course the fuel to burn it ;)

All the people on our team are volunteers, no one is paid and we all have to secure our own funds to get to USA and on playa.

 

What You Get

 

We love our project and we want to share some great perks with you for your kind contributions.

* wooden beer mats = beer coasters with burned logo of the project (each burned by us)

* pins made from the beer bottle caps

* bandana with print of our logo

* special badge - each hand crafted on piece of leather or textile (as you wish)

* project T-shirt

* your name can float in our beer foam, we will be very happy to put it on one of the  balloons

* we will send you postcard from our beautiful city - Prague

* you can get maps of beers andbreweries in Prague or in Czech Republic (all texts in Czech and English and some in Geman as well)

* with the higher contributions you can get the original print of photograp of our CORE on playa (size A4)

* there is also limited version of original glass beer mugs by Czech glass makers with our logo (yes, we know it is not suitable for playa, but very cool to drink beer from it during the other 51 weeks, right?!)

* and we have one very special perk, which is the prototype of our beer logo stamp, which was forged by member of our CORE team...it is one of a kind!!!

 

We will try to deliver your perks during August, but we hope you understand that especially the bigger and special one will take little more time and will be delivered after Burning Man.

 

Other Ways You Can Help? SURE!

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

Please, share this campaign with your friends on facebook, twitter or send to your email contacts, who you think might be interested in this project.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!

Thank you so much for your support!

 

NA ZDRAVÍ! = CHEERS!
story_txt:
What?
It is the biggest beer on Playa, the Czech beer tradition embodied in huge beer mug. The well known mug - chubby glass with handle, with golden body and white fluffy foam hat. Mirage. When you see mirages on the Playa and the heat is making your mind see the things you want to see, suddenly there is a giant beer mug standing in front of you and stream for it - and you are saved in the middle of the desert.

The Czech Oasis will be part of the CORE (Circle Of Regionals Effigies) at Burning Man 2013.
And yes, it will be a giant beer! It will have shape of typical (Czech) beer mug with handle, with the beer foam on top. Made of ribbed wooden structure from solid wooden beams with white foam from balloons on top. The effigy is of round shape and it will look as a huge beer mug from every direction. We want to place the handle on the side, parallel to the man. We are sure people will love to pose for pictures as "holding" the beer with the man in background. (At least our team is excited to do so.)

 
Who?
This will be the first Czech project at Burning Man. The community in Czech Republic is slowly forming and this is for the first time when we are getting together as a group to travel to BRC and work on a project for all of its citizens.

 
We are group of...as you can see...fun people, who will pack our backpacks, fly over the ocean, get ready in Reno and build this great madness in the dust.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!
Thank you so much for your support!
 
NA ZDRAVÍ! = CHEERS!

story:
Short Summary

Aloha!

 I’m humbly asking for your support.

 I’m a skilled artist having attended 5 years of schooling with many famous master artist. I worked my way through art school managing a construction business before the US economy took a down spin in 2008. After 5 long years without work, living only for work trade for shared space or tent at times, I never lost site of my dream to work full time as an artist. Now I have been blessed, staying focused on my art, finally my art portfolio has awarded me an apprenticeship as a tattoo artist. I’ve received my required state license and I’m Currently doing my required 50-60 tattoos on friends before I can start earning money as a tattoo artist. The Art of tattoo is a very difficult task to master, while perfecting this art I need an additional income to help me along the way. I have been accepted into a local gallery as well but my production is slow due to lack of materials.

 Raising Funds to go to las vegas for a tattoo removal course and certification will add to my tattoo apprenticeship and able me the needed income to promote my art work as an oil painter and tattoo artist.

 This is my Plan to fund the promotion and the art supplies, to further my skills as an Impressionistic Oil painter and tattoo artist.

Some one asked why the pink Cadillac?

The Pink Cadillac stands for change. The pink cadillac is a painting that I decided to break away from realism and move twards imprissionism. So I started with the sky and incorperated brush strokes with feeling, and so the story goes. Blessed to have the realism training as it is a great help in learning the art of tattoo, however when I paint with oil paints I enjoy a more impressionistic style, with feeling. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

What the funds will cover:

Tattoo vanish school and certification.

http://www.tattoovanishinc.com/

Plane ticket round trip to Las Vegas from Maui where Tattoo removal course is held.

850.00     round trip air fair.

2400.00   Course  Tattoo Vanish.

250.00     Certification 1st year fee (this will also allow me to be on tattoo vanish web site.)

170.00     Hotel for 3 nights, 40.00 x2 and 90.00 x1 = 

160.00     Transportation to and from the hotel and class. Class is is 5 miles from the              hotel.

169.00    printing fee for 2 styles greeting cards total 200 qty. Vista print .com 

30.00      includes shipping. clear covers for greeting cards. 200 qty.

400.00     material budget for Offered Pet portraits and Flower paintings, oil paints and canvas and gamvar varnish. 

500.00     budget for shipping, post office,  small 5x5 painting, pet portraits and card orders.

421.11     for iddiegogo 9% fee.

I will post my Certification upon compleation of the course on my web site

at www.mebelingart.com

You can also view my progress on our face book page at

Zen Tattoo and Art Gallery.

I'm not on the web site as of yet. When I complete my apprenticeship I will be on the web site, for now i'm only on the Face book page.

http://www.zentattoomaui.com/index.html 

 

If i'm not able to reach my goal by the dead line I will apply the funds I've made here to the trip and it will take me a few more months to save up for the course. I have a special discount for the course if i go before September. If not it will cost me 20% more for the course as listed above. So I pray to reach my goal. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Impact

Helping Me to support my art will allow me to support my other local passion and that is local organic agriculture/ local farmers. I also like to help others with special needs. Having been without steady income for 5 years has given me a great deal of compassion for those with out. So I wish to help others on a local level with my art.

This is an example of some one I would like to help through my art. https://www.facebook.com/OurJourneyWithAutism

Aloha Smiles

Other Ways You Can Help

All my Beautiful friends please use the Indiegogo share tools!

I understand If you are unable to contribute to my cause, so I humbly ask you to pass this along to those that may.  Mahalo (Thank you Kindly)  and Blessings

story:
Summary

Our camp has been going to Burning Man for 7 years. It has gotten to a point that to give back to a community that has shaped our way of life is to totally infuse our selves with that community. 

Our Goal is to provide Live Music - Visuals - Fog and Lights to 30 plus people driving down the playa keeping the dream alive. We have got a solid team on this so far all we need now is 25% more funding to actually keep this vehicle going for 7 days in the desert. 

      Over $8,000 have already been spent and with another $5,000 we can keep the energy of Burning Man alive on the playa 2013.

story:
I'm just a Digital Sculptor trying to make custom statues based on characters that I love. I was always fascinated by how even the non official garage kits based on Japanese Animes are high quality. I want to somewhat follow the same trend. However, it will not just be limited to animes and mangas.

Project details:

Prototype is ready. All that remains is figuring out no. of copies that needs to be made. Overall, it is a pretty expensive process. Funding that will be generated will be used to produce resin copies and the profit will entirely go towards funding the future projects. Though to be honest with the profit I am making I will probably end up mostly funding my own future project.

Size: 10 inch.

Material: Grey Resin (Polyurethane)

Digital Concept: http://usmanhayat.deviantart.com/art/Digital-Concept-Supergirl-Statue-361702718

Turnaround: http://vimeo.com/62838656

Prototype: http://usmanhayat.deviantart.com/art/Supergirl-Statue-370246174?q=gallery%3Ausmanhayat&qo=0

Delivery Date: 2-3 weeks. Painted version will take couple of months.

Shipping:  Not included in the perks. It will be charged on individual bases depending on where you want it shipped and which perk you choose. Shipping cost on Painted figure will be higher than that of Garage kits. You will be contacted before the goods can be shipped so you can pay the remaining amount.

story:
How to Sell Like Jesus

I was born in the slums of Bombay, India, the only son to Catholic Anglo Indian parents whom i lost to alcoholism. I thereafter spent the majority of my childhood as an errand boy for my aunt who provided an education in return.

After a great deal of relentless effort to get ahead in life by trying everything and anything i possibly could, i hit upon the idea of trying to apply the words of Jesus in my business life.

I picked Jesus because He was the only 24/7 clearly successful marketing guru i could afford. He was free!!! 

That's when the magic happened and in a short span of 10 years i built a hugely successful pan-Asian publishing/Communications business without ever once revealing what made me successful. It was my secret that i would not share with anyone.

In early 2013, i met with a terrible accident in Hong Kong and was hospitalised for nearly two months. Doctors had nearly given up on me when one night i felt a presence in the hospital ward. Instinctively, i knew it was God and i begged for my life on behalf of my two young children.   

The following morning doctors informed me that there was a turnaround in my condition. That same night i felt the presence again and asked what i could do to express my gratitude. I felt told to share my success secrets with those who are now where i once was -- struggling to get ahead in life.

I said - "No this is a bad idea. Why should i share? Who would believe me? The world was not grateful to You when you were here. In return for Your love we nailed You to the cross and haven't stopped celebrating that shameful act, since. NO! Anything but that! I protested.

He remained unmoved. It was either that or nothing. 

Soon after being discharged from hospital i told my colleagues this tale and they believed. They gave me the time and space to write How to Sell Like Jesus which i completed in a little under three weeks. 

A series of events unfolded including people who I had never met before appearing out of thin air to help me make the book a reality and publish it on Kindle Amazon. Here is the link for the free preview. -- http://www.amazon.com/How-Sell-Like-Jesus-ebook/dp/B00AVKZVJE/ref=sr_1_1?s=digital-text&ie=UTF8&qid=1357085667&sr=1-1&keywords=How+to+Sell+Like+Jesus

I began a facebook page (www.facebook.com/HowToSellLikeJesus) therafter and under less than 2 months, the book has nearly 10,000 Likes from more than 15 countries. Questions pour in from readers and i try to answer them each morning after asking Jesus what to write. 

ALL THE LETTERS still appear there and i invite you to inspect each and everyone of these before you make your decision to support How to Sell Like Jesus. 

Those reading the book and the Q&A on the facebook site have testified that they do not believe i am capable of the answers i have written. I believe so too. 

Friends came forward with time, talent and money to help make the site www.howtoselllikejesus.com  and we produced the first print run of 2000 copies that are now selling in Hong Kong and the Philippines for US$15 and US$8 resply.

MY CAMPAIGN: I want to be able to make the printed copy available to as many book stores in as many countries as possible eventually But THIS campaign is targetted at having the print copies at least in a few stores in the United States, India and more stores the Philippines.

 

It is important to me that i do whatever i am capable of, to bridge the gap between God and His people so that more can benefit professionally and personally as i have.  

Your contribution will help get How to Sell Like Jesus to at least ONE bookstore in every state in the US, India and the Philippines. This will mean setting up a small company and printing in those countries so as to keep costs low and eliminate transport and/or mailing.

I will also need to make testimonial videos for each of my targetted three countries to as to creat more awarness of this unique resource.   

 

What We Need 

I need at least US$100,000 to set up a small registered legal identity company in these countries, print and promote locally and have at least ONE bookstore in each state keep the book and price it at least at US$15 so as to keep it affordable.

The goal is to have at least 1000 copies in each of these three countries to start with and replinish as they are sold. Money will also be spent to promote the book in the form of book signings, social networking platforms, testimony videos etc. 

Contributors will be able to follow the book's progress on the site as well as on the book's facebook site.

What You Get

Each contributor gets his/her name aside an angel depicted on the site's page --  www.howtoselllikejesus.com/angels.html and those contributing more than US$25 get their name and photo (if they wish) on the ANGELS page in a listing that we will feature beneath the world map illustration.  

If i don't reach my goal, the funds will be used to make promotional tools like testimony videos, illustrations, social networking ads etc to help draw more people to engage with the book's facebook site and benefit from the shared wisdom unfolding there from reader's letters and God's answers to them.  

If this particular fund raising effort is not deemed successful by God, i will persist in my efforts until i realise my dream in making How to Sell Like Jesus available to those who need it most. This has become my life's cause and will only stop when God calls me to eternally rest at His feet. 

The Impact

This project is about opening people's eyes by tearing off the blindfold and schackles that our cunning society progressively ensalves us with from the moment we are born. Proof fo this is all over us. Look what our 'well-meaning society' has led us -- to the brink of WWIII. See how so many are poor and so few are rich?

This projest is about empowering our young by showing them proof of how honesty, sincerity, love for our fellow being makes AWESOME BUSINESS SENSE!  

Each chapter in How to Sell Like Jesus shows how I discovered the awesome power in Jesus' simple words and applied them to HUGE sucess in my professional life as a salesman. 

I believe that no matter HOW DISADVANTAGED you may be, if you do your part honestly, using His principles, He will help you to get WHATSOEVER IS BEYOND YOUR REACH!. This is what the little youtube video we made, shows. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Those unable to contribute money can still be an important part of this project:

If you would like to support this dream but don't have the money to contribute, you can STILL PLAY A PART by promoting this effort on your social networks, help us to get investors or simply follow the book on facebook and participate in the dream that WILL become a reality.

Please help me to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you 

Your's humbly

Glenn Rogers

I believe that no matter HOW DISADVANTAGED you may be, if you do your part honestly, using His principles, He will help you to get WHATSOEVER IS BEYOND YOUR REACH!. This is what the little youtube video we made, shows. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Those unable to contribute money can still be an important part of this project:
If you would like to support this dream but don't have the money to contribute, you can STILL PLAY A PART by promoting this effort on your social networks, help us to get investors or simply follow the book on facebook and participate in the dream that WILL become a reality.
Please help me to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you 
Your's humbly
Glenn Rogers

story:
Our Story

We are driven by the desire to empower the artists, who will empower the people. 

 

This message comes on behalf of the New Works Festival of CalArts in the hopes of establishing a mutually beneficial relationship between you and our group. The New Works Festival is a student driven movement to empower young artists. New Works serves as the only avenue on the CalArts campus for students to obtain agency, and showcase their original work. This year, the New Works committee hopes to expand the scope and scale of our festival encouraging more students to participate. 

 

In the past two years New Works has evolved into a powerful venue for students to explore the endless possibilities of what art is, and how art can be made. Run by five students, the festival encourages interdisciplinary collaboration, explorative processes, and immersive risk-taking. We expanded the festival from four days to three weeks, accepting 52 projects compared to what had traditional been a 10 show festival. Directly and indirectly we touched the entire institute and mobilized a group of over 200 artists. Excitement for this year's festival is already palpable, and we now seek financial support to make it happen. 

 

The Impact

 

The collective efforts of 5 students are being pooled to ensure that New Works evolves into a powerful artistic and educational experience: artistically, academically and emotionally. 

 

We are motivated by a mutually shared desire to expand our reach, accepting more projects, and increasing student participation. We will encourage the use of alternative performance spaces, curate a festival that showcases a diverse body of work, and facilitate outer metier experimentation. Finally, we will provide social venues for students to meet fellow artists in order to establish networks that will launch them smoothly into the next phase of their artistic careers. 

 

We must, however, address our obstacles, namely, our limited budget, which hinders our ability to achieve the level of communication, visibility, and organization necessary to achieve our goals.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

Sponsorship is a vital part of what will allow New Works to operate this year. The funds we collect will be used to fund small-scale student generated projects, and social events for students to meet fellow artists.  New Works is a student run group that, like all professional art organizations, runs on a deficit regardless of the qualitative cultural contributions that it makes. We rely on the support of community members, local businesses, and people like you  to help us fulfill our mandate. One of our foremost goals is to give back to the local community by providing a setting in which people of diverse persuasions can come together to share in a dynamic an engaging cultural experience. It is only though the support of people like you that New Works can achieve this goal.


Your support will be invaluable to this year's festival, its continued success, and of tremendous importance to all the students involved. 

 

 

Thank you,

New Works Committee 2012

story:
The Disco Ball is a 15 foot diameter helium balloon disco ball that will float 20 feet above the Black Rock Desert this year at Burning Man.

It will be sewn from poly-tarp, lined with a weather balloon and covered in hundreds of silver mylar mirrors. Six strands of 850 pound test kite line will anchor it via a pulley system that can lower it in high winds. Three theater spotlights will illuminate it from all sides, and a small gear motor will keep it rotating.

This project is not funded by the Burning Man Organization. If you want to support the Disco Ball but can’t contribute financially, your time and effort assisting with promotion and fund raising will be a tremendous help.

Perks for supporters include your name and a quote on the Disco Ball, a DVD, and pieces of the project after the event.

Follow the blog: http://giantfloatingdiscoball.blogspot.com

story:
Our Sparkly Story

The Burlesque Boutique LLC is the first of its kind here in Seattle; we offer top of the line burlesque accessories, performance material, and educational items in a cozy and classy lounge style shop. Our Goal is to be open by Summer 2011! 


Our target market is professional and seasonal burlesque, boylesque, cabaret, and drag performers; the novice, daring housewives, gift giving lovers, your nine-to-fiver, and the little diva in all of us that want to be sparkly.


While there are many places around Seattle that carry products performers use, The Burlesque Boutique is the only place one can meet all his or her burlesque needs at one location. We are a one stop shop. Our goal is to supply performers with all their accessory and embellishment must haves. We will educate the inform the public about the 'The Art of the Tease' with books, magazines, and movies dedicated to Burlesque. We aim to build good will and community by selling items made by local burlesque performers, participating in community events, and referring to other retailers and vendors.


Management of The Burlesque Boutique is headed by its owner, Tanya Harris, with eleven years of extensive retail experience and a Bachelors of Science in Fashion Merchandising. Ms. Harris will have a hands-on approach in the company. Harris is also a respected and well known performer, Ruby Mimosa, with international burlesque troope The Atomic Bombshells, and instructor at Miss Indigo Blue's Academy of Burlesque.


Burlesque is happening around the globe! There is a major resurgence occurring throughout the United States, Europe, Australia, and Asia. Amazingly enough, many of the international performers who participate in festivals worldwide live right here in Seattle. The late Gypsy Rose Lee, a pinnacle woman in the Golden Age of Burlesque profiled in the theatrical movie “Gypsy”, is from Washington. Burlesque Superstars like Dita Von Tease are doing commercials for Wonderbra and Perrier; there is a Burlesque Hall of Fame, an annual festival in Las Vegas, Nevada, which promotes the knowledge, art form, and legends of Burlesque. In November 2010 Hollywood capitalized on the term burlesque, coming out with major motion picture “Burlesque” starting Cher and Christina Aguilera. In television, hit show “America's Got Talent” has burlesque contestants Michelle L'Amour, Fuchsia Foxx, and The Atomic Bombshells. Let's face it... Burlesque is everywhere!


The Glitter Impact

The Burlesque Boutique will be a one stop shop for performers! There is not currently a place in the city to find high quality burlesque/ performance accessories and embellishments. Help us become the first boutique that is convenient and accessible, catering to the needs of performers in Seattle and the Capitol Hill neighborhood.

The Burlesque Boutique will also be an outlet for performers who have items to sell; getting their name and products out to the public. We strive to promote and build good will with all types of performers in this rich and artistic beautiful city.


What We Need & What You Get

Here's the dish! I am looking to raise a total of $57,000 for the initial start up of the Burlesque Boutique. With IndieGoGo, I am fundraising for $7,000. The amount raised will go to the purchase of our inventory, purchase of fixtures, website design and compensation, signage (hanging neon and sandwich boards), actual build out of the store including construction and electrical wiring, promotional materials, rent, attorneys and bookkeepers fees.

It's not a waste! If we do not reach our entire goal, the money raised will still put towards the purchase of these items. 

Other funding sources: Private Investors and Small Business Loans

Perks!!! Refer to the right side of the screen for details


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time reading this and hopefully pledging. I am very grateful for all the support and excitement in The Burlesque Boutique.

Please pass this along to your friends, family, and colleagues. Every cent earned through this campaign will go a long way in the start up costs and launch of The Burlesque Boutique LLC.  .

Also, Please use the "Share" tools to help spread the word!!

With warmth, sparkles and thanks!!!

Tanya Harris/ Ruby Mimosa xox

story:
ALZHEIMER'S IS SCARY— ART ISN'T

You hear it everywhere—stories about Alzheimer’s and dementia full of fear, sadness and loss.  Those with the disease are most often spoken of in the past tense—empty shells where someone used to be. 

It's no surprise that most of us tend to turn away as fast as we can.

But art invites you in—past the fear.  One look at Mom's fascinating paintings and you can immediately see a nimble mind at work—funny, inventive and full of life.

With your help, the art will spread the word far and wide that those with the disease are still here—living lives of value, creativity and joy, plus it will generate funding for arts programs for people living with Alzheimer’s. 

Mother discovered her inner artist late in life. At the age of 89 with a short term memory of 3 seconds, she forgot to tell herself that she didn’t paint and stunned everyone with her glorious art.


In the early years, Mom painted what she saw on the table of her painting class. When she saw a flower, she painted a flower...or in this case, strawberries.


The more she painted the more fanciful her paintings became. The subjects on the table—flowers, fruits, vegetables—didn’t change but Mom began to transform them into something completely unexpected and almost always alive. She saw zucchinis as dragons and a bouquet of flowers as a bird hungrily eyeing an insect. The paintings are often perfectly symmetrical and tend to have a face.


Now she paints largely from her mind’s eye though you can definitely see the traces of the subject on the table. We never know what to expect but the art is fascinating. It provides a window into her mind—to thoughts and emotions she is unable express any other way.

“There is whimsy and almost impish joy in your mom’s painting. Her art is a miraculous example of a still-active mind which has found a means of self-expression. I hope your mother’s art and your beautiful calendar will encourage others to explore ways to encourage and unleash the creative spark that Alzheimer’s cannot quench.”  Rob T


“The paintings are evocative, colorful and deep with whimsy. I look forward to seeing each new creation, and marvel at the newly expressed talent. Her art is a wonderful window into a soul...The colors, shapes, are so beautiful and frankly, profound.” Cathi S

Now 95, Mom is still painting—though she has no conscious memory of doing so and actively resists the idea as nonsense. Yet she has captured the imagination of a legion of fans and the media alike for a story about Alzheimer’s/dementia with hope and heart...most recently, with her EMMY-winning, KING5TV story, "I'm Still Here."

http://www.king5.com/news/Those-suffering-from-Alzheimers-are-still-here-209108031.html

IMPACT

Our budget of $4,000 will cover the design and printing of the cards and calendars, artist fees plus all campaign expense and fulfillment of all perks.

It will also allow us to market the art—paintings by Mom and others—with net proceeds to support art programs for people living with Alzheimer’s and dementia. 

  THE 2015 CALENDAR

“Your Mom's calendar inspires me every day."  Cindy T

Premium quality, custom designed, the calendar is 12”x12” opening to 12”x24”, it will feature 12 of Mom’s paintings plus photos of the objects she was painting. It’s fascinating to see them through Mom’s eyes. 

THE NOTE CARDS

With way too many favorites, it was difficult to choose the art for the cards but my sister and I winnowed it down to 8 different designs.  Each card will also show the object she was painting.  4 1/2" x 6 1/4" on white, uncoated stock.  Plus envelopes.

Mom on her 95th birthday

When I tell Mom that people like her art, her reaction is one of astonishment—first at the idea that she paints and second at the idea that anyone would like it. When I tell her that people actually want to buy her work, her reaction is immediate. “They’re crazy!” But then she relents, “Oh, I suppose that’s all right.”  But truly, if she knew that her art was helping people, she would be enormously pleased.

“Colorful, fanciful, playful and creative! Words that describe the Calendar and the artist! Each month the Calendar provides another phantasmagorical image that tickles the heart and brings a smile, along with changing my perspective about life and living in the moment. I'm supporting this Campaign so the 2015 Calendar can brighten my wall and continue to open my eyes.” Betsy G

HOW YOU CAN HELP: My sincerest thanks for your interest in Mom’s art.  Even if you can’t contribute, please consider helping spread the word by posting a link to this page on Facebook. You can also send links to everyone and everyplace you can to my Facebook page www.facebook.com/TheArtOfAlzheimers/ or the website at www.theartofalzheimers.net/

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Acknowledgements and Thanks

Elderwise—Thanks to Sandy Sabersky and the wonderful Elderwise program at Horizon House in Seattle. With their guidance and encouragement, Mom continues to paint and amaze.

John Sharify and Doug Burgess for their moving and Emmy winning story about Mom on KING5 TV

Charlie Watts and William Thompson and WattsMedia for their beautiful film about Mom

John Engerman/Bicameral Design for graphic design

Mary Fields for generously providing the video

Ruby de Luna and KUOW 94.9 for being the first to tell her story

Risks and challenges

Our designers and printer are ready to go.  We just need you!

story:
HELP GET RIGOBERTO A. GONZALEZ'S PAINTINGS TO HOUSTON, TEXAS 

Help Make Art - A Voice for the Border



Thanks so much to everyone who has donated so far!


Due to unforeseen shipping issues, (extra wrapping and labor costs) the bill was $392 more than we had anticipated. Our new goal is $2627. Please consider donating if you have not already. This online campaign will be open until March 9, 2012


Help support this rising artist: Every penny counts!


Our Story


Mexican-American artist Rigoberto A. Gonzalez has the opportunity to exhibit his powerful paintings about the drug wars across the Texas-Mexico border in the heart of Houston, which is the fourth largest city in America. In order to make this powerful exhibition happen, his paintings need to be trucked approximately 792 miles from Las Cruces, New Mexico. It will take $2,000 in gas, drivers and insurance to move the work for an exhibition at the Art League Houston opening on March 9.  If you can help get the work here, the space is available and the media is interested! Let the people of Houston see this work for the first time, hear the story it tells and reconsider the power of art to address the most difficult of issues.  


About the paintings


Gonzalez created the paintings in Roswell, New Mexico, and was inspired by the violent confrontations between drug cartels, Mexican federal troops, and people involved in illegal immigration in his home town of Reynosa; a border city in the northern part of Mexico.


The artist paints in a Baroque-style found in the 17th century paintings by artist such as Caravaggio and Jusepe de Ribera.  This style often incorporates storytelling as away to depict great historical dramas, with rich colors, and symbolism.


Rigoberto brings an additional voice to this story with a reference to the rich tradition of storytelling by placing the portraits of two musicians into his paintings. The musicians are playing songs known as a corridos, which are a narrative tradition in northern Mexico and usually express unpleasant stories about oppression and violence. Rigoberto sees his paintings as contemporary visual corridos, which are not made up of rhyme and verse, but instead of paint and movement.




Impact


  • Rigoberto's paintings will highlight the rich historical tradition of artists who express violence through the beauty of painting as a way of bringing difficult issues into peoples lives like artists such artists like Caravaggio and Goya.  


  • Rigobertoâ€™s paintings will offer the Houston community an artistic snapshot of what is happening on the order side of the border and express a voice for the people who are affected.  


  • The work will motivate the community to raise important questions about what is exactly  happening on the border, and why artists throughout history have chosen to explore contemporary issues within their culture. These questions and many more will be explored and talked about in panel discussions at Art League Houston and Talento BilingÃ¼e de Houtson in Houston.  


  • Rigabertoâ€™s work will highlight the importance of art-making as a meaningfully tool to connect to, view, evaluate and understand the world. Rigoberto will take part in a unique painting demonstration at Art League, where he will reveal the methods of his painting process.     


What we want and want you get

Every Mile counts!

We are asking people to make monetary contributions to the sum of $2000 through this indigogo page to pay for the transport of the artwork from Las Cruces, New Mexico to Houston, Texas. All Donors will receive a thank you letter from Art League Houston a 501 c-3, acknowledging their contribution to this project.


Rigoberto can only seize this exciting opportunity to exhibit in an amazing location in Houston if you can help fund the $2000 cost of trucking the work to Houston. The distance of the trip is 792 miles, which is only $2.50 a mile! And every mile counts!


Donor Benefits:


$150+ All of the below plus a signed drawing by Rigoberto A. Gonzalez

$50     All of the below plus lunch with the artist and curator at the Art League

$35     All of the below plus a membership to the Art League Houston

$25     Private preview of the exhibition with artist. Glass of champagne provided.

$5       Provides trucking for the distance of 2 miles from Las Cruces, New Mexico, to Houston, Texas.


Other Ways You Can Help
Use the share tools on this site to spread the word about funding this exhibition and help us promote this exhibition. Visit http://www.artleaguehouston.org/index.html  to see other diverse programs hosted by Art League Houston.

Thanks so much to everyone who has donated so far!




Due to unforeseen shipping issues, (extra wrapping and labor costs) the bill was $392 more than we had anticipated. Our new goal is $2627. Please consider donating if you have not already. This online campaign will be open until March 9, 2012



Help support this rising artist: Every penny counts!


Our 
Story
Mexican-American 
artist Rigoberto A. Gonzalez has the opportunity to exhibit his 
powerful paintings about the drug wars across the Texas-Mexico border in the 
heart of Houston, which is the fourth largest city in America. In order to make 
this powerful exhibition happen, his paintings need to be trucked approximately 
792 miles from Las 
Cruces, New Mexico. It will take $2,000 in gas, drivers and insurance to move the work for an 
exhibition at the Art League Houston opening on March 9.  If 
you can help get the work here, the space is available and the media is 
interested! Let 
the people of Houston see this work for the first time, hear the story it tells 
and reconsider the power of art to address the most difficult of issues. 
 
About 
the paintings

Gonzalez 
created the paintings in Roswell, New Mexico, and was 
inspired by the violent confrontations between drug cartels, Mexican federal 
troops, and people involved in illegal immigration in his home town of Reynosa; 
a border city in the northern part of Mexico.


The 
artist paints in a Baroque-style found in the 17th century paintings by artist 
such as Caravaggio and Jusepe de Ribera.  This style often incorporates 
storytelling as away to depict great historical dramas, with rich colors, and 
symbolism.


Rigoberto 
brings an additional voice to this story with a reference to the rich tradition 
of storytelling by placing the portraits of two musicians into his paintings. 
The musicians are playing songs known as a corridos, which are a narrative 
tradition in northern Mexico and usually express unpleasant stories about 
oppression and violence. Rigoberto sees his paintings as contemporary visual 
corridos, which are not made up of rhyme and verse, but instead of paint and 
movement. 




Impact




Rigoberto's 
paintings will highlight the rich historical tradition of artists who express 
violence through the beauty of painting as a way of bringing difficult issues 
into peoples lives like artists such artists like Caravaggio and Goya. 
 



Rigobertoâ€™s 
paintings will offer the Houston community an artistic snapshot of what is 
happening on the order side of the border and express a voice for the people who 
are affected.  



The 
work will motivate the community to raise important questions about what is exactly  happening on the border, and why artists throughout history have chosen 
to explore contemporary issues within their culture. These questions and many 
more will be explored and talked about in panel discussions at Art League 
Houston and Talento 
BilingÃ¼e de Houtson in Houston. 
 



Rigabertoâ€™s 
work will highlight the importance of art-making as a meaningfully tool to 
connect to, view, evaluate and understand the world. Rigoberto will take part in 
a unique painting demonstration at Art League, where he will reveal the methods 
of his painting process.     



What 
we want and want you get
Every 
Mile counts!



We are asking people to make monetary contributions to the sum of $2000 through this indigogo page to pay for the transport of the artwork from Las Cruces, New Mexico to Houston, Texas. All Donors will receive a thank you letter from Art League Houston a 501 c-3, acknowledging their contribution to this project.


Rigoberto 
can only seize this exciting opportunity to exhibit in an amazing location in 
Houston if you can help fund the $2000 cost of trucking the work to Houston. 
The 
distance of the trip is 792 miles, which is only $2.50 a mile! And every mile 
counts!

Donor 
Benefits:


$150+ 
All of the below plus a signed drawing by Rigoberto A. Gonzalez$50 
    All of the below plus lunch with the artist and curator at the Art 
League
$35 
    All of the below plus a membership to the Art League Houston
$25 
    Private preview of the exhibition with artist. Glass of champagne 
provided.
$5 
      Provides trucking for the distance of 2 miles from Las Cruces, New Mexico, 
to Houston, Texas.

Other 
Ways You Can HelpUse 
the share tools on this site to spread the word about funding this exhibition and help us promote this exhibition. Visit http://www.artleaguehouston.org/index.html 
 to see other diverse programs hosted by Art League Houston.

story:
About my work:
"Researches the issues of contemporary populist movements, including animal and human rights activism, and their strategies. Hypocrisy within these movements and discourses is the main focus point of her work."


Hello, my name is TINKEBELL.
Im a Dutch artist and currently working on a large project called "SAVE THE WORLD". For this project I travel around the world to 'save' people, animals, places and situations 'according to the Dutch norms'
SAVE THE WORLD in South Korea

In January 2012 I'm planning to visit South Korea...
Earlier this year I 'saved' a dog in Gambia, a family in Guinea Bissau, 69 turtles from being eaten in China and a complete neighborhood in Peru. All were part of her SAVE THE WORLD project: Interventions worldwide that explore what happens when we force our (Western) view of the world on other cultures.


About the project
When we, as Western people, or more specific, born in the Netherlands, travel around the world, to countries which are “less Western” or just “differt”  (which is in fact every place outside the Netherlands) we all experience the same thing: We se see how people, situatations, animals, ‘things’ are treated in a wrong way. Things arent organized well (enough) and the way people live, roads are made, buildings are build is done badly.

 Everything is always better in the Netherlands. We know how to get things done and how the world should be organized.

This feeling shows up especially at the moments we experience cultures that are different from ours. Even in countries that, at first sight, look very close to our own culture.

And this feeling that we have as Dutch people, is often not just a feeling. There are many cases where we also act towards it:

For example: We have an organization in the Netherlands that asks Dutch foreigners when they are on vacation in certain countries, to get street dogs from, for example Spain, on the plane to the Netherlands. This organization places these dogs in families to keep them as a pet. Because, according to this organization: The dog has the right to be loved and taken care of by a family.

When we travel to Africa for a nice warm holiday in the sun, it is completely normal to bring an extra suitcase flled with our own old clothes: To give away to the people there: An ideal way to get rid of your junk and at the same time getting the feeling to do something good for the world.

The thing we often forget in these “good deeds” is to communicate. Do you actually need our help? And if so, what kind of help can I (we) offer? Even at times we do ask ‘locals’ about how they feel it doesn't really matter what they say. We keep thinking that “the don't know any better”.

Isnt it pure arrogance to think that everything is better the we handle things? That our norms are superior next to any other culture? And that, without having the experience to live in a different cultural environment?


The project “SAVE THE WORLD” is a project about this clash between different cutures. The need to help people to pamper our own ego without communication with the “needed”.








The plan
 With this project “SAVE THE WORLD” I want, beside the signalised clash, also discuss our own norms we use as a base to ‘help’.

Through a series of interventions in about 10 different countries spread over the world I’m planning to ‘save’ people, nimals, situations etc. to our Dutch norm. In this way, by decontextualizing this norm, I hope to show this clash to my audience and I also hope to create a discussion about the imperfectness of our own norms.

Between these interventions I present my world saving activities to a large audience at multi media art centre Mediamatic in Amsterdam (NL). The audience there will also be my think tank for future interventions within this project and with every presentations there will be speakers from different groups like NGO’s, philosophers, politicians etc.


At the end of these SAVE THE WORLD series there will be an overall exhibition about the project at Mediamatic and TOCHGallery in Amsterdam and at the Active Space in NYC. (end 2012/begin 2013)
At the same time there will be a book published (SAVE THE WORLD) with an overview of all interventions, presented as a personal diary.
Finally there will also be the presentation of a documentary made by “Jan de Bruin”: He follows me during the whole project for this film and meanwhile he makes short films to present all the interventions separately.

What I hope to achieve is a new, more open way of thinking about- and looking at our way of “helping” all over the world. What are the changes if we throw away this feeling of living in a superior culture?

 
Reconcideration of norms and redefining ‘help’.


How I work
In the gallery you find the movies of previous interventions in Gambia, Guinea Bissau, China and Peru to give you an idea of what I’m planning to do in about 10 different countries spread over the world in the next 2 years.

Every time when I arrive in another country, I will do some research first. What is different from our norms and where do I get the urge to intervene, to help?
So, I cant say on forehand what I will do while I’m visiting a new place. It is all based on described concept and then, research at the location where I am.
The average time I need for that will be around 4 or 5 weeks per country, with the possibility that I have to come back (like in the Guinea Bissau example) to work things out.

 

So, what do I need?
That's hard to say because at the moment I decide exactly what to do is when I'm already in South Korea. So, I can tell you know that the price of a plane ticket will be about $1000,- and staying and living in or around Seoul for one month will be about $2500,-

The average amount I've spent per intervention is about $15000,- So that's the amount of money I try to raise here right now.

Other ways you can help
Spread the word!!! Tell your friends/family/neighbors that the best Christmas gift ever is (to) SAVE THE WORLD!!!

Besides that: Maybe you have a house, an apartment or any opportunity to invite me somewhere. Or maybe you live in South Korea and you can help me around when I'm there?

story:
Short Summary

It began at best buy, I was in a box.

I was put over the counter and carried away.

I knew my purpose,  but had no idea of the journey's yet to come.

I heard though the box that the lady had sold all her expensive bags to buy me.

I knew at that moment I was in for a good life with her.

After a few weeks of my buttons being clicked and a lot of deleting and I was on a plane.

Together her and I captured putting a Cambodian child in school, then we climbed the Great Wall of China.

I was brand new and had already traveled to two countries!

A month later I was back in NYC and always around her shoulder, we were in so many places capturing talent and random adventures.

The next trip to Cambodia I found myself in a village capturing children capturing images, my mom was teaching them how to use camera's just like me but smaller. 

I got really dirty shooting a bathroom being built and learning center being erected.

We went on so many trips and I was able to capture Cambodia's first hip hop festival, it was incredible!

After 6 months I was back in NYC again and we met this young woman who sings like an angel, from then on I saw her everyday and recorded her feats all over New York as well as SxSw in Texas.

I was excited to leave and anticipated another adventure opportunity would arise and I was right!  May of  2011 we went to Mexico just mama photo and I. We were doing more stuff with kids and beads and yarn. 

Within two weeks I was right back in NYC and yes again following the angel singer to all sorts of venues where crowds of people cheered loudly.

The following month we packed up in a car and hit the road. We traveled all over the USA on a music tour, Vans  Warped something, I can't remember all these names:) I even was used while my mom was driving! She's always so brave with me, and I always felt safe to take the shot.

Summer passed and it was back to NYC running all over to different music venues capturing the angel singer.

I knew we would be on the road again soon, my mom cant sit still for long! But before that would happen I would witness all the work I had done with her in this giant bright gallery! WOW did we create! I was happy to see our images not through us, but through others.

Last week i realized we'd be going back to Mexico and to other places around the area, mom the angel singer and me. It would be so nice to capture those happy children learning again!

We arrived and I was soon thrown over her shoulder ( my very favorite place to be) we took a long metro and bus to these Giant ancient temples called Teotihuancan, hope I spelled that right! I have never captured anything so big besides the Great wall and I was so inspired.

We captured all day her and I, even the angel singer started using me. I was loved, i was fulfilling my purpose.

The bus ride home my mom was tired and zipped me up tight in the top of her bag, i wish i could've talked cause I would have told her that there were four men watching me and her.

I felt my case being tussled and in a snap I was taken by hands I did not know!

I am now lost in Mexico somewhere and I am very sad to be away from my mom and our friend!  What really hurts the most is that I cant be there to help her capture their humanitarian and musical adventures.

All things happen for a reason and the people that took me must need me more than she does, but I am still upset to be separated so suddenly, it will all be very different now….

I know I will be ok but I hope that she will have another me asap!!! Maybe if you are reading this you can help….

 

What We Need

Canon rebel t41 body- $849.00 http://www.adorama.com/ICAT4I.html?j=Email060812Canon&utm_term=Other&utm_medium=Email&utm_campaign=Email060812Canon&utm_source=ET

50mm lens - $110.00 http://www.adorama.com/CA5018AFWB.html

Battery Pack - $139.00 http://www.adorama.com/ICABGE5.html

A total of $1,098 is needed to replace my gear. The campaign is for $1,200 to cover fees that indie go go charges.

 

The Impact

Everything I do is documented, you will give me that ability back.

Currently I am in Mexico to implement workshops in the Mayan village of Yokdzonot and will be headed over to Guatamala to do the same. My time frame for this campaign is limited and as of now I will be documenting everything for this Fighting For Futures endeavor with my iphone4.

Starting July 17, 2012 I am with the Bring it Back Stage on the Vans Warped tour as an official media rep and workshop coordinator with FFF. This project cannot happen without a camera.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! 

If you would like to see the work that has been done in the past three years with the Canon Rebel please visit one of three sites.

www.fightingforfutures.org - Humanitarian endeavors.

www.fcgetsit.com - Most celebrated photo and video of various sorts.

www.youtube.com/feleciacruz - All video.

story:
Our Story

The Semi-Permanent Autonomous Zone (aka the S.P.A.Z. collective) has been organizing social events, community spaces, free festivals, art happenings and more for nearly 20 years. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, we've also traveled around the United States, Europe, and Asia creating unique situations for people to come together and experience art and music in a liberated social environment. We roll in diesel buses that we've converted to run on recycled vegetable oil, and we're equipped to transform any space into a vibrant, stimulating, living, breathing social sculpture. Our crew is made up of multi-talented creative individuals with a combined skill set ranging from bus mechanics and sound design to textile arts, and circus skills. We haven't done a proper tour in a few years and we're eager to share what we've been up to in the Bay Area with people far and wide. To get back into the swing, we've decided to organize a West Coast mini-tour this summer, beginning in mid-july.  We'll travel from the Bay Area northwards visiting towns, cities, and isolated rural areas setting up art and music environments, children's art workshops,independent film screenings, dance parties, and more....

 

The Impact

What we do has been known to raise peoples spirits, inspire action, and plant the seeds of possibilities...

What We Need & What You Get

If we raise our full target amount, we'll buy a new diesel coach, do a full vegetable oil fuel conversion and build out the interior to accommodate our crew and equipment. Our current bus is great and can do the job, but it's been on the road with us now for over 10 years and many cross-country missions. It's getting more expensive and time-consuming to keep it roadworthy and safe, and we'd like to focus our energy on our creative work.  Any funds left over will be used to maintain the vehicle on tour, buy art supplies and materials for installations and workshops, and feed the crew. A fully-funded tour will also allow us to do mostly free events...

Other Ways You Can Help

Please visit our website and explore what we've been up to, download free music, and contribute.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

  • We are seeking to earn 4000 dollars to fund the urchase of a hearse, and the cost of living for a United States tour of the OhYesYo Team.
  • We have perk options available from 5 dollars! From yoyos, to skateboard decks and more!
  • Even if you purchase an item from us, and we do not reach our goal the funds will still be put towards the purchase of a Hearse and the costs of a tour

The Impact

  • Funding this project will give people around the country the chance to meet and yoyo with Coffin, Meep, and other OhYesYo Team memebers. 
  • This project will also open up the ability for OhYesYo to tour schools, and present yoyo shows to them.
  • OhYesYo has a proven track record of producing fun, unique yoyos that people around the world enjoy playing with.

Risks & Challenges

OhYesYo is already a successful brand. We have 6 produced yoyos under the OhYesYo name, and 4 yoyos released via collaboration with other companies. 

  • The fact that we are already a successful brand does not mean we are immune from failure, but, it does make the odds of a total campaign failure minuscule 
  • if costs of production rise, we may not be able to produce the yoyos or products for the quoted price, reducing the amount of your money that goes to fund the actual Hearse purchase.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute, dont worry! their are other ways to help!

  • Spread the word on social media! all advertisement for this project is appreciated

The fact that we are already a successful brand does not mean we are immune from failure, but, it does make the odds of a total campaign failure minuscule 
if costs of production rise, we may not be able to produce the yoyos or products for the quoted price, reducing the amount of your money that goes to fund the actual Hearse purchase.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you cant contribute, dont worry! their are other ways to help!
Spread the word on social media! all advertisement for this project is appreciated

story:
As the most recent wave of Covid intensifies, independent wrestlers are facing uncertainty as shows are cancelled and bookings disappear....   As we approach the Holiday season, these Wrestlers once again need your help, and we are asking for your support!

100% Your donation will go directly to the wrestlers. On December 5th GCW's highly anticipated debut in Las Vegas will no longer take place, but the show goes on without an audience from a new location.....

Slime Season will eminate from the GCW performance center and will stream LIVE!  on Game Changer Wresrlings YOUTUBE page!! 

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME AND SUPPORT!

story:
We want to introduce you to a new local initiative - New Orleans Independent Fashion is an emerging collective of fashion designers, entrepreneurs and professionals in the New Orleans Area.  Our mission is to uplift and support local fashion designers while also creating economic opportunities and avenues to connect with local buyers.

We are currently planning a series of three events culminating in our first showcase to present at the Happyland Theater in the Bywater on Thursday, October 24 and need your support to make this evening memorable.

We are seeking bold businesses and individuals to support our first showcase so that we can build a network of designers, buyers and industry professionals in the Gulf South Region. Our long-term vision is to bring attention to New Orleans as a center for fashion innovation. In the meantime, we need your support to begin this process, and an evening of fun and enchantment is the best start we can imagine.

 

Our first presentation will exhibit ten emerging and established designers in New Orleans.  We will feature the designs of:

Maria Sandhammer

Cree McCree

Corinne Margaret Fibers

Calamity

EKS

Howlpop

and more!

There are so many incredible designers based in New Orleans using ingenious methods in circularity and upcycling and intriguing design techniques, however there is yet to exist a platform to present these designs. Our goal with this first installment is to bring designers and buyers together for an organized and engaging presentation. Local MC Chris Lane will guide the evening, while a group of musicians led by musical director Justin Peake will provide runway music. Our night will be highlighted by local performers, and we will open our designers market after the show!

In leading up to the date of the event, we are planning two smaller events to promote the Showcase October 24.  We are hosting a free clothing swap at the Happyland Theater September 26 from 6-9 PM. Attendees can bring their gently used clothing and we will create a “store” where people can trade for other items.  We have partnered with the Music Box Market and will do a preview of our runway show as well as have an informational booth at their October 13 market.
 

We are working with photographer Chris Granger to create a stunning editorial featuring work from each of our designers and pieces from local boutiques, backdropped by New Orleans’ uniquely beautiful landscape.  These photographs will be shared with the designers, models, and crew to promote their own work as well as the showcase. Many of those on our team have national and international reach within their social networks. 

We are aiming to keep the cost for designers and audience low - we are charging $25 application fee for our designers and $10 for general admission/$25 VIP for our audience.  We want to keep our cost barrier low to eliminate any restrictions on participation or attendance. Rather than spend money on an entrance fee, we want our audience to spend their money on purchasing our designers’ products!  

Which is why we need your support now!  We have partnered with New Orleans Airlift as our fiscal sponsor so that each donation is tax-deductible.  Please request a letter for your deduction by e-mailing neworleansindependentfashion@gmail.com with your receipt and we will provide that information.

Thank you and we hope you will join us in creating a magical evening !

 

What We Need

Your contribution will help us pay professional rates for:

Photographer

Musicians

Sound & Lighting Engineer(s)

Hair & make up

Models

Offset costs for Spring 2020 production

Staff

The Impact

The global fashion industry is one of the largest contributors to pollution and climate change.  By supporting and uplifting local designers, makers and professionals with our fashion choices we are collectively making steps towards building a better future.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We're also seeking volunteers!! We need extra hands for:

  • Spreading the word about our events!
  • Volunteers to take slots at our information booths October 12 (at the Piety Market) and October 13 (Music Box Market)
